name: Bag o' Dicks
description: Free spirited camp with good beats, booze, and the friendliest bag o' dicks around! Look for the big LED dicks in the sky and come say hi. A bag o' dicks isn't always a bad thing, come check out our dicks and judge for yourself.  Come warm up your dick by our bonfire most nights or early mornings as well!
landmark: 3 neon dicks in the sky with sparkly come shots

name: Pussy Day Spa
description: If there is one "must do" at Burning Man, it's a visit to the Pussy Day Spa. We offer a choice of refreshing body wash and pussy massage including happy ending. What's not to like? Pleasure and bliss awaits as we pamper and delight you. Your boundaries will be respected, your feedback / adjustments encouraged, and your wishes fulfilled. We guarantee it will be the best experience you will ever have at Burning Man, or anywhere else. Open daily from 1 to 5 pm, we take reservations (recommended) as well as walk-ins.
landmark: Pussy Day Spa sign

name: Camp ASL Support Services HUB
hometown: All over, north, and, South America
description: American sign language Support services. Centralized services for the Deaf.
landmark: "American sign language support services" sign

name: Casa de la Rumba
description:
The most magical prohibition era Casino where you can come and try our whimsical cocktails while trying your luck at our roulette or Blackjack table all under our glorious circus tent.

Come get some rumba to our Casa. Celebrate sharing, life, and try your luck in our little casino. You can come and bet whatever you have on you and we will match it up.

Be prepared to walk in a different time and space once you step into our 20s Casino. There will be a smile in your face when you leve. Guaranteed or we give your money back!
landmark: Huge lighted CASINO letters

name: Twisted
description: Twisted Camp is a vibrant gathering space where creativity, connection, and community come to life. Our camp features a welcoming bar with mixologists (you never know what drink concoction we might have!), a cozy coffee station, and a lively atmosphere with music by DJ Tokenoshi. Expect a mix of interactive experiences, social spaces, and spontaneous fun. Our setup includes a well-lit bar, plush seating, bike racks, and unique art installations. No matter where we land on the playa, we are here to bring good vibes, great conversations, and unforgettable moments. Follow the twisted lights and join the fun.
landmark: Large Twisted sign flagpole

name: Chariot Project
description: Injured? Have a footsie-oopsie-daisy? Fear not! Chariot Project has a rainbow fleet for hurt feet. Our pedal-powered mobility carts are available for checkout by the day to attach to your own bike. While you are here you can explore our collection of canes, orthopedic boots, knee braces, and more to help you on your healing journey.
landmark: Yellow Flags and Bike Chariots

name: Chair Camp
description: The Dusty, cozy-as-can-be living room with room for all of our Chair, automan, and TV people. Chair Camp is proud to be on playa for the fourth year, with 6 mutant vehicles and a 24/7 lounge-pad for when we're done stomping around deep playa + giving lifts to our burner neighbors and off adventuring. Cold beverages and warm, cozy hangs? Purrr.
landmark: the orange glow string lights that mimick a flames

name: Camp Bird of Paradise
description:
Camp Bird of Paradise will have a prominent banner across the front of our permanent large community shade structure which reads 
"Camp Bird of Paradise"
landmark: A banner sign which reads Camp Bird of Paradise.

name: Camp Pendant
description: Welcome one and all! Come by and decorate one of this year's pendants or pick-up a "BURNER" bike license plate. Rest your weary feet and tell us about your year. Place yourself on the world map. Be sure to check out the day's swag on our gifting tree. Whether you take a little something or leave a little something, it's here to make everyone's day a little brighter.
landmark: Painted backdrops of famous art. 9 long Pennants.

name: The Sound Garden
description: We are a high vibe sound camp here to delight your senses with a unique 360 degree sound system that will blow your mind. By night we bring you some of the most talented DJ's and artists to create an unforgettable experience of movement, sound and performance. By day we host sound healings, deep house yoga, and listening parties of your favorite artists. We also offer body work, and a few healing  workshops in our Garden Lounges
landmark: Large White enclosed HEX Tent & Sound Garden Sign

name: The Airship
description: The Airship is a steampunk inspired bar camp that's returning to the Playa for our second year. Our little crew of miscreants, scoundrels, and artists want to gift some fun and frivolity to the Playa in the form of themed bar night and a lounge for relaxing!
landmark: Airship sign and lights

name: Orgy Bus Camp
description: Orgy Bus Camp provides a safe and clean space for poly play parties on the playa. All of our parties have an opening ceremony where we practice consent and boundaries, as well as a fun and interactive opportunity to meet other guests. Our parties are at 3 PM and 11 PM daily.
landmark: Kissing Booth and Purple RV

name: El Tesoro
description: "The Treasure" of the Playa. A place to rest your weary soles (punny), have a nice cold beer, and engage in meaningful conversation.  Open most of the day/night all week long.
landmark: Nevada state shaped lighted sign

name: Khaleeya
description: Come immerse yourself in a world of Moroccan bliss at Khaleeya (formerly TeaHive)â€”where the hive thrives in harmony.
landmark: Bell tent and Khaleeya sign

name: Ludus Symposium
description: Ludus (playful love) Symposium (Meeting for music, drinking and intellectual discussion) is a place to hang out on our friendly deck/bar above the playa and watch cheezy cult movies.
landmark: Colorful Ohm flags

name: Duane's Whirld
description:
DuanesWhirld is enjoying our 19th consecutive year en Playa, with many of our campers trekking from Vermont.

Our camp supports the mutant vehicle Fluffy -- accessible public transit masquerading as a cloud wafting across the playa. A wheelchair lift and Braille rails accommodate that many more Burners into the artcar experience.

We enjoy mass-gifting our fellow Burners with Deep Playa Beer Delivery (quenching the late afternoon thirst in the heat) and 'Smores (late nights in deep playa to ease the chill with warm gooey treats.) Each of those gatherings generates micro-community among those Burners brought together. Look for Fluffy!!
landmark: "Duane's Whirld" faux realtor sign on the street

name: Sepia Lux Homebase
description: Come find the Cuttlefish (and Flash the Tortoise) back at their lair and say hi!
landmark: Inflatable Cuttlefish

name: Frybread and Friends
description: Stop by and share Frybread treats and relax in our lounge area open bar  Throw axes at our ax throwing targets .also feature non alcoholic drinks.
landmark: Banner Frybread and Friends

name: Camp Balagan
description: Balagan Camp exists to create a playful, soulful, and immersive Moroccan desert experience rooted in music, connection, and creativity. "Balagan" is a joyful chaos â€” we embrace that spirit with curated sonic journeys, shared rituals, and a warm, open atmosphere for self-expression and cultural fusion.
landmark: Look for a flag BALAGAN CAMP WITH A LIHGT ON IT

name: Cult of the Magic Lady
description:
Come to our Cult, we have snacks!  The snacks are babies, but don't worry, they are alcoholic.  We also have a church, for your physical wellbeing and personal gains.  And we feed on your shame.  

We also have a library.
landmark: Cult of the Magic Lady sign

name: Children of Chaos
description: Children of Chaos, established in 2000, is returning to the playa!  Join our Gold Parade, have your fortune told, stop by our conversation bar and have a drink and a chat!  Our campers hail from Reno, Portland, Seattle, San Francisco, Denver, and Houston.
landmark: Orange-decorated bar, "Children of Chaos" flags

name: Planned Playahood
description: We offer "second aid" services including contraceptives, pregnancy tests, and hygiene products and a Menstruation Station to help you stock up on your needs. Pay homage to Our Lady of the Shaven Beaver, where you can experience your playa rebirth. Visit our bar The Rusty Speculum for your daily speculum shot and themed cocktails, stop by our photo booth, climb our tower or use the couch swing, get a faux-scription from our camp 'doctors' for whatever ails you, or mix up your playa wardrobe at our costume exchange. Visit The Museum of Dildonts (items you don't want to put in your body), or stop by for daily events, parties, DJs, & a shaded dance floor that just won't quit. We have it all to Un-Fuck your Burn!
landmark: tower with Planned Playahood logo & couch swing!

name: Knot Sure
description: Come to Knot Sure and play our spinning wheel game hang out or get a decorative rope top.
landmark: Look for our big camp sign that says Knot Sure

name: Duty Free
description:
Dutyfree Camp is a welcoming space for art, music, and community. Our Bedouin-style lounge offers shade and sound meditations, while our mutant vehicle brings energy to the playa.

We host the White Shabbat Dinner, serving 550-1,000 guests, and gift food, drinks, and connection. With a kitchen, dining tent, and thoughtful design, we create unforgettable moments. Join the family!
landmark: Black tent / red light at night / cheeky iguana

name: HAPPINESS AND JOY TOUR MASSAGE
description: We have been all over the world spreading the message, and here the message is MASSAGE! Our name says it all. Come by in the middleÂ of the day - it's too cold at night and too hung over in the morning.
landmark: MASSAGE upright feather signs

name: Camp Morning Wood
description: Welcome to Camp Morning Wood! Which is, quite simply, your friendly, neighborhood, summer camp-themed, saloon. Starting fresh each morning at 10:00 a.m. to "Eye of the Tiger" we're there to motivate the neighborhood, to attack a new day (after licking our wounds from the night before). CMW is ready to greet you with a smile, music, dancing, or maybe just a view of the city from our raised platform. From sunrise to sunset (and beyond), you can almost always pull up a barstool for some friendly conversation, and an ice cold (hard or soft) beverage.
landmark: Wooden log entry site "Camp Morning Wood"

name: Camp Zoombox
description: A giant boombox and some rad people
landmark: Giant boom box

name: Dancing Cat
description: Dancing Cat Wine Bar! Where there's alittle something for everyone!
landmark: Large black dome with 2 silver domes beside it.

name: High Desert Cinema
description: Movie Night! 8:00pm Hot Buttered popcorn & theater candy! Come hang out!
landmark: Large lit up marquee -  High Desert Cinema

name: Jipangu/Bijou Boutique
description: Come visit us for Japanese sake (21+) and drop-in jewelry making workshops. There is also a Boutique to select or share a special piece of jewelry.
landmark: large Bijou Boutique banner

name: Pickleback Oasis
description: Take a break from the hot sun and stop in for a cold Pickleback. Relax and meet new friends under our shade structure.
landmark: 20x30 w/black wind screen side walls. Lit at night

name: Pablo's Crusty Creatives
description: We are Pablo's Crusty Creatives! We are a small camp dedicated to bringing cool interactive art to the playa.
landmark: Sign that says "Pablo's Crusty Creatives"

name: SYMBIO
description: Symbio is a Burning Man camp built on the essence of symbiosisâ€”a close-knit family of Playa-loving souls who support and uplift one another. Rooted in connection, collaboration, and radical self-expression, we create a welcoming home for our community while fueling the journey of our beloved mutant vehicle, Dirty Owl. More than just a camp, Symbio is a dynamic fusion of energy, creativity, and support, embodying the magic of the Playa through shared experiences and unforgettable adventures.
landmark: A lit up cuddle puddle with oriental rugs

name: Snuggle Shuttle
description: Step into our Middle eastern-inspired oasis, where we offer a welcoming space to unwind, connect, and experience culture. Join us for daily tea service from 2-4 PM, where we serve authentic Middle Eastern teas in a cozy, shaded lounge. In the evenings, our space transforms into a vibrant gathering spot from 6-10 PM, featuring music, ambient lighting, and a relaxing atmosphere. Whether you're sipping tea, lounging in our snuggle area, or engaging in conversation, our camp is a sanctuary of hospitality and community in the heart of Black Rock City.
landmark: Middle eastern-inspired oasis

name: Nomad Collective
description: Nomad Collective Camp is a sanctuary for those who live and thrive through music. Born from a passion for electronic sound and deep connection, our camp creates an immersive space where beats and community blend seamlessly. We welcome both seasoned Burners and first-time dreamers, fostering creativity, self-expression, and unforgettable sonic journeys. As our family grows, so does our commitment to sharing music that moves the soul and unites the dancefloor. Join us in celebrating the rhythm of the playa, where every note tells a story.
landmark: The frontage of the camp will feature a Big Sign

name: OHM HOME
description: We are a mutant vehicle support camp. Home of Ohm Kar, Manta and Vibe Apple. Come n boogie. Take the ride.
landmark: Black and white Ohm Home flags.

name: Wake N Bake
description: Rise and shine at our Wake Pyramid with morning yoga and ice-cold brews to get your body moving and your mind buzzing! Then, slide over to the Bake Pyramid, where you can bake some tasty treats and chill with some like minded people!
landmark: two side by side pyramids with Wake & Bake signs

name: LAF Lazy-Ass Fuckers
description: Come walk through the history of Playa SWAG at The Playa Artifact Museum! We provide a look into past pins, posters, tickets and more, highlighting decades of creativity at the Burn.  We host workshops with new artists and friends from years past. All are welcome!
landmark: Playa Artifact Museum and Lazy Ass Fuckers Sign

name: Brainy Bar
description: A neighborhood dive bar that welcomes dreamers, schemers, and big thinkers. Come share ideas with like-minded individuals. Schedules and activities will be posted out front. Time travelers welcome.
landmark: Brainy Bar Sign and red/yellow flags

name: Birth-Day Camp
description:
Get ready to jam and jive because your Birth-Day is about to get a whole lot groovier! We're throwing the ultimate party featuring the iconic hits from the '70s, '80s, and '90s, perfect for unleashing your Radical Self-Expression! ðŸ’ƒðŸ•º Dash to our bar for your special Birth-Day Vodka shot and a surprise gift. Show up in your Birth-Day suit, and you'll score a double shot or even TWO gifts! 
Join us for some wild fun with gamesâ€”all while boogieing to the tunes from Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday! 

And don't miss out on an electrifying Neon lights Birth-Day bash Friday night! Put on your most fabulous outfit, and stand a chance to win an awesome prize for best dressed! Let's make this Birth-Day one for the record books!
landmark: 3 inflatable 6 foot birthday cakes

name: CocoDisco
description:
CocoDisco is your playa home for....well...coconuts and disco. Stop by Tuesday afternoon for a cold coconut, tropical vibes, and an epic dance party. Or Wednesday for a full dim sum brunch.

The CocoDisco lounge is also open 24/7 when you just need a little time at the beach.
landmark: Coconut in a disco ball

name: MISFITS MMXXV
description:
This year the Mystical Misfits celebrate 22 years on Playa.  
We will be providing the beautiful Narwhal as a stationary stage for Performances, DJs, and a shaded rest spot for Burners.
We plan to have Daily events on the Narwhal during the day and evening.
We will also have the Boobs & Berries Bar. Seeing refreshments to Participate everyday at Happy Hour. They will also have DJs scheduled everyday.
This year we will also have a "Chill Out" dome for Participants to get out of the weather and just chill.
landmark: The Narwhal.  A stage built like a Narwhal.

name: Guerrilla Cheese Camp
description: Bay Area Food Camp serving lunch Monday through Thursday. Hot quesadillas, cold beer (ID required) & lemonade.   Be sure to get your hot ass stamped at our ass branding corral too!
landmark: GUERRILLA CHEESE CAMP & ASS BRANDING signs

name: Camp Gotalotgoinon
description: A collective of doers and artist that want to create a collaborative art space to share with others. Creating together and experiencing multi-sensory art that inspires connection and growth. Come play games, solve a puzzle, get your dance on, add to the collaborative string art or come relax and take it all in at the Fog tub. Whoever and whatever you create is art and we look forward to sharing ours with you and experiencing yours.
landmark: Large camp sign and giant Teddy Bears

name: Send Noods
description: Want to send a unique one of a kind NoodleGram? Get crafty and dive into our pool of noodles to make your masterpiece which we will hand deliver to your loved one in BRC. Limited time only, come join our team of couriers, and experience the joy of engaging in new connections! Let us give you a safe(to the third powa) space to radically express yourself and show you what immediacy is all about! If that's not your cup of tea then just join us in a hot steamy bowl of Noods in our stretchy yoga classes!
landmark: green Send Noods vinyl sign trampoline porch swing

name: Camp Orange Heart
description: We are a fourth year theme camp - Camp Orange Heart. Our camp is founded on the principles of unconditional love, mutual respect, honesty, trust, and transparency. Our goal is to provide a deeper intimacy among all human beings with respect to the eight types of intimacy and a mocktail bar for burners. No drama type of camp - only love, respect, and radical acceptance!
landmark: Camp Orange Heart Flags

name: Disco Ballz
description: Disco Ballz is your place to come for Disco Dancing the night away.  Don't miss our Big Thursday Night Disco Dance Party.  Come by for Coffee & Donuts or enjoy a drink at our Shitty Bar.
landmark: Shade Structure with DISCO BALLZ flags flying

name: Playa Penthouse
description: Elevated, restful, shady platform, from which to view the entire Playa. Lively discussions about life and relationships. Coffee in the mornings, cocktails in the evenings. Dance parties day and night. Our interior chill space/playpen is perfect midday or midnight. People from all over the world come to share experiences or simply enjoy our view in silence. "Our view doesn't suck"! We are the home of the Eros Tangier. Informal discussions all week on topics as varied and vital as "Living The 10 Principles", "Couples Communication", "Self-acceptance in sexual transition", "Finding a safe space for partners to express and discuss fantasies" and "We Love You! Do not fear".
landmark: Tall scaffold tower with the Man Head lamps

name: Wild Child
description:
Run away to our circus community, hosted by world class artists, where every day is filled with workshops designed to ignite your passion for performance.

Dive into the world of partner acrobatics, master the art of flow props, explore the freedom of parkour, and unleash your creativity with tricking sessions. 

Whether you're a seasoned performer or curious beginner our inclusive community welcomes all skill levels.

Join us for an unforgettable circus adventure.
landmark: Big black "Wild Child" flag

name: Camp VRC
description: Camp VRC is about capturing and sharing the Burning Man experience beyond the playa by means of immersive 360 D virtual reality (VR) footage. Lose yourself in past year's VR experiences or jump in and help us build a global network to carry the impact beyond the playa. Monday to Saturday, 3-5pm, at the yellow short schoolbus. Also, you might find us POP-UP, to show footage, at other busy events throughout the playa.
landmark: Yellow Short School Bus and Camp VRC sign

name: Better Next Year
landmark: high flying orange windsock

name: A-PLAYA-MASK
description: Breathe easy with the Maskman's quality N-95 Dusk Masks with the non toxic psychedelic Burning Man logo. And don't forget our Breathe Easy nose plugs, BM Stickers, and Pins.
landmark: Day Glow A-PLAYA-MASK sign with masked mannequin

name: Camp Seem to Leave
landmark: geodesic hammocks

name: Dusty Speakeasy and Sanctuary
description:
1920's Speakeasy travels thru time to find itself on a dusty playa. Provide the password "Tomorrow Today" to enter down a dark hallway, up the stairs, then back down to a hidden speakeasy. Enjoy a refreshing drinks like Bees Knees and moonshine. Come show off your Burlesque talents on our stage.  Theme days to include Gatsby Gala Wed white party.
If Sanctuary is what you seek, find our cool hidden oasis, full of hydration, snacks, personal care, conversation and connection.
landmark: Dusty Speakeasy and Sanctuary sign w red lights

name: Lands Beyond
description: Lands Beyond is a haven for strivers and adventurers always seeking the unknown. We help you break through barriers and reach outside your comfort zone to attain your higher self. A globally-minded camp with Mexican flair, come join us for tasty micheladas and all-day aguas frescas inside our cosmic neon-lit dome. Ecstatic dance, breathwork, dynamic meditation, and cacao ceremonies are also on the menu. Come for the fluorescent cosmic crÃ¨pes and refreshing micheladas, stay for our black-light Day of the Dead party!
landmark: 30-foot dome of neon-lit multicolored triangles

name: Rocket 'n Roll
description: Rocket 'n Roll mutant vehicle support camp
landmark: Old West Jail next to the Rocket 'n Roll MV

name: Southern Discomfort
description: Welcome to Southern Discomfort, where we bring a slice of charm to the eclectic desert landscape of Burning Man. Join us as we invite you to indulge in the ultimate fusion of down-home hospitality and radical self-expression. Prepare to be transported to a realm where Awful Waffle and Hillbilly Ice Tea parties redefine the notion of fun and festivities under the scorching sun.
landmark: A Lit Dead Opposum sign saying Southern Discomfort

name: Vault 21+
description:
Vault 21+ invites you to step into our 23-hour-a-day dive barâ€”that's right, 23 hours. If you're roaming the wasteland and thirsting for a drink, there's a good chance we're openâ€¦ unless it's sunrise. In that case, take a moment to soak in the irradiated sunrise, then return when the time is right. We'll still be here, with a cold drink waiting for you.

This week, we've got a killer lineup of events, including Karaoke (for those brave enough to sing), themed parties (brace yourself for chaos), and food giveaways (because who doesn't love free rations?). Stop by, grab a drink, cool off in the heat, and kick back. All these activities come with a soundscape of non-stop, certified, vault-approved tunes to set the mood.

We can't wait to welcome your dusty, smiling faces into our vault.
landmark: Vault door,  Shade w/blue and yellow flags

name: Wild Free Spirit
description: The Wild Free Spirit Camp is an immersive art experience set inside a large motorhome with seating and immersive lighting. The general welcoming area will be lit with lighting and seating. The immersive art experience and general welcoming areas are open to all ages
landmark: large motorhome with bright psychedelic art

name: Grilled Cheese Experiment
description: Serving gooey grilled cheese realness, the One Sin Spa, and Literal Table Flipping to fine creatures of Black Rock City!
landmark: Giant Rainbow flag, with LEDs at night

name: Pussy Avalanche
description: In spite of what degenerates might think on first read - Pussy Avalanche is all about cats.  Like cats, games, books, or dorky references?  Welcome home.
landmark: Convenience store w/clothes and public couches

name: Pandora's Lounge & Fix-it Shoppe
description:
Our camp keeps our fellow Burners biking: our repair shop offers education, tools and parts, for bike repair. Actually we'll help you repair just about anything, but bikes are our specialty. We also love to mix drinks and host visitors in our adjacent lounge.

Bike repair is our specialty, we will teach you to do your repair. We are open 24 hrs a day. We have a bar and lounge to make life easier.
landmark: Large Red Arrow that is lit at night

name: Penny Smashing Point
description: Our custom pressed penny machine turns ordinary pennies into unique BM souvenirs.
landmark: Red bricks gates /arch

name: Abraxas Camp
description:
Abraxas Dragon has been on playa since 2006, providing incredible music, art and vibes.

Abraxas has a history of being one of the most recognizable and photogenic art cars on the playa. We believe that art car magic can be created with dedication, commitment and basic tools and supplies. We live this dream and aspire to show burners that they can too.
landmark: Abraxas Mailbox ~ orange gold with black ABRAXAS

name: noMADart
description:
noMADart Camp one of few Family Friendly camps that offer daily renewable art project where you can make a gift, memory and connection all in one stop. 
Dusty Hugs
landmark: Dusty Fish and noMADart banners

name: Awesomesauce
description: We are a Unicorn ranch decorated in bright fuchsia pink, lights and unicorns. We run an afternoon and early evening bar, called The unStable, with daily events, and serve our unique 'Unicorn Tears' drinks. We also have Awesomeball - large inflatable Zorb balls people can climb in and bash against each other.
landmark: Big pink playing field and pink frontage

name: Black Rock City Welding & Repair
description: Welding, repair, adjustment and general tinkering help. Come on over to use our tools to repair your stuff or get our help repairing what's broken.  We repair bikes and all sorts of other things.  Enjoy an adult or NA beverage at the Crowbar - our shaded walk up and sit down Bar.
landmark: 10' foot high large shade area and bright sarongs

name: Camp Cosmo
description: Welcome to Camp Cosmo! We are a tribe of global citizens who come together to create a Cosmopolitan playground. We have karaoke on Tuesday and Thursday from 2-4pm .On Monday Wednesday Friday from 2-4pm we host "Bring Your Cup We Have The Hat- English High Tea", pastries are served and polaroid photos are taken to capture your moment! You won't find anything else like our "Eastern well-blended into Western" vibe on the playa, so come and join us!
landmark: Camp Cosmo flag

name: Jail of Hedone
description: A large Old Western wooden-fronted enclosed space with air conditioning & cooling misters. This JAIL evokes Hedone, the Goddess of Sensual Pleasure and so, is stocked with cots, giant pillows and couches; snacks, water, cold beer & drinks (including our signature Absinthe-Whiskey craft cocktail) along with a stripper pole, whips & ticklers, great music, the occasional foot bath, along with sporty fun on the side.  Come be judged and whipped and relax in A/C with the playa's only Whiskey/Absinthe cocktail!
landmark: "JAIL OF HEDONE" signs in front of a western bar

name: Gypsy Monkey Carnival
description:
Gypsy Nebula Carnival welcomes you!
Eat some Gourmet cotton candy, adopt a mutant monkey, play games, and win prizes. You can ride the biggest cock on the playa. The Gypsy Nebula Carnival lounge is shady during the day and black-lighted at night and always welcomes the weary traveler to rest and enjoy our ambiance and snark.
landmark: 20' tall Madam Zelda with her welcoming embrace.

name: Kamp Suckie Fuckaye
description: Kamp Suckie Fuckaye emerges from the dust as a carnival of primal fire and shadowed performance. This dark circus camp invites wanderers to cross the threshold into a realm where reality bends and conventional boundaries dissolve.
landmark: Lit Kamp Suckie Fuckaye sign and LED lined camp

name: IKIGAI
description: We all hail from different countries and cultures around the world but we all share the lifelong pursuit of finding one's Ikigai, or reason for being. Our camp's reason for being is togetherness and collective belonging ignited by disco and the power of dance. We strive to foster radical self-expression, reconnect with our inner child, heal the spirit, and encourage everyone to live boldly in the here and now.
landmark: Large IKIGAI sign with lights

name: Camp DIY
description: Camp DIY offers daily Agua Fresca (non-alcoholic) refreshments Monday to Friday of Burn Week. We also have crafty supplies for you to "Pimp Your Cup".
landmark: 12' tall "Camp DIY" sign.

name: Orgasmic Smoothies
description: We are offering a reTREAT from the heat and dust. Cume get your fresh made vegan smoothies.
landmark: Large hanging camp name sign in LED.

name: Tiki Bar & Hammocks
description: Tiki Bar & Hammock â€“  bring your thirsty lips over to enjoy a fresh cool island drink or Kava tea and visit and connect with neighbors and fellow burners.  Share all your great stories "this one time, at burning manâ€¦!"  Get some advice if you are new to burning man, and of course, swing in our hammocks with us or relax on our sofas and stools in the shade!
landmark: Tiki bar and Big metal structure with hammocks

name: Lucid Dreams
description: Lucid Dreams is all about dreaming. Come and relax with some tea and snacks in our wonderland tea party, and if you dare, explore down the rabbit hole into our immersive 360-degree projection experience.  With different themes throughout the week, come visit us at different points to experience different environments and emotions as we take you to another dream state.  Within the tea dome, chat with fellow burners about your dreams and what it takes to truly lucid dream.
landmark: Two domes with bike racks and Lucid Dreams sign.

name: The Friend Zone
description:
Welcome to the Friend Zone! A place where no one will fuck you.
This camp is all about friendship. No need to worry about trying to hook up because platonic love is all that's on the menu. We'll be hosting lip snyc battles, a low key dance party, and a coffee interaction.  We'll also be hosting a golden girls photo op.
Be sure to participate in our pen pal exchange program and make a new burner friend from the Midwest.
Stop by and make friends, see friends, be friends!
landmark: 11 foot tall Rainbow of 11 feather flags

name: Best Year Yet
description: Providing the best hot drip coffee on playa every morning. Come enjoy a cup of Joe, a game of cribbage (or learn cribbage) and pay a visit to our magical gaseous zucchini king, Zucczilla!
landmark: Best Year Yet sign and zucchini

name: Lily Pad Lounge
description: Home of LilyPod support camp. Have support for other small art cars, particularly those based off golfcarts. Also salve and frog-related things.
landmark: Tall LED flagpole with Frog

name: Oral Fixation
description: Popsicles!! Come one, come all, to partake of our tantalizing treats!! Suckle your way through the pearly gates of bliss. We've doubled our offerings to maximize your oral pleasure. Don't miss out!!
landmark: Lips

name: Glamour + Shots
description: Glam, Bam, Thank you Fam! Become immortalized with a Burning Man style glamour photo!  Capture the moment.  Capture the Magic. Capture your face after a shot of something "strong."
landmark: Neon Glamour Shots Sign

name: Alter Ego
description: Camp ALTER EGO creates experiences through art that challenge and expand one's sense of self.
landmark: ALTER EGO sign and Black flags

name: Ataraxia
description: We're a safe space to: Chill. Laugh. Dance. Experience. Learn.
landmark: ATARAXIA signs & 100 LF of laser cut LED panels

name: F.U.Ego Stage Bar & Lounge
description: Camp Fuego hosts the F.U.EGO Bar, No Mercy Stage & VIP A/C Lounge, serving daily the playa's only bottomless ORGANIC SNOW CONES and hosting No Mercy karaoke parties, an open mic, and DJ'd dance parties. DJs and musicians welcomed to our stage! Choose any mixed drink, mocktail, spiked cone, cold craft beer or hard cider. No Mercy karaoke singers agree to be cut off at any time, for any reason, or no reason at all! A gong is standing by. Only truly amazing singers get to the end of a song. ALL PARTICIPANTS gain access to Fuego's VIP A/C Lounge! There you will sip top shelf booze in cool luxury. Look for Camp Fuego's namesake Art Installation, "Fuego", a life-sized stretched barbed-wire prancing HORSE with flame effects coming from her eyes and mane. Or lie in our coffin. And Eff Your Ego!
landmark: life-sized barbed wire horse w flames eyes & mane

name: Tower of Slackjaw
description: Tower of Slackjaw is one of the tallest climbable structures on the playa with the best views of the 3:00 sector and beyond.
landmark: 50 foot metal tower

name: The Wrong Neighborhood
description: Stay off our Lawn! And Drink Water! Also, watch your purse.
landmark: Trailer painted w/Heavy metal Mermaid, Metal Signs

name: Mycodelic Forest
description:
We are a mycologically based theme camp. We love mushrooms and all fungus related things!
Like the mycelium that connects the roots of the forest, the Mycodelic Forest serves to connect the humans that pass through it.
Come sit in our shade and have a cold home brew beer while listening to a wide variety of music. You may learn something!
landmark: Giant Mycodelic Forest Archway and Signage

name: RIPPERS ROW
description: Rippers Row is an immersive and interactive theme camp hosting daily parties with DJs playing a variety of tasty music. You're guaranteed a high energy shakedown on every Ripper dance floor. Home of the mythical GatorWalrus. Long May They Reign.
landmark: White tent with LED beacon.

name: Flying dildos
landmark: we have a black short bus called flying dildo

name: Bouillonaires Club
description: Boullionaires Club or doesn't rhyme with Bougie but it should. Stop in to see our hoard of dough and other delights
landmark: Parachute covered Geo-dome

name: Lucid Dream Hideout
description: A afternoon coffee bar to get the best iced coffee and Matcha on the Playa!  We have a live DJ, wi-fi and shade to sit and chill to share your amazing burner stories. Spin our Wheel of Misfortune for a fun experience and receive a memorable sticker to remember your amazing time with us!
landmark: Lucid Dream Hideout Banner

name: Vamp Camp
description: Burning since 94, one of the oldest camps on playa. We are mostly Battle Born burners whom take pride in Nevada. Enjoy playa lore whilst embibbing our signature Vamp Juice or a cup of joe. We have DJ's as well. Stop by, we do bite!
landmark: Vamp Camp sign in the center of frontage

name: Battle Box
description: Come try your hand at radio controlled robot carnage!   We supply the table top sized battlebot cage, robots, controllers, and a cheering section.  You bring your creativity and a friend (or enemy) to battle with. No friends? That's ok, we've got those too!
landmark: Camp BattleBox sign

name: KAHVE
description:
KAHVE (meaning cafÃ© in Turkish) is an Anatolian-inspired camp serving coffee from 10am-2pm as well as coffee ground readings. We are a stylistic sanctuary for wary travelers on their journey throughout the desert. Find shade among plush pillows, pithy lounges and Turkish lanterns. Enjoy the atmosphere and ambient music while admiring the intricate art pieces. Find a safe haven in one of our Bedouin-styled cabanas to relax and enjoy your beverage.

KAHVE is a sanctuary to provide relief from the hustle and bustle of the stimulating playa. Come by anytime you need a place to chill, relax, take a nap.. or briefly lose yourself in an Anatolian dream.
landmark: Backlit KAHVE sign and 4 illuminous wooden columns

name: Infinite Community
description: The Infinity Boxes are only active when shared and seek to bring you to awareness of your awareness. Minds are often blown and leave you in a state of astonishment and joy.
landmark: The Infinity Symbol on top of our installation

name: Oh Shit, Wrong Playa
description: Oh Shit, Wrong Playa is a bunch of lifeguard wannabes who showed up to the least beachy playa possible!  We support our new-to-playa mutant vehicle Endless Summer, a giant, mobile lifeguard tower dedicated to preventing drownings on playa and providing good times.  When we aren't out searching for drowning victims in the deep playa, join us at our camp for beach vibes and lifeguard parties!
landmark: giant lifeguard tower mutant vehicle

name: The Dusty Nuts Tavern
description: Escape the constant wub wub for something a little different, along with dusty drinks from dusty people.
landmark: Wooden bar with Dusty Nuts Tavern spraypainted

name: Dusty Booty Ranch
description: An outpost where misfits fit.
landmark: Scaffolding tower

name: Down Low Club
description: Host of annual LGBTQ+ MEET & GREET on Monday night since 2012, LITTLE BLACK DRESS PARTY on Tuesday evening and TV/MOVIE THEMED brunch on Thursday. Also, since 2009, hosting the 24/7 interactivity in our DOWN LOW CLUB TENT, providing a discreet, enclosed and air-conditioned space for erotic play between consenting 18+ adult men & male-identified individuals.
landmark: 16' DOWN LOW CLUB sign, GAY PRIDE sign, ARMY TENT

name: Zeta zone
description: The Zeta Zone, Art supporting camp for POD07 art installation, all around good camp
landmark: 12ft Shade over RVs

name: Wally's Cowboy Kitchen
description: Interactive cooking camp for people to learn camp cooking and have a hot meal. Great place to hang out.
landmark: Kitchen containing Dutch ovens.

name: Hakuna Matata
description:
Building art objects and art cars to light up the Playa Nocturnal Kaleidoscope!
Promoting mindful and safe cruising.                SLOW                              DOWN!!!
Leave No Trace )'(
landmark: 7'x10' wood LED wall "Hakuna Matata" & bikes racks

name: Treble Makers
description:
Long day on playa? With a daily wine, music, and cheese pairing at sunset, you'll be able to enjoy some of life's most indulgent pleasures. Our artists are grass-fed, our red wine is selected and served by beret-wearing french busboys, and we will show you the difference between cheese and fu**ng fromage.

If you want to get to the next level of indulgence come enjoy the somatic gyrations delivered to your weary core by the one-and-only Buffer Bush. Swing on by and we will help you hit that higher note, we got your back!
landmark: Big red and beige shade - poofer tower at night

name: Tarwater
description: Look for the mannequin caged in a travois:   There you'll find Lady S's Boutique, Cut throat Bowling, Choose Your Belief interaction, Time Capsules, miscellaneous games and the welcoming denizens of Tarwater. You'll also recognize us by the crusty old Rat Taxi, parked in front.
landmark: The mannequin in a travois

name: Foreskin
description: Camp Foreskin... not what you're thinking!  We provide facials throughout the week For Your Skin!  Great group of people just wanting to give back to our community.  Come chill with us anytime and you might be in for a skin-gasm.
landmark: tapestry out front "Foreskin...not what you think"

name: Camp Blowjob
description: Camp Blowjob is where you can let loose and get your leaf blown at Burning Man in a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity! We aim to provide a fun atmosphere where all are welcome!
landmark: flagpole illuminated with a "camp blowjob" flag

name: Don't Stop
description: Black Rock City is a place where small things can derail your day or night and we want to support our fellow burners by offering small necessities [ex. tampons, condoms, sunscreen, or glowy things] from our Don't Stop Gift Box, or a drink with inspired conversation.  Additionally, we offer opportunities to restore through Yoga and breathwork and learn how to repair your  bike.
landmark: White shade structure with the Don't Stop banner

name: Stoop
description: Serving top-shelf, neighborly vibes, Stoop is a place where you belong. Our art is hosting. Welcome home! We've created a place for neighbors to gather, share stories, express their art, and make new friends while sipping a delicious cocktail and eating a grilled cheese, blueberry pancake, or whatever we've got going on the grill.
landmark: Blue converted 22' box truck with blue shade

name: Bumpbed
description: Bumping those beats across the playa far and wide
landmark: Giant BumpBed labeled shade structure

name: Pollination Station
description: Pollination Station is a classroom camp with one goal: providing detailed information regarding the proper care, proliferation, and value of native pollinators including bees, butterflies, moths, birds, and bats...aided by the liberal application of honey-flavoured booze and sweet treats. Join us and support the 10 Principles through education and skill development!
landmark: LED flowers and fuzzy red shade structure supports

name: Hunty
description: Hunty is a camp of LGBTQ+, allies and people of color from across the landscape of California. Primarily consisting of veteran burners, most of whom are artists, Hunty is space for the creative minded to come together and flourish.
landmark: Multi Colored Tent & Hunty Sign

name: Ofosho
description: Good ramen, a great playa moment! Serving the ramen experience on the playa the last 12 years. Doodle or dance to deep house or minimal techno while you wait, noodlessly polaroid yourself or connect with 100s of fellow burners either noodling around or slurping an irresistible bowl of happiness (we have got you covered vegetarians!). Ofosho memorable!
landmark: Tower with "Ofosho" sign, and red ramen cart

name: Pig Nest
description:
We like to pig out and chill hard. 
And maybe get a little rowdy... mostly get rowdy.
landmark: Pentagonal wood structure with blue shade cloths

name: No Holes Barred Comedy Club
description:
Your favorite, out of this world hilarious comedians make their triumphant return! 

Brighten your day with Laugh Yoga, chill out in our giggle inducing Meditation Sessions, learn how to make friends and strangers laugh, and cry, in our variety of Story Telling and Stand Up Comedy Workshops, then test your new skills at Open Mic. Got beef with your campmates? Join us for "Judge Django" to argue your case and redeem your reputation! And of course, the main event! Every night! Laugh your butthole off at our Pro Stand Up Comedy Special! 

All Holes Welcome!
landmark: 15 ft tall orange and blue neon sign with smiley

name: Hiburnia
description: Serving delicious honey, Agave & Clove, infused hot Toddies at sunrise and sunset every day. Temple Builders Drink for Free
landmark: wooden bar that says hiburnia

name: M.E.L.T.
description: M.E.L.T.- Multiple Environments, Lounges and Terrariums-Our domes are a great place to hang out, meet people and relax if you just can't dance anymore or want to make new friends. You can rest and reflect in the Fairy Bower full of flowers, vines and the gentle tinkle of a waterfall, or get out of this world for a cosmic chill in the lively performance space of the Wormhole. Our domes are hosted, welcoming inclusive spaces to connect and inspire.
landmark: 2 large white domes right next to each other

name: Camp Wineaux
description: Come join Camp Wineaux for intimate and fun wine and spirit tasting experiences.  We will rock your palates with wine and spirits and challenge you during our popular blinded wine tasting events.  Don't miss our nighttime tasting extravaganza on Thursday night.
landmark: Large tent colorful curtains, blue/yellow banners

name: Hello Brooklyn
description: Hello Brooklyn is a vibrant and eclectic camp where urban cool meets whimsical creativity. Our Playa neighborhood combines the charm of Brooklyn with the playful flair of a Florida Panhandle trailer park. Visitors can explore diverse spaces like the Sunflower Temple, offering love and healing; Club Gosh, our inclusive dance venue with live DJ sets, karaoke, and Ecstatic Dance; and The SHAQ, hosting cookies, consent classes, body painting, and Sage's Sexploration seminar. With radical inclusion, spontaneity, and community spirit, we create a welcoming home filled with connection, creativity, and endless surprises.
landmark: Hello Brooklyn sign

name: Hot Noodz
landmark: Hot noods sign. Blue semi truck games and bars

name: BS BOOZE CRUZ
description: Slow water rafting on the Playa. Our camp includes the actual 24 barrel barge you will need and the characters that make up the crew. During the day, these characters will present off the wall instructional presentations.. Semi Pro DJ's will keep the vibe going under the sun but you can chill under the 40x40 shade structure. Choose your favorite float toy, some on top of coil springs, to rest your feet. At night the camp will feature a small campfire and 7pm to midnight music. Sit on our chairs and look at the stars under the blue camp lighting. The music theme will change daily. Of course we will serve at least one meal. It will be Elote, Mexican corn in a cup, on Tuesday. Bring your own spoon and cup.
landmark: Neon blue LED camp entrance sign w blue strobes.

name: Brand-Ur-Ass N More
description:
Brand-Ur-Ass N More will stimulate your entire being -- from your mind to your ass. Bare your butt in the "branding coral" and
get one of a number of  temporary brands. Belly up to our western saloon or find serenity in our daily group sound bath temple at 11am and hear the harmonic frequencies and allow your mind to wander. 
Find something/give something at the Giving Tree, hitch a ride on our mutant vehicles or stop by late night to hang around one of our public space fire pits/fire features. Come play with us!!!
landmark: Wood log branding corral

name: Camp Sand Mandala
description: Soju House serving multiple flavors of soju and cold barley tea, and tarot card readings with Burning Man-themed cards.
landmark: Blue-roofed, white-walled, Asian style house

name: Playa Party Patrol
description: We are a global community of artists, dreamers, doers, and travelers united by a love of music, charity and adventure. At Burning Man we operate the Pardywagon art car and assemble as the party patrol and spread love and fun together. We support small to mid named DJs and artists who deserve a highly visible platform to perform on. We are San Francisco, NYC, Las Vegas and Montreal based.
landmark: Pardywagon during the day

name: Camp O-Wow
description: Come and enter a snippet of London and gaze at the stars and play a game of checkers or croquet whist enjoying cool shade and great company. Also grab a stick and make a mouthwatering S'more!
landmark: We will have a Camp O-Wow Flag at the entrance

name: Harmonic Convergence Camp
description: Come by for our Welcome Pumaccinos on the first Sunday or Farewell Pumaccinos after the Temple Burn.  And if you're looking for a good party before the Man Burn, then stop by our College Football Tailgate & Viewing Party.  We will not have set hours as a cafe or healing center, but if you stop by, there's a good chance we'll serve you a cappuccino or set up an energy healing.
landmark: Harmonic Convergence Camp sign

name: Just Roll With It
description: Our life-sized board game returns to the playa! Join us as a live pawn and enjoy drinks, music, and prizes! All ages welcome.
landmark: Rainbow colored bike racks & white flag

name: DeMentha
description: Mojitos, mist & dancing served up with a warm welcome.
landmark: Large DeMentha sign on the corner of our frontage

name: BatCave
description: BatCave is gifting artisan lemonade daily! Come join us Monday-Friday from noon-3pm for alcohol free lemonade and stay to hang out in our comfy Bat Roost. We will be serving up unique flavors each day and they will always come with ice.
landmark: Lemonade Stand with BatCave sign

name: Bike Gods
hometown: Reno, Sacramento, Paris, Salt Lake City
description: Bike trouble got ya down? Come visit the Bike Gods, where we practice self reliant bike repair 24 hours a day. Our camp features 8 fully equipped workstations and spare parts. We have caring and compassionate bike mechanics to assist you M-F 10am-12pm. Out on the Playa, look for our Bike Gods Taxi Service running yellow tandems and our famous Lanterne Rouge art car.
landmark: Red & White Shade Structure with LED Bike on top

name: Pretty Pickle
description: A relaxed and welcoming outpost on the dusty road to nowhere. We have daily afternoon pickle service (Noon to 3 pm). Cold pickles and pickletini shots! We invite passersby to step under our shade, enjoy a refreshing treat, and ride our disco pickle swing! In-the-know visitors may inquire about our playa-famous pickle warmers!
landmark: green and pink flags and "Pretty Pickle" sign

name: Black Rock University
description: Black Rock University teaches Playa Survival Skills and Best Practices. The 10 Principles of Burning Man. 10 Principles of Couples Survival and other Playa Centric courses and outreach.
landmark: Black Rock University Flag and USA Flag on a pole

name: FAFA Camp
description: Welcome! We are an international camp and look forward to seeing you at our friendly, cozy camp.  Come round mornings and afternoons for our interactivities or to just sit in the shade on our front porch.
landmark: FAFA sign

name: BAR MACTROPOLIS
description: We are a full-service Bar.  All are welcome.   In the morning, we serve coffee, extra libation, and blood Mary's!  For the rest of the day come by for a blended drink that you can blend with our custom-made blender or enjoy a cocktail or beer. Our music is chill and our bartenders the best!
landmark: Large yellow canopy and shade structure

name: Astral Outpost
description:
Astral Outpost is a place where the ethereal meets the earthly. We invite you to transcend the ordinary and explore the depths of the cosmos. At Astral Outpost, you may encounter a diverse array of beings - stargazers, scientists, engineers, activists, spiritual seekers and cosmic voyagers. 

Engage in thought-provoking dialogues during our Salon Talks or simply bask in the company of like-minded souls as you enjoy an ice cream crafted to awaken your senses and ignite your imagination.

Whether you're delving into astral projection or simply seeking a refuge on your journey, Astral Outpost offers a sanctuary where the boundaries between the physical and metaphysical blur, and the journey of self-discovery knows no bounds. Join us as we embark on a voyage through the cosmos.
landmark: Astral Outpost camp sign

name: Anonymous Village
description: Anonymous Village is a supportive community to help burners stay sober in the challenging environment of the playa and BRC. Members staff the Village hospitality tent and lead recovery meetings in communal meeting space. Recovery Yoga is available daily at 10:30am in the Yoga tent.  We offer a daily meeting schedule including meetings of AA (Alcoholics Anonymous), NA (Narcotics Anonymous), Alanon, SAA/SLAA, FA/OA, CoDA, MA, and PIR.  We also host sober camping as well as a separate area for Alanon's and recovery friends/allies.  We also offer "AnyA" meetings daily that offer an inclusive environment for people recovering from addiction to "ANY" behavior or substance. We welcome curious burners who want to learn about how we burn sober.
landmark: Anonymous Village Marquee Sign

name: Bitchin' Braid Camp
description: Come for the braids, stay for the bar parties. Please grab a partner or find one in the braiding lounge to make a plan for a style that will last the week. Braiders on hand with all the supplies and skills to get you taken care of, including mirrors to check out your sweet self on the way out. No hair? NO PROBLEM. From 10am to sunset we have have hosted bar parties, new faces, new specialty drinks, new outfits and new music every two hours. Want to be apart of our camp's 10 year tradition, head over right before sunset to grab a bevy and enjoy a special treat as the sun starts kissing those mountains. Miss you already, so swing by.
landmark: Blue Camp Sign in Front of our Shade Structure

name: Future Turtles
description: The Future Turtles offer a friendly and welcoming 24/7 destination where you can come hang out, play with our LED tower, climb up and view the playa from our observation decks, and meet the Turtles: happy mutants: nerds, engineers, programmers, gaymers, creators and artists, scientists and philosophers. Our Monday night kink party and our mud parties featuring naked twink mud wrestling are world famous. Our DJs promise to play absolutely no pop whatsoever. We have a nice lounge to hang out at the gateway to the queerborhood and an amazing pillow fort for adult consent-based activity during opening hours.
landmark: 2 shipping containers painted white w/ blue waves

name: Dr.Baron von Realz, Esq. Sideshow
description:
Come join our circus of freaks
Burning man will be here before you know it and "Dr. Baron von Realz Esq. most spectacular Steampunk Sideshow of altered reality and debauchery" needs you. Come join our circus of freaks and be a part of the shenanigans of our camp. Flaming girls, tattoos, body modifications, piercings, carnies, performers, artists, suicide girls, freaks, geeks, and other oddities are welcome to fill our ranks. Besides filling our ranks we are always looking for dedicated minions to help us set up and tear down the camp, couch taters need not apply. We are looking for people who want to be Burning Man, not people who want go to Burning Man.
landmark: 30 foot camo parchute covered dome

name: OjO Grande Tiki Bar Camp
landmark: White fiberglass EggCamper (looks like a Scamp)

name: HIGHKU
description: Camp HIGHKU is a zen-inspired oasis offering shade, hydration, and good vibes to weary travelers. Step through our iconic torii gate into a tranquil space where you can cool off with ice-cold lemonade and coconut water, relax under misting shade structures, and connect with fellow Burners. Our serotonin workshops, led by medical professionals and Zen practitioners, provide meaningful conversations and wellness insights. With a welcoming atmosphere, chill music, and thoughtful gifting, Camp HIGHKU is a refreshing retreat where you can rest, recharge, and reconnect before heading back into the dust.
landmark: Large wooden torii gate with Camp HIGHKU sign.

name: Kidsville
description: Burning Man's best place for kids!  Come enjoy our trampolines, playgrounds, kid-friendly treats, and meet other families that burn with people under 18.
landmark: Big Rainbow "Kidsville" Perimeter

name: Schnitzel Camp
description: "Schnitzel - camp" serving best Schnitzel on playa! Watch out for the crazy food truck!
landmark: "Schnitzel Camp" flag

name: Spoonful of Friends
description: An inclusive 3-course sit-down banquet awaits with arts, games, drinks and gastronomic delight. Hurry, first 70 to arrive dine!
landmark: Big white trailer and a big sign of two big spoons

name: SonicBoom Saloon
description: Come enjoy some old west drinks while you learn to crack a whip or gamble your precious shwag away.
landmark: 8' Tall Cowboy Cutout

name: Camp Prism Effect
description: Welcome to Camp Kaleidoscope, where corporate surrealism meets playful absurdity. Step through the portal and enter a waiting room unlike any other, a liminal space filled with HR posters that seem oddly cryptic, a receptionist who may or may not actually help you, and a series of nonsensical instructions that hint at something much bigger. While you wait, you'll have the chance to engage in an assortment of odd office games designed to prepare you for your inevitable meeting, though the rules remain unclear.
landmark: Kaleidoscope portal with Neon sign

name: Kuker Camp
description:
BULGARIAN KUKER Mutant Vehicle is based on the Kukeri Ritual Dancers - a millenia old tradition from Bulgaria, Eastern Europe. Kukeri are people wearing elaborate self-made fur costumes and hideous animalistic masks. Every year at the beginning of spring Kukeri dance to scare away evil spirits and bring joy, happiness and prosperity for the whole village throughout the year. 
In addition to just having the festive and carnival-like appearance, we have infused our ancient MUTANT PET with a modern soul - mixing ancient bagpipe melodies and live drum beats with various electronic music styles.
landmark: The Kukeri furry masks hanging on the canopy poles

name: Rebel Camp
description: ESD Support Camp
landmark: Red Flag with Rebel Camp Logo

name: Dusty Taint
description:
Dusty Taint Juke Joint
Inspired by 1940s Negro Juke Joints, our space blends music, games, and drinksâ€”where passersby can unwind after a long day on the Playa. More than a party, it's a multi-cultural, sexually diverse gathering that sparks conversations and new friendships.

As the sun sets, we toast the night with laughter, connection, and games that push boundaries. Cards, parlor games, and themed gatherings keep the vibe lively in a relaxed, informal setting.

In a world of hate and noise, we stand for love and unity, celebrating cultures, embracing differences, and learning from one another. At Dusty Taint Juke Joint, we don't just partyâ€”we strive to build a better Burning Man community.
landmark: 30 ft facade made from dark brown Rustic Wood MDF

name: Cheat Codes
description: Cheat Codes is a bespoke analog arcade offering games of wit and dexterity 24/7. Come play with us!
landmark: analog sign that says "Cheat Codes," lit at night.

name: Soulshakers
description: Our camp is a playground for the free-spirited and a home base for nomads with a thirst for connection and adventure. We're a global tribe of dream-chasers and boundary-pushers, supporting each other to live our best lives; from the peaks of New Zealand to the shores of Thailand, and everywhere in between.  We are solid as a community and feel that the space we hold between us can inspire other Burners to live courageously and less conventionally, as we all aim to do, as a community together. Join us, where every moment is a chance to shake up the soul and sprinkle a little more magic into the burn.
landmark: Green Parachute & Large White Stretch Tent

name: Swag of Burning Man
landmark: "Please Slow Drively" Street sign

name: Arcane Spirits
description: Come cast a love spell or hazard a curse! The cauldron is hot and the spirits are hungry: tarot, theme nights, and magical lore galore. The pointy hat is optional, but thirst is mandatory.
landmark: green glowing sign that says "Arcane Spirits"

name: Kombuchachacha
description: Kombucha: (n) kom-BOO-cha. Renowned playa aphrodisiac. You may not get the booch you want but you will definitely get the booch you need. The home of con+sent.  Relax, refresh and cha cha the day away. 4 stars on yelp 2024.
landmark: Black and red flags and kombuchachacha sign

name: Side Boob
description: The "side boob" has long been disparaged as trashy. But why? Come join us at Side Boob and let your side boob out on the dance floor or cuddle up with one of our camp members and share a bit of your inner "side boob" â€“ a part of you that you don't always feel like you can share. We promise, no matter how trashy you think it is, we appreciate all parts of you. We are an eclectic, non-judgmental, life-loving, arms-and-hearts-wide-open group of sometimes trashy people who want to know you better, side boob and all.
landmark: giant boob shade structure and the hot pink lyra

name: WHAT THE PIC?
description: Camp WHAT THE PIC? is where everyone is welcome and we will be taking 360 degree photos. All photos are gifted instantly via wireless connection. Bring your friends, hang out, and take home a lasting memory of a 360 degree photo!
landmark: 10 foot wide Butterfly

name: Joyism Artcar Support Camp
description: The home of the Joyism artcar, the temple for the Joyism religion, the religion of the 30th century!
landmark: Joyism coffee bar (yellow and purple) next door.

name: WrongoWrongo
description: The home of the mutant vehicle Uuna Ahi and your somewhat friendly neighborhood mutant vehicle repair oasis.
landmark: Metal Moai Mutant Vehicle and palm tree sign

name: U.F.O.
description: U.F.O. is an oasis by day to pamper yourself and relax in a cozy, shaded environment with great music. At night we turn up the bass and the fire. Lots of personality
landmark: UFO sign in "living room" and purple lighting

name: SpeLeoBox, The
description: Crawl through our SpeLeoBox or pump up a view over the RV line on our extra-tall swingset. Day or night, hop off your bike, put down your phone, and heed our siren song of hilarity & connectedness!  If you are lucky, maybe you'll also get to stand in line at Gaslighter's Pizza Parlor, channel your inner witch in a cackling competition, chill your taint with some crotch ice, earn Trash Mommy's Milk & Cookies by being a MOOP-master, let out your inner diva at Spontaneous Musical: the Musical, receive the ultimate sensory treatment from Dr. Piffletwister at Psychosuction, or let Dr. Teeth's Mobile Dentistry clean up your filthy mouth. Celebrate IMMEDIACY with us: we want it, NOW. And seriously, put down your fucking phone.
landmark: SPELEOBOX (6'x8'x14' box with murals) & SWINGSET

name: Camp Ridiculicious
description:
In a pickle? Come get some advice.
Need a pickle? Come get a pickle.
Need a straw? Make you own out of a Pickle!
Need to hug a pickle? Let us help!
Kid Friendly
landmark: Green fabric pickles signage /  inflatable pickles

name: Latica
description: We are a very diverse camp that will exemplify radical inclusion. This camp will be mostly populated by latinX individuals from Venezuela, Mexico and various hispanic upbringings along with some strong allies.
landmark: The sign that says our name "Latica"

name: Cheshire Alley
description: Join us on a trip down the rabbit hole! Cheshire Alley - the most fun dive bar on the playa!! Stop by for some afternoon and evening silliness, cool drinks, games, and black light body / face painting. We host super fun themed parties Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday evenings.
landmark: Cheshire Cat in Tree

name: George's Glorious Anarchy
description: IYKYK.
landmark: Lit multicolor "Mom Camp" sign + bike parking area

name: Dye With Dignity
description: Dye With Dignity provides silk scarves and all necessary elements to create your own tie dye work of art on playa! On none dye days we provide snow cones and frozen margaritas.
landmark: large Dye With Dignity sign street lights

name: Playa Paul's Concierge Service
description:
Discover Playa Paul's Concierge Service, where unparalleled support meets the spirit of Burning Man. Our camp redefines the playa experience with a suite of services, including daily gourmet coffee service, refreshing afternoon beverages, and personalized RV maintenance. Embrace the convenience of our on-site concierge including pump outs, water, and art tour bookings. Each evening, join our vibrant community gatherings for networking and relaxation. Our interactive art installations and dedicated spaces foster creativity and connection. At Playa Paul's, we ensure your journey is as fulfilling and comfortable as the memories you'll create. 
At Playa Pauls you are a VIPP!
landmark: Large Playa Paul sign above walkway

name: Camp Slow Your Roll
description: Take inspiration from the sloth and give into the deadly sin. Take a breath, put a pause on your carefully laid out plans and just slow your roll. No need to rush! Land in a sloth's dream jungle paradise. Come hang with us where everything is, you guessed it, slooowly done. Experience Slow Drunk Yoga (Mon/Wed 11am-12pm) and the Best Worst Sloth Cocktail Lounge (Tue/Thu 4:30-7pm) for the best tasting cocktails and mocktails  on the playa but with the worst service since you have to wait. Play some slow sloth challenges and games while you wait. Don't fall off but finish last in the Slowest Bike Race. Channel your inner sloth to take photos in sloth onesies at our Sloth Pun Photo Booth.

name: Opulent Chill

name: Candyland

Come join the fun at CandyLand. Enjoy a sweet treat from one of a dozen retro decorated candy dispensing machines. Then you can step over to our "Candy Bar" for a shot of Jolly Rancher flavored Vodka.
After choosing your favorite vodka flavor, get in line at "The Claw" for an opportunity for more treats, and some x-rated toys for those over 18.
CandyLand is open everyday until 6 pm.

Honey Puddle gives you that warm, sweet, exhilarating feeling of being enveloped by love and friendship. And music and mead and
dancing and light. We're not a quiet camp, we're not a not-quiet camp. We're just right...and we'll be here when you want us. We fit like
warm pajamas.

Come on by for a rest in our shade, play board games, test your coordination on our obstacle course, troll the inter webs, watch a weird movie or two, and participate in the first running of the Burntucky Derby!

Our Watertenders guide you through the AquaZone Intentional Water Bar ritual of choosing your intention for the moment. You decide!

Our camp is a haven for enthusiasts of all experience levels, from the curious novice to the seasoned practitioner.  The Spanktuary offers a space where participants can delve into the multifaceted aspects of spanking.  We are committed to creating a safe, welcoming and judgment-free zone where individuals are encouraged to have fun as they explore their desires!  Equipped with various  accoutrements such as paddles, whips and bare hands,  participants can choose to spank or to be spanked. Have your spanking with bacon, whipped cream or a shot. Come one, come all to celebrate everyday just like it's a holiday. We bring the spirit of celebration to the playa with our life-sized billiards game.
Beyond the game, our camp invites burners to engage with interactive installations:  
New Year's Resolution Board â€“ Share your dreams and intentions for the year ahead.  
Love Letter Board â€“ Leave anonymous messages of love and appreciation for fellow burners.

Christmas Exchange â€“ Leave a small gift, take a small giftâ€”embracing the joy of giving.  

With glowing night games, themed challenges, and festive surprises, Misfit Island is a place to celebrate, connect, and playâ€”one oversized shot at a time!

name: Spinny's Playground
description: Spinny's Playground is a re-imagination of Sticky's Playground, a Burning Man camp designed to rekindle the childlike joy of physical challenge and play. As kids, we naturally tested our limits for fun, but as adults, we often lose that instinct, turning movement into a means to an end rather than a source of joy. At Spinny's, playfulness reigns through mega-sized playground structures, type-2 fun experiences, and extreme schoolyard games hosted by our Recess Hall Monitors. From 360-degree see-saws and a spinning bar to rope climbs and dance floors, we invite burners to rediscover the thrill of movement on the playa. Created by a passionate crew of artists, engineers, and dreamers from Reno, Nevada. We don't stop playing because we grow oldâ€”we grow old because we stop playing.
landmark: Large Scaffolding with a 'NO VAGRANCY' sign

name: 3SP (Third Space Place)
description: 3SP (Third Space Place) is your dusty, comfy front porch/living room combo serving as a Black Rock City "third space" â€” a relaxing, community spot offering a real sense of welcome and belonging beyond one's dwelling ("first space") and one's workplace ("second space"). As with any true third space, guests can stop by, relax, ask for directions, chat, or PARTICIPATE in one of 3SP's events focusing on all kinds of issues: being introverted on Playa; navigating the world as a stutterer/stammerer; identifying unconscious biases; Native-American appreciation versus appropriation; relaxing with essential oils or a camera obscura mediation; and more. We've been around since 2015 and we've got campers from DC, NYC, Minneapolis, Philly, Portland, LA, and beyond. Come on by!
landmark: Blue and Green Flags and large 3SP sign

name: Penguin Place
description: Penguin Place is a welcoming home for dusty travelers from up-and-down the West Coast. LGBT-supportive community. Our mid-week Ice Throne event invites you to see just how long you can last on our frozen throne. The Jockstrap party on Thursdays is all about showing off that dusty ass. Enjoy the street-side trampoline, or stop by our shade lounge to keep cool and chat with fellow burners. Talk and taste sustainable coffee with our resident coffee expert on Wednesday morning. Warm-up by the burn barrel in the evenings, share stories and make new friends.
landmark: Wooden penguin cutouts and rainbow penguin flag

name: Camp P3
description: Join us as we spiral ever outward in unending discovery of where the highway of radial participation intersects with the great canal of radical inclusion. Camp P3 is  'be your best self' boutique clothing gifters, and Nitro Coffee moguls hell bent on emblazoning your brain.  We are also simply the hosts of the world's largest white Wedding Dress Wednesday procession complete with a mass wedding ceremony? Don't ask us, we don't even know what our camp name meansâ€¦ Perhaps it means something different to each of us.  Come visit us and find out what P3 means to you.

name: XOXO
description: Welcome to your oasis on the playa! Kick back on our loungers, sip icy-cold refreshments that rotate daily, devour coconut pancakes, and get ready to make some bizarrely awesome connections. Whether you're speed-friending, shaking it at our parties, working up a sweat at our fitness class, or crafting your next artful masterpiece, there's no shortage of ways to unleash your creativity and meet new friends. With friendly people, chill vibes, and a whole lotta love, XOXO is all about making meaningful connections. We've got beats that'll get you dancing, interactivity that'll make you laugh, and an atmosphere that's pure magic. Come for the pancakes, stay for the vibes!

We'll be hosting a comfy shade and tea lounge on-playa with activities like conversation-games, tarot, iced non-alcoholic tea, and our very own Shady Ladies who will be there to give you a (consensual) read.

name: Gigsville

Renowned for our legendary fuckery, we create a space where creativity and rebellion flourish. Here, every form of individuality is celebrated, from seasoned burners to wide-eyed newcomers. Our ethos is built on challenging norms and embracing everyone with a penchant for mischief and a heart for community. Expect the unexpected: from mind-bending installations to spontaneous performances, all wrapped in our trademark humor. Gigsville: where history, hijinks, and heartfelt acceptance collide.

name: PolyParadise
description: PolyParadise has been influencing the Hearts & Minds and Washing the Bodies of Playa Citizens from '2:00 - 10:00' since 1999 celebrating 27 years in BRC in 2025. Polyamory involves openness to multiple loving relationships, with honesty among all partners. We welcome ALL Poly & Poly Friendly folks to camp within our borders. PolyParadise 2025 welcomes the Twisted Swan | Temple of Bacchus as part of your Playa Experience. PolyParadise is NOT a Swinger Camp. Being Poly or Practicing Poly is NOT a requirement for camping with us, but being OPEN MINDED about other people's lifestyle choices IS!!
landmark: 10' Black Metal Man with Red Heart/Infinity Symbol

name: Backfire
description:
A small camp composed of ASL signers that loves to bring a little bit of their community and experience to the citizens of Black Rock City! 

We have Vietnamese Coffee and ASL every morning, along with our popular Lil Fixit Shop if you have something that needs fixing.

Or come by in the afternoon to check out our ASL confessional booth!
landmark: Backfire sign (well lit LED sign)

name: Aurora
description: Konnichiwa, pardner. Whether you're coming home from a long night in the saddle or just mounting up for the day, join us for a fresh bowl of ramen that'll soothe both body and soul. Sidle up to our cozy bar, share a tale with a stranger, and settle your spirit to the sweet sounds of smooth grooves.
landmark: Aurora sign, flat top bar shade structure

name: Pink Lightning
description: Pink Lightning is the home of the Burning Man Ultramarathon, and all things running at Burning Man: the 5k, the beer mile, the naked mile, easy mile, and more! Come to run an event or support an event. We also love all things PINK!
landmark: Pink Lightning Bolts and pink shade structure

name: Breakaway Republic
description: Tiny Arms Tavern welcomes all dinosaurs for libations and roar-ing laughter. Open every day, look for the giant T-Rex. Espresso martinis and wine from 10-2 every day!
landmark: Giant T-Rex Costume and Redheaded Manekin

name: Apotheneum
description:
Apo-the-neum (place of divine elevation) is a visual, sonic and haptic instrument intended to "transport" visitors through participatory immersion. Comprised of two nested chambers made of back-to-back LED nets (13,940 nodes in all), Apotheneum presents multiple canvases for collaborating visual artists and an immersive sound system for collaborating sound artists. Measuring 40 x 40 x 40 feet, Apotheneum's cubic antechamber envelops a thirty-foot "inner sanctum" that opens to the sky and is anchored by a 24-foot pressure-sensing "bed" on which visitors are invited to recline, and be transported.

At night, evoking aspects of the natural worldâ€”wind, fire, lightning, rain, stars, gravity, people and animalsâ€”Apotheneum encourages inward contemplation through multi-sensory somatic immersion.
landmark: 36 foot translucent dome covered in shadows

name: Castra Ursi
description:
Castra Ursi is pioneering a fully solar-powered, efficient, and inspiring camp model while showcasing the future of sustainable infrastructure on Playa.

This year, we bring The Ursas, two large, interactive, illuminated bear sculptures powered entirely by solar energy. Our camp will also serve as a hub for renewable energy education, offering a behind-the-scenes look at large-scale solar systems for camps and public art.

We are excited to promote the integration of art into the city, demonstrating how sustainable, interactive artworks can shape urban spaces. Through live demonstrations and discussions, we'll explore the future of fuel-free energy solutions at Burning Man and beyond.
landmark: Giant Bears

name: machinedom - the experience
description: machinedom-the experience.... come by and see us!
landmark: Placement pennent flag atop a 20' flagpole

name: Playasos!
description: Come ride SeÃ±or Snail von Slidesmouth, a 40' foot long giant tube slide dressed up like a monstrous rainbow snail! Sure to make you squeal like a kid again, this ride is open at all times for all peoples, large and small alike. von Slidesmouth is eager and ready to take you on a ride and swallow you down into his dark and thrilling underbelly. This ain't your school playground's slide. Just don't be embarrassed when the 5 year old in front of you is less scared than you are :)
landmark: Giant Rainbow Snail

name: Patsy's Hangout
description: Patsy's Hangout is a fabulous lounge in the gayborhood where you can connect with old friends and make new ones while enjoying a refreshing cocktail. Enjoy high-energy tunes, good company and a comfortable space all day, every day. Stop by for our daily recurring activities including: Patsy's lounge, which is always open, Patsy's Classical Morning Brew: Serving coffee with classical chill music every morning 9 AM to 12 Noon and Patsy's Bar: Serving cold beverages, and lots of ice, every day 12 Noon to 6 PM. Participate in our daily special events including Patsy's Closet on Monday, Patsy's Nail Salon on Tuesday, the Golden Girls Escape from Shady Pines bar crawl on Thursday.  And don't forget to visit Patsy's Parlor. Remember: Your Fabulous!
landmark: Large metal/tarp structure with "PATSY'S" signage.

name: Lusty Chanterelle Kombucha Bar
description: Whisky is out- Kombucha is in. The Lusty Chanterelle Kombucha bar is a place to rest, unwind, and drop in with good conversation and a cold non-alcoholic beverage with your fellow burners. Come with an empty cup and we will fill you up and help you feel at home with the most quaffable drink on playa.
landmark: Short mushroom themed art pieces, wooden bar

name: Wetspot
description: Established in 2010 and based in Reno, NV, Wetspot is a playa favorite saloon for daytime fun and libations. We invite you to come kick in our doors and let us fill your cup with an ice-cold draft beer or our legendary Skip-and-Go Naked cocktail. Feeling like your burn needs a little more, burn? We've got you covered with a shot of our spicy tequila. You just might end up on the Wall of Flame! Drinking not your thing? That's okay too! Wetspot is about making new friends in an open-to-all setting. Dancing and laughter are guaranteed. Cheers!
landmark: Wetspot flag and large saloon doors

name: Black Rock City Aquarium
description: At this aquarium, you can choose whether to see the fish or be the fish. Props provided. Regular feedings. Exit through the gift shop.
landmark: two white carports with a large blue banner

name: Decotoro Social Club
description: The support camp for the Decotoro mutant vehicle. Decotoro is an art deco style bull from Dallas, TX. The Decotoro team aims to provide an elegant riding experience in Black Rock City with an attention to detail, design, artistry, and environment complementing music.
landmark: 6' x 3' Lit, Red, Marquee Sign that says "Tourist"

name: Kelly's
description: Kelly's is a close-knit, gay-friendly diverse camp with a history at burning man that goes back to 1993, Come sing Drunk Karaoke, chill out in our Art Light Chill Space, feed that late night chocolate craving, or learn something new about: Coffee Appreciation, E-Playa, Playa Cooking, and Lana Del Rey.  Come with an open attitude and be prepared to make new friends.
landmark: 6Ft wooden Kelly's Sign

name: The Last Starfighters
description: Greetings, Starfighter. You have been recruited by the Star League to defend the playa against commodification & moop. Your participation in supporting artists by building a branch of The Solar Library & giving home to Solarians is to be commended. Your communal effort & civic responsibility will be known across the galaxy. You as a radically self reliant creature have always wanted to fight a desperate battle against incredibly dusty odds. The Trailing Soul & Augmented Reality Porta Potties are your legacy. Remember to listen next time a gung-ho iguana tells you to relax.
landmark: Yellow Wedge Shaped Solaria Unit

name: Deaf Granny's Kitchen
description: Deaf Granny inhabits a vintage 1950s kitchen,  serving up goodies (and some baddies) in an interactive improv performance art format.  Sit and learn about visual communication and the particular ways of being exemplified by Deaf people.  Lovingly and  humorously she will confront and break down your preconceived notions, drawing you in as a participant actively engaged in your own awakening.  Also come and dance with us at our night time parties in our lounge.
landmark: Big lit midcentury-modern style billboard

name: I'm OK, You're OK Corral
description: Stop on by the Corral for a libation in our vintage saloon. We host daily drink specials and welcome critters of all types!
landmark: OK Signs!

name: IPOW-Indigenous People of World
description: IPOW-Indigenous People of World wants to bring Indigenous people and allies from around the world together to share their stories and life experiences. The basis of the camp is to create a place to share Indigenous culture and educate all who want to join our camp or events to learn.
