Facilitating scenic airplane flights for Burners? Of course! The Agents at the Black Rock Travel Agency are committed to burners having an experience only to be found at the best airport in the world. Start, continue or end your journey with us.
landmark: Starport

name: Camp Tidy
description: Welcome to Camp Tidy! Enjoy a proper cuppa at tea time and peruse our extensive collection of literature in the Tea and Porn lounge. Relax in the Playa Cloud. Recharge yourself and your devices with our solar powered charging station.
landmark: "Tea & Porn" shade structure + 16'x16' dance floor

name: Samsara Art Support Camp
description: An Art Support Camp for the Samsara Water Temple honoraria project. We are in a hub with the MoonLight Library Art Support Camp
landmark: bamboo arches

name: Turbaza Chayka
description: Our camp is a welcoming place for emotional exploration at Burning Man. We offer compassion therapy for deep emotional connections and healing. Our Listening Camp provides a space to share and feel validated. We use complaint forms for constructive feedback and themed days to explore psychedelic insights. Tarot readings offer mystical guidance. All activities aim to foster self-discovery and connection in an inclusive environment.
landmark: An announcement board with camp's name on it

name: Slushious
description: Catering to a whole spectrum of playa experiences and mental states, Slushious offers uplifting themed parties and a  chillout space. We believe that by working together, and inviting all passing dusty desert travelers to join us, we become more than the sum of our parts. Whether you're looking for fun, sympathy, commiseration, R&R, or simply shade, refreshment and a place to meet our welcoming campmates, Slushious offers it all. Fun for all ages, ALL PEOPLE.
landmark: Big slushious sign!

name: Sian Kamp
description: Sian Kamp is a Black Rock City oasis with beautiful downtempo and deep house accompanied by tea. We want you to start the day the right way with us ;)
landmark: Bedouin shade structure with a Sian flag on top

name: Rabbit Hole
description: It's whatever you want it to be!
landmark: Illuminated  rabbit curiously perched in front

name: Camp Clusterfuck
description: Welcome to our otherworldly circus camp, where creativity meets the cosmos! Join us for aerial spectacles, enchanting performances, spontaneous play, workshops and carnival festivities that foster community and connection.
landmark: Lighted UFO portal rings pointing skyward

name: Astral Lab
description:
Lose yourself in a reverie of music. An intimate sound camp for people who like good, unique music to jam out to. 

Feel like taking a break? Come watch forgotten films from the VHS era on a large format screen with high quality sound.  Or take a seat, have a drink, and discuss the day's explorations in our shaded bar and lounge.
landmark: Solar DJ Booth and Astral Lab sign

name: Helioz
description: At Helioz, we worship the Sun god. To honor our god, we roast delicious animals and share them with all guests. Come by in the late afternoon and evening for some tasty treats, and drink a sun-god libation.
landmark: Big HELIOZ sign and bright red/yellow drapery

name: Boom Boom Womb
description: Boom Boom Womb is your feminine, funky, soulful, childlike home away from home on the playa.
landmark: 20 ft metal truss in center of shade cloth pyramid

name: Camp [No Name]
description: An international camp hosting DJs, yoga, workshops, theme parties, a bar for the thirsty, cozy lounging, bar games and flogging/kink dungeon. Specializing in dubious advice and questionable antics.
landmark: Bar With No Name on the streetfront

name: Flock of Donkeys
description:
Come burn off that hangover and create a new one, you sparkly little donkey, and let's pretend we're ageless. Rock the day away on our life-size donkey, test your balance on two or four hooves on the balance beams, and take a spin on the pole.  The best place on the playa to be a real ass, and bring a friend to play with you!

Alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages served in the afternoon during our donkey shenanigans. 

Hoof it over and horse around or, in this case, come donkey around with our crew.
landmark: Rocking Donkey, "Flock of Donkeys" flag, UN bar

name: Fauxliage
description: Our fake greenhouse offers a temporary refuge from the harsher elements of the playa. Come take a break in our cool space, have some tea, and practice your creativity by making origami playa gifts. We'll hang leftover origami pieces throughout the week as if our greenhouse is "growing" in the desert! At night, look for our 11' LED sign, colorful up lights, silhouetted plants, and occasional fire spinning!
landmark: 42' dome with fake plants & 11' illuminated sign

name: PlayaReal ID
description: Welcome to the Department of Radical Self-Projection â€” a future-bureaucratic agency temporarily stationed in Black Rock City to credential citizens for the world of Tomorrow, Today. At our futuristic field office, participants are interviewed, pose for a quantum mugshot, and receive their laminated Playa SurReal ID: a license for the soul theyâ€™re becoming. Get certified by our Licensing Specialists by day, and return at night to witness the Orb of Source Identity â€” a luminous, timeline-jumping relic. The Department of Radical Self-Projection proudly recognizes radical self-expression across all dimensions, timelines, and realities.
landmark: A large circular welded together bikes

name: Cool Cat Cafe
description: Cool Cat Cafe is all meow all the time.  We are a small family owned and operated theme camp dedicated to serving quality nom noms.  We are here to make your burn meowy af!!
landmark: Sphinx and all the cat stuff

name: Making Art at the Mad Tea Party
description: Please drop by our camp and contribute to our collective art projects, using sharpies, pencil crayons or paints (supplied). We want you to spend 5 minutes expressing yourselves on our practical and fantastical themes, creating multi artist works of art. And please stay until 5 pm and join us for our daily afternoon Mad Hatter iced tea party, complete with regalia.
landmark: 3 large art easels near the road

name: Salon Soleil
description:
Salon Soleil is a salon on the Enlightenment model, a forum for the exchange of creative ideas. Our inspiration is sunlight: We burn bright and clean. The one trace we leave is good karma. 

Come recharge your devices with our solar array. Check out our eclectic array of events and recharge yourself. Our magic is connecting with Burners as unique individuals whether that's through sharing ideas, catalyzing healthy emotional and somatic release, or shaking up default-world assumptions through playful hijinks. Audition for silent-movie stardom, try on a new look at our atelier, feast with us on vulvular waffles or sacramental cheese. Be transformed by our life-changing Healing Faire. Or just relax in our welcoming Do-Me Domesâ€”a lush and safe space in which to decompress and meet new humans.
landmark: Red-topped Domes and bright yellow container

name: BeeYond:
description:
We have been buzzing the playa for more than 20 years now, and we are ready for more, indeed moving BeeYond: 

We rely on serious energy, creativity, love, and silly shenanigans to keep our love flowing.

We seek to inspire, connect, and celebrate life by spreading our love and care for our fair Black Rock City. 

This shows in our efforts to be a clean green camp, in the way we BUZZ people (imagine a buzzing vibrating swarm!) in the way we welcome all passersby into our NectarSector to escape the sun or onto our Mutant Vehicle the BoomBa and most of all how we love each other and all we meet!
landmark: 10 foot tall lit metal sign that says BeeYond!

name: Playa Bears
description: Come chill and get your bearings at Playa Bears! Where we're always bruin' up good times and kodiak moments. Our forebears believed in dancing, strong drinks, delicious food, and koality time with friends. We're serving up all of the above in our Playa Bear Den! Do you need a place to get away from the pandemonium of the playa? Fur the love of the man, honey! Come join us at one of our events or stop by anytime for a cocktail and a bear hug.
landmark: forest tapestries, teddy bears, & Playa Bears sign

name: Phonic Bloom
description: Join us to experience a sound-reactive light show. Sing, play instruments, or just relax and enjoy a synesthesia-inspired experience in a relaxing and intimate environment.
landmark: geodesic dome and illuminated "Phonic Bloom" sign

name: Playa Alterations
description: Playa Alterations is your one-stop shop for chopping, cropping, bedazzling, sprucing, or painting up your favorite duds! We have shade, sewing supplies, outfit ideas, and tunes to carry you through your week.
landmark: Silver dome Playa Alterations, LED tree

name: Fever Dream Theater
description:
Witness our wild, weird, and wonderful Variety Show in the style of a classic Vaudeville and the spirit of Cacophony. Step through the red windmill into the red velvet paradise that is our classic cabaret theater, and see comedy, tragedy, mime, dance, live music, and some stuff that have you feeling like you're in a Fever Dream. Nightly performances of SOMETHING at 10pm Monday through Saturday.

Our pro performers host classes and workshops during the day if you want to learn how to radically express yourself.
landmark: Red velvet tent with the windmill blades on it.

name: Gender Blender
description: Welcoming home our trans, non-binary, BIPOC, and gender non-conforming community on Playa!
landmark: Neon Flags near Comfort & Joy

name: Queertirement
description: Queer Retirement Community - Hang with the queer playa elders, drink lemonade, bring magic, love, and gifts and receive great wisdom.
landmark: next to Turtles LED beacon our lemonade stand

name: Bloom Camp
description:
Join us at Bloom Camp, a two-story portal of human flourishing - a climbable art installation that transforms into a stage for live music, transformative conversations, and inspiring panels.
By day, stop by to enjoy our signature mimosas and fresh smoothies. By night, we come alive with DJ sets and live performances.
Come Bloom with us!
landmark: A 32-foot-high white flower portal with stairs up

name: Burnstream Court
description: Burnstream Court is a group of Airstream owners who recreate a 1960s trailer park, Black Rock City style.  We almost always have fun daytime events happening that you can join in with. And we give away grilled cheese sandwiches midday M-F.
landmark: A lighthouse beacon on a scissor lift. Airstreams.

name: Refugee Camp
description:
The journey to Burning Man involves leaving behind the familiar and embarking on a journey towards the unknown. This shared experience resonates deeply with the journey of immigrants, refugees, and boat people, who leave behind everything they know to navigate unfamiliar territory in search of a sense of home in an unlikely place. Black Rock City Refugee Camp celebrates the strength, resilience, ingenuity, and compassion of these remarkable communities.

With open hearts, we welcome all who seek solace, camaraderie, and belonging. Join our journey of resilience and celebration, as we create a space where the enduring spirit of immigrants, refugees, and boat people shines brightly in the heart of Black Rock City.
landmark: Buddhist goddess statue with radiating LED halo

name: PlovKraft
description: We cook delicioud PLOV and serve it daily!
landmark: Big PLOVKRAFT sign

name: Entheos Community Village
description: Members of the Entheos Community organize one of the larger and most diverse theme camps placed at the annual Burning Man event in the Black Rock Desert of Nevada. Friends and members of the Entheos Community come from over 43 countries to contribute their effort, skills, and resources to the creation of Entheos @ Burning Man. The camp creates extensive 24/7 interactivity for all ages as a gift to the citizens of Black Rock City, functions as a pilgrimage home for its members, and serves as a nexus to meaningfully connect people from around the world across national, religious, and ideological lines. As part of Entheos' commitment to radical inclusion, diversity, and equity, we hold a significant portion of our camp capacity open each year to welcome people who are new to Entheos.
landmark: giant trampoline arena with angled bounce walls.

name: Camp Truth or Dare!?
description: At Camp Truth or Dare!? our mission is to inspire joy, mischief, courage, curiosity and connection through the game of "Truth or Dare," foster Burning Man's 10 Principles + consent, and promote the Radical Inclusivity, Diversity and Equity initiative.
landmark: large light-up exclamation point & question mark.

name: Bushwood Country Club
description: The Bushwood Country Club offers a challenging putt putt golf course. Golfers will experience the course with an expert golf caddy who will carry your clubs (clubs provided) and provide real time advice on the green. Bushwood Country Club also offers additional amenities such as music, a club house serving ice cold John Daly's and Arnold Palmers, shade and friendship.
landmark: Putt Putt Golf Course

name: Groove Oasis
description: Groove Oasis is your refuge in the dusty desert to rest or move your body. We are hosting dance workshops and parties throughout the week so check the playa schedule and come get your groove on!
landmark: "Neon" Lotus Heart Logo Sign

name: Dilated Peoples
description: Expand your inner-vision while indulging your senses. A soothing treatment of refreshing eye drops, cucumber slices, a cooling eye mask, gentle mist, healing touch, and lavender pillow awaits you within an enchanting oasis.
landmark: Dilated Peoples sign; purple/white flags with eye

name: Dusty Dreamers
description: At Dusty Dreamers (formerly Dusty Frogz), we believe Burning Man is a dream in which we get for a week the opportunity to be completely free, to let our imagination go wild, to try new things and make new friends and that's why we are building the Home of the Dreamers at BRC. Our core theme is Celebration and Liberation. We are also a European camp, with our burners coming primarily from France, Sweden, Latvia and Spain. We are very easy to find, just look out for our 28ft tall Eiffel Tower, et voila!
landmark: Eiffel Tower (28ft tall) lit at night

name: Pyramid Scheme
description:
In the desert's dust, where the sun burns bright,
A mirage emerges, a gambler's delight.
A liquid oasis, surreal and divine,
A water casino where dreams intertwine.

Each droplet a chip, each sip a high stake,
Where thirst is the wager no soul can forsake.
With life as the currency, parched and extreme,
Water's the jackpot of this pyramid scheme.
landmark: A large lit sign that says "Pyramid Scheme"

name: RNDZVS
description: RNDZVS (ren-dez-vus) is an abridged version of the word Rendezvous, which at its core is a meeting place for friends. Come have a relaxing rendezvous during the day and refresh yourself from the playa elements. Stay for the night, bring your debauchery, and see what happens when the camp shifts to its alter ego, RNDZVS.
landmark: Neon Rendezvous/RNDZVS Sign

name: Navigate to YES
description: Find your destiny on playa with our GPS - Global Persuasion System
landmark: Navigate to YES neon sign and phone booth

name: SERENDIPITEA
description: SERENDIPITEA, a place where you can expect terrific teas, transformative workshops, titanic parties and tons of absurdity. Come by any time and enjoy a refreshing iced tea cocktail infusion, under the shade in our desert oasis. For your recovery mornings, help yourself to a cup of tea and recharge at our crystal alter. We exist to cultivate experiences full of intimate bonds, insightful breakthroughs, incredible beats, irreverent banter and intoxicating brews. Tues (Day) and Thurs (Night) we host our big parties! Let us dream of evanescence, and linger in the beautiful foolishness of things.
landmark: white camo shade two black flags serendipitea sign

name: Helios Hideout
description: Helios is a symbol of rebirth after hard times.  It is a celebration of humanity and an invitation for us all to stand together in the challenging times ahead.
landmark: Large red phoenix

name: Kumaya
description: Cozy up in our 24/7 library lounge filled with pillows, blankets, books and art. Write, doodle, or read the journals lying all around, filled with the stories of visitors from past burns. Eat a pancake at our morning disco party. Pilgrimage with us to deep playa at sunrise for tea and tunes. Get some deep rest in our meditative sound bath or simply lounge and connect with fellow travelers < 3
landmark: large white dome and a big sign that says "Kumaya"

name: Feed tHE ARTists
description: Started in 2007 with Larry Harvey's blessing and support, FTA has fed tens of thousands of artists, musicians, dancers, builders, makers, dabblers, and generally curious wandering travelers. FTA actively models the concept of creating community through the sharing of delicious meals at BRC and all over the world. We are striving to elevate food to an art form, serving as a primary resource for playa food safety, kitchen design, and unforgettable cooking. You never know what we'll be cooking up next - and, whatever it may be, you are invited to prepare it with us and share a meal of some of the finest food ever gifted on the playa!
landmark: Yellow rope lighting & neon Feed the Artists sign

name: Questionable Behavior?
description: Questionable Behavior? is a crew of principal-oriented burners who unite around creating immersive experiences that inspire participation and inquiry. We share art in the forms of interactive installations, dance parties, and sometimes a bar! Check out the weird and find a different view than the one you came with.  We are all a bit Questionable.
landmark: Three story scaffold with large disco ball

name: The Hand Lovers Lounge
description: A soft landing space for hands, lovers, lovers of hands, and everything in between!
landmark: Geodesic dome with purple fabric

name: Erotic Inclination Photo Studio
description: Step into the realm of sensual allure: Swing by to EIPS (Erotic Inclination Photo Studio) to create one of a kind photo memory of yourself and your loved one with the help of our resident photo artist. Singles, couples or groups are welcome at our studio located in the outskirts of Black Rock City where the good ol' Razorback Mountain is sitting and waiting to provide a natural backdrop for the art you're about to create using nothing else, but your body and the unique light of the high desert. We will provide a discrete environment to have your intimate photos taken in our photo tent or you can choose a photo session outside in the walk-in camping area catching the light of the golden hour of the late afternoon. All walk-ins are welcome! Hours: Mon â€“ Fri, 9:30 â€“ 5.
landmark: Dark Brown 10ft tall Moroccan Bedouin Desert Tent

name: The Hotel Lobby
description: With a lavish chandelier, bellhop service, concierge desk, a lux hotel bar, and a buzzing karaoke lounge, you'll be treated to 5-star service and a dusty bev in a welcoming and weird Hotel Lobby.
landmark: Archway and Neon Sign

name: Lost Art
description:
Come and visit the Lost Art of Conversation Cafe! We at Lost Art celebrate opportunities to create deep connections with friends old and new. At our Conversation Cafe you will be welcomed and supported in exploring avenues of conversation that encourage depth with the goal of learning something new about others and maybe even yourself. We want you to come and settle for a while and get lost in conversation. To keep you nourished we have tea in the mornings and street foods from around the world in the evenings. 

We are a small collaboration and connection driven community from across the US who love taking on ambitious projects, connecting with other awesome communities, and seeking growth and meaning in all that we do. Come on by, we'd love to get to know you.
landmark: Lost Art sign, large metal lips, and cafÃ© areas

name: Camp EAT ME
description: Camp EAT ME is EXCITEMENT ACTION TEAM MAGICAL ENCAMPMENT. We are a tight-knit group of weirdos united around making life more playful. Our skills, interests, and attitudes vary wildly, but the one thing we all have in common is that we almost always say yes to your silly idea and encourage everyone to play with us.
landmark: Ribbons, Barbie pink carpet, and carnival signs

name: Disco Space Shuttle
description: Home of the Disco Space Shuttle art car and camp. Board with us at 10pm and take a ride around the Universe and Beyond
landmark: Shiny blue space themed lounge with moon lights

name: AprÃ¨s-Ski
landmark: Flag with our Camp Name: AprÃ¨s-Ski

name: Playa Glass
description:
Would you like to make jewelry from the playa dust? Grab a pair of welding goggles and harness the energy of the sun to melt the playa into glass. We provide the instructions, tools, and supplies, you cast your artistic aspirations into glass.

The flipside of radical self expression is radical listening and receiving. Come join a playful, experiential workshop that might just transform how you experience the burn and your life! We will use our physical bodies, imaginations, and conversations to explore how we can more deeply receive one another. Radical listening is a gift to yourself and others that guides us all towards radical transformations.
landmark: Giant 'Playa Glass' letters sign and white tent

name: 7 Sins Lounge
description:
Sinners!
After 22 years of welcoming friends and sheltering strangers, 7 Sins Lounge will take its final bow!
So if you've loved one of BurningMan's oldest theme camps and the "friendliest slice of Hell on the Playa", come visit us "for the first time" one last time! 

Come share a memory, sign the book, have a final Flaming Blue Phuck and share some 7 Sins swag!
Because we're not fading quietly into the night- we're going to "party like it's 1999!" (Our 1st year!!)
landmark: red entrance and 2 red demon girls outside

name: What Would You Do For A Pickle?
description: Come join us and play the Pickle Game and find out what YOU would do for a pickle! Spankings sold separately.
landmark: pickle banners and one raised pickle flag

name: Mobile Pile
description: We are a Mutant Vehicle Support Camp bringing live Bluegrass music to Black Rock City.
landmark: sign on our frontage "Mobile 'Pile"; giant banjo

name: Word Play Cafe
description: Word Play Cafe is the space at Burning Man dedicated entirely to word games for people to gather, play and learn together. Visitors to Word Play Cafe can play favorite daily games, classic word games, and custom games like our Burning Man themed crossword, and other new word games we created just for Burning Man in our 30 ft dome. We also serve cold brew coffee daily from a cute vintage trailer just beside the dome. Additionally, we have daily events such as panel discussions featuring game developers, facilitated group games and friendly competitions.
landmark: 30 ft dome, white cover, crossword flags in front

name: Burning Band Camp
description: This is the home of the itinerant Burning Band, here to provide you with an earful of music. Well, two earfuls, really...
landmark: Burning Band flags

name: Viking Bar!
description: Serving ice cold quality craft beer and non-alcoholic options from our Viking themed bar since 2017.  Come grab a pint or three and make yourself at home while you escape the sun, play our array of games with your new friends and vibe to some good tunes.
landmark: Metal dragon statue out front, mult. viking flags

name: Black Rock Sauna Society
description: Experience the essence of Finnish sauna culture amidst the Playa's embrace. Our camp offers invigorating sauna sessions, traditional lÃ¶yly rituals, and the chance to encounter real life sauna elves! Join us for communal relaxation, deep connection, and the transcendent warmth of the Northern spirit.
landmark: Container sauna with big letters SAUNA on the roof

name: plop!
description:
Welcome to our wild and whimsical dancefloor, where the vibes are as sexy as they are hilarious! Picture a vibrant space filled with young, adventurous souls ready to unleash their inner party animal. PLOP is a playground of creativity, featuring DJs spinning the hottest house & techno beats that will keep you dancing until the sun goes down.

Costumes are a must hereâ€”think playful, provocative, and downright outrageous! Whether you're rocking pasties, neon tutus, or something kinkier, you'll fit right in. Join us for one of our daytime dance parties or evening happyhours filled with laughter, freedom, and a sprinkle of mischief. This is the place to let loose, connect with like-minded individuals, and make memories you won't remember.
landmark: Big antique "LIQUOR" sign and desert camo netting

name: Black Rock Yacht Club
description: We share our love of sailing by offering instruction, and use of our fleet of wind-powered rigs
landmark: Orange wind sock, Red BRYC banners on tall masts

name: Snacklandia
description:
Snacklandia is a whimsical camp serving up surprise snack and drink pairings through our interactive Spinning Wheel.
Each spin brings a random delightâ€”salty, sweet, spicy, or maybe a group hug. New this year is our Nail Art Station, where Burners can express their favorite Burning Man principles through creative, glitter-filled nail art. With daily tastings, playful workshops, and spontaneous fun, Snacklandia invites you to come curious and leave deliciously surprised.
landmark: Snacklandia Sign

name: Do More Now
description: The Firehouse bar at Do More Now is the best little hangout in the neighborhood.  We have parties, events, workshops, and performances happening every day. Come and introduce yourself!
landmark: 3 story building painted in red brick

name: Space Cats Karaoke & Comedy
hometown: Bay Area, CA and Los Angeles, CA
description: Enjoy cool beverages, impeccably timed snacks, gut laughs and hearty camaraderie through comedy and karaoke with your friends, the Space Cats!  We do it for the love. You know you're curiousâ€¦stop by for open karaoke, or earn a spot to make us laugh with your comedy tight five.
landmark: Big "Car Dealership" style sign

name: Pour Decisions Winery
description: Come make good decisions at Pour Decisions Winery while listening to mediocre music.
landmark: Anti-gravity device

name: GDI's - Gawd Damn Independents
description: We're the GDI's (Gawd Damn Independents), and we're working for the Man - We are Gerlach-ians, Reno-ites, plus one gawd damn Canuck -  all with "Playa MacGyver" skill sets. Drop in late afternoon or late at night as you might catch us enjoying a hot coffee or cold one...after work. Pull up; dust off a chair and share your best "There was this one time at Burning Man" story around our fire-pit. We might trade a trinket, a laugh, or one of our stories for your effort. We have Burned forever, and we long the days of Cacophonic attitudes; however - if speed past our camp on a 'lectric bike - that'll be us - yelling at you -  "SLOW the F*** down...". Dusty hugs and squinty eyed smiles back at yah; "In Dust - We can Trust".  Peace, Love & Hugs - the GDI's. (insert smiley emoji "here").
landmark: Brown Mailbox with 8:14+G (GDI) on it.

name: Camp BYUS
landmark: Hand Painted Banner that says "Camp ByUs"

name: Amulet
hometown: All Corners of the globe, but mostly SF Bay Area
description: Whether you seek magic or inspiration, join us at Camp Amulet.  At our Amulet table, you'll be gifted a brass dog tag; pre-stamped with the Burning Man symbol. Our highly skilled Amulet Counselors will guide and inspire you to make your mark, and answer the great pressing questions of your life as you customize your Amulet. Using metal stamping tools you can add names, numbers, symbols, astrological signs, and Viking runes.  After you have all the answers, we'll put your Amulet on a necklace, keychain or bracelet for you when you're finished.
landmark: Two 15' tall yellow/blue Amulet flags lit at night

name: Camp Hotdog
description: We bring the hotdog, we are the hotdog. We relish every opportunity to ketchup with old friends or meat new ones. Hot weiners, cold drinks, cool tunes, what else do you need? We are here to help you find the true condiment of your soul. Stop by the Triple D Diner for the coffee and grilled cheese, but stay for the good ol fashioned camaraderie. What'll ya have, hun?
landmark: 30 ft high LED hotdog on a skewer

name: Red.it.be
description: Red.it.be is a techno camp at Burning Man that channels the Berlin club scene with the best techno music and a giant dark cube dance floor. During the day, it's a chill-out space, and at night, the party continues with high-quality techno music. The camp is open to everyone and encourages self-expression.
landmark: red leds cube dance space awesome techno

name: A&mpersand
description: Need a respite from the heat of the playa? Camp "&" invites you to come enjoy our shave ice, spam musubi and more at our Hawaii themed afternoon events.
landmark: & sign

name: Tazii
description: Join us for rest, ease, and libations in the Tazii Moroccan Tent chill lounge 24 hours a day! Our bar is filled with pillows and rugs to get cozy with new and old friends. Swamp-cooled during the day for the perfect nap, themed cocktails in the evening to inspire a great night, and good times all the time.
landmark: Large, three spired tent

name: I Forgot!
description: Welcome to I Forgot.  We are an art / human support camp supporting several playa art pieces.  In camp we have the Playa Mart with all the items you forgot like sun glasses, tooth paste, etc. and shade lounge for relaxation  and free Wifi.  Open from 12 noon to 5:00 pm and more...  Refresh with a cold water, a chance to cool off in the mist and check email with loved ones who could not make the Playa.  You can also meet Burning Man artists that camp with us and you can volunteer to help with their art.  We have an art garden in camp as well as art support vehicles to support our Playa art.
landmark: I Forgot Signs

name: Honey Pot Tea House
description:
Come sit by our fire, enjoy a cup of tea, and a side of Burning Man that is connective, simple, and grounding. 
Sunset-sunrise tea service. Cozy fire pit. Daily workshops.
landmark: bright yellow geodesic dome and large blue trailer

name: Endstation
description: Welcome to Camp Endstation, your intimate oasis at Burning Man. Dive into deep human connections in our cozy space adorned with cushions and rugs, all set to the backdrop of soothing lounge music. Receive a crafted ticket to explore scheduled and spontaneous activities, and engage in meaningful conversations sparked by our unique 'Who Cards'. Each morning, our pavilion transforms into a coffee bar with massages, promoting reflection and connection. Embrace the tranquility of our communal area, designed with an enchanting oriental atmosphere for relaxation and nightly festivities. Our camp is a sanctuary for shared stories and experiences, inviting you to rediscover yourself and connect deeply with fellow burners.
landmark: Large stretch tent with Endstation logo

name: Surly Camp
description: Surly Camp is the home for the The SurlyBird mutant vehicle. Well over 20+ years in the making.
landmark: Red Surly mailbox, red shade structure

name: Frothin' Weirdos
description: A collective of international miscreants with a shared goal to make the world weirder..er!!!
landmark: Weirdo Baby Head

name: Lucid Paradise
description:
Welcome dusty traveler, to Lucid Paradise - a universe born from our collective vision to awaken wonder within the hearts of all who enter. 

As the sun dips below the horizon and the stars ignite the sky, surrender yourself to the magic of our dreamlike wonderland. Behold the illuminated flower garden and a floating blossoming Lantern Wall that casts a spellbinding glow.

Afternoons, come savor our ice-cold che dessert with fruits and jellies, and evenings, come try our late night snacks -- spank musubis, dirty sausages, and more. 

Experience a full sensorial immersion that will leave you breathless and yearning for more.
landmark: Multicolored Lantern Wall

name: Bao Chicka Wow Wow
description:
Come hungry, not hangry.
Visit Bao Chicka Wow Wow to taste our bao (dim sum buns)!

Fill your belly with our fresh and delicious steamed-to-order pork, red-bean, and custard bao.

Hours:
Sunday Sunset: 5pm - 8pm (SUN)
Brunch: 11am - 2pm (MON, TUES, WED)
landmark: "Bao Chicka Wow Wow" sign

name: Clown Car Camp
description: Clown Car Camp, home of the Animal Art Car!
landmark: Wanderlust and sultry lounge.

name: Goat Energy
description: Camp Goat Energy helps you align with your highest self. Through rituals, games, and connection-based experiences like "Messages from the Universe" and radical self-expression activities, we create a vibrant, empowered, and sustainable playa home.
landmark: Look for "Goat Energy" under color-changing LEDs.

name: Baalam
description: Our camp offers a vibrant, interactive space dedicated to community connection and fun. We provide free Mexican coffee, chocolate, and sweets, along with chill areas and casual activities for everyone to enjoy. We encourage creativity, inclusivity, and exploration, inviting all Burners to experience a warm and welcoming atmosphere where everyone can feel at home. Join us for a unique experience where sharing, laughter, and new friendships are at the heart of everything we do.
landmark: Illuminated Mayan sign and banners at night

name: Oracle Camp
description: Oracle Camp provides I-Ching and Kuan Yin readings everyday, all day and Tarot Card readings throughout the week depending on scheduling.
landmark: Oracle Camp sign

name: Funky Town
landmark: tan multi-triangle shade with 2 story DJ booth

name: Do What You Will
description: Come one, come all! Join us and Do What You Will in either our sober area or our bar area. We have games, activities, parties, art tours, and cold brew. We welcome all to swing by and kick your feet up, have a drink, play some games or just...Do What You Will
landmark: teal and yellow lockers that say Do What You Will

name: Strong Tonic Center for Vitality
description: Seeking the remedy for your malady? Step right up! Our incontrovertible methods are proven(ish).
landmark: Snake oil cart (wrapped scaff) with octopus banner

name: Astropups
description: Fun, Frisky, and Fabulous! Exploring the Playaverse one Open Heart at a time.
landmark: beige carports with a ground-level ASTROPUPS sign

name: Secret Passage
description: Art Support Camp for PATCHES.  Come kick up your feet, chill out, and learn about the building of our art project in our Museum tent.
landmark: neon pink "Secret Passage" sign on white tent

name: Camp Orange
description: In 2025, Camp Orange will return to Black Rock City, and our 16-foot tall banana stand will once again tower erect over the Playa â€” a shining, lighted beacon for all citizens of BRC in search of a place to rest their weary, dusty bananas! Join us for chocolate covered frozen bananas, fruity frozen drinks, silly dance parties, fun and educational sessions inside our cozy dome, or just to hang out and have a good time.
landmark: 16-foot banana stand, orange geodesic dome

name: Happy Hour
description: Hard day on the playa? Unwind at Happy Hour, where you'll be greeted by one of a kind refreshing spirits served with smiles! Enjoy our lounge, bar, and dance floor! Start your day with Happy Hour!
landmark: Bright Round Happy Hour Sign & Ethiopian Flag

name: Camp Hot Cheeks
description: Camp Hot Cheeks is a theme camp focused on having fun, engaging with BRC community, inviting people to enjoy our lounge and nonsense. We host an annual event the Sunday after the man burns called Sake Bomb Sunday. Sake Bomb Sunday is an end of burn tradition at Camp Hot Cheeks. It is a day of celebration and camaraderie. Burners from all walks of life come together to enjoy sake bombs and celebrate the end of the burn.
landmark: Yellow Camp Hot Cheeks Sign and couch and rugs.

name: Sake To Me
description: Sake To Me - your friendly playa servers of various chilled and flavored sake. There's plenty of sake and chill in our shaded, cushion-ish area, plus giant Jenga and other games for all!
landmark: 30' x 40' red EZ-Ups and neon Sake To Me sign

name: A Transformation Station
description:
Explore, Engage, Evolve: Transformation Amidst the Magic of Burning Man.

Discover a world where transformative experiences and interactive art merge to create a sanctuary of healing, reflection, and communal celebration. Dive into classes or workshops during the day, sign up for 1-1 healings, and co-create collective narratives that envision a future of interconnectedness and environmental consciousness. Join us to embrace a journey of self-discovery, connection, and personal growth, set against a backdrop of music, meditation, and the magic of shared experiences!
landmark: A Transformation Station sign

name: You Look Amazing
description:
You Look Amazing is not just a camp name, but a state of mind. We LOVE each and everyone of you and want to get to know you better. 

Our camp is an oasis of wellness at Burning Man. Where mind, body, and spirit converge in a harmonious dance of rejuvenation and exploration. Nestled amidst the pulsating energy of the playa, our camp offers a sanctuary unlike any otherâ€”a haven where participants can immerse themselves in a holistic journey of self-discovery and transformation.

Join us for yoga, mindfulness, workshops, dancing and the best crepes you've ever had, we promise. They're better than sex. 

So come, weary travelers, and let us wrap you in dusty hugs and smiles. Tell us your stories and we'll tell you ours.
landmark: White Tent with Signage: You Look Amazing

name: Hush Hush Pony Barn
description: Hush Hush Pony Barn is exciting to bring two offerings to playa: Our beloved Mutant Vehicle made out of reclaimed fence board (formerly known as the Trash Fence) and our brand new interactivity Gossip & Guillotines. They say you'll lose your head at Burning Man! Come see what the rumor mill and the gallery are all chatting about.
landmark: bloody guillotine

name: Pepperland
description:
Pepperland is your Playa home for the newbie and the veteran.
We are a mellow camp with a Beatles vibe that will send you on a Magical Mystery Tour.
We have a lot of workshops we do in camp, so many to choose from! You can also just stop by and relax in the Octopus's Garden and chill out!
landmark: Yellow Submarine Flag   Large Walrus inflated

name: Krepe Burners
landmark: Rogue Nation Village banner

name: ASTRO SHACK JaVa JoINt
hometown: Eta Carinae Nebula, Milky Way Galaxy
description: Delicious coffee served in a cool space with extraordinary hospitality. Fresh ground French press dark roast brewed black as the depths of interstellar space itself (BYO creamer if you must adulterate). The hangout for quasi-legal alien beatniks, mutant cyborg gear heads, trans-solar scooter gangs, radical anarchist raypunks, neuroatypical geeks, freaked-out psychonauts, and caffeine fiends of every stripe.
landmark: Firehouse (3-5 story bldg painted like firehouse)

name: Chain Reaction
description:
Roll on by our camp for friendly bike repairs! Whether it's a flat, a squeaky chain, or some Playa mystery, we've got your bike covered so you can keep cruising without a hitch. We're here to get your ride back in action so you can keep the fun going.

But it's not just about repairsâ€”we've created a super chill space to relax, swap stories, and soak up the good vibes. Whether you need a quick fix, a break from the dust, or just want to hang out with fellow Burners, we've got great company and a laid-back atmosphere waiting for you.

And if you can't make it to us, don't worry! We actively cruise around the Playa looking for bikes in need of some TLC. Flag us down, and we'll get you back on track! Plus, if you're extra comfy, we can even make house calls!
landmark: Chain Reaction sign in front of our camp.

name: BUBBLEGASM
description: Bubblegasm is a mutant vehicle built to spread the joy of bubbles and lights with all those who ride on her or dance and play around her. Bubbles are a metaphor for life, fleeting and fragile and are a reminder about how precious our time is while we are here, and to make the most of each moment. And like each bubble, each person and their life is beautiful and unique. Bubbles are also temporary and once they pop they become part of the universe, just as we do when we die. When people encounter bubbles it is a like a rare moment of magic. They symbolize our childhood innocence, reminding us of a time when life was simple and carefree. When we see these glass-like orbs dancing in the air they remind us to live in the moment, let go, dance with a stranger, be silly - have a bubblegasm!
landmark: 2  white shade structures with Bubblegasm banners

name: Valhalla On The Playa
description:
Friendliest Viking Bar you'll ever find! We offer a shady lounge, full bar, with silly and not-so-silly interactivity while you sip on a delicious cold drink. Come by for one of our specialty drink happy hours, featuring drinks such as fresh watermelon daiquiris, solar Margaritas, and Mead! 
Our music always meets the vibe and raises it up a notch! Come celebrate Black Rock City in Valhalla!
landmark: Black, white, and red Viking Flags

name: Nocino's
description: That cozy social place where people come to hang after a long day of [redacted] and [censored] to connect with beer, pizza, and good music.
landmark: Pink and yellow flags on top of a 16' parachute

name: Juicy Rootz
description:
Welcome to Juicy Rootz, where the fruit is juicy, the vibes are juicier. Swing by and meet us, the delightfully playful, slightly unhinged, and always heart-centered Juicies! We're serving up two workshops/parties where you can get your hands sticky making wearable art out of dried, resin-soaked citrus. That's rightâ€”your new accessory is made of fruit. 
Come for the fruit, stay for the unfiltered joy, the spontaneous dance-offs, and when you're dehydrated from all that wiggling, we've got you covered with non-alcoholic electrolyte drinks at our "Juice Bar".
landmark: bright yellow sign, and faux fruit entrance

name: Camp to be Continued...
description: Camp To Be Continued... is the home of the Playa Pet Adoption Center and a wonderful saloon. Look for the Poohrimeter and stop in to adopt a new friend and sip on something cool and delicious.
landmark: Poohrimeter (hundreds of Poohs sewn together)

name: Dickstracted Camp
description: The Dickstracted Camp is and adult-gay oriented camp emphasized on bringing exhibitionism and voyeurism to the playa.
landmark: Giant Mobil dick

name: Catawampus
description:
As the bass fades and the creaking of your bike becomes audible once again, you turn onto tan unfamiliar street.  Appearing as the breeze sweeps the dust from the ground is a warmly lit wooden cottage, beckoning with firelight and the soft sound of mandolin and laughter.

Catawampus is ramshackle and sincere, just like our group of members, relationships and structures built with love and found materials. We spread the mantra of "magically imperfect", both in our on playa offerings and in our compassion for all people. We tap into the old wisdom, of the land and ancestors, worn but still worthy, to bring comfort and connection to all who venture to our porch. We are askew, perfect in our irregularity, having found a place that only we fit. You will fit too.
landmark: Crooked wooden cottage

name: SlÃ¶MÃ³th
description:
SlÃ¶MÃ³th is the birth of night striving toward the light â€” a space where all participants become moths, both visually and philosophically. Inspired by post-modernist ideas, our camp blends curiosity, playfulness, and the irresistible pull toward brightness.

Spot our mischievous moths by their Fluffy Pink Coats, Wiggling Antennae or at least The Moustache. If we're not in camp, we're flocking toward distant lights or performing a ritual at our beloved installation â€” The Moth.
landmark: Pink lounge and campfire

name: Synaesthesia
description: Camp Synaesthesia is a dreamworld where movement, sound, and light unite. Come play on our 26' tower, dance to live music and DJ sets, enjoy a refreshing NA beverage, and vibe with our signature bass floor installation.
landmark: 26' tower, glowing 'Synaesthesia' sign, and stage

name: Carrot Tribe
description: Carrot Tribe is a self-care sanctuary where you can unwind, refresh, and glow with carrot-infused treatments. From soothing carrot seed oil massages to hydrating face masks, we'll pamper you from root to tip. Sip on a carrot juice mimosa and let your stress veg out in our cozy, shaded oasis!
landmark: Carrot Tribe signs on both entrances.

name: Edna's Oasis
description: Edna's Oasis, where the elephants instinctively flock like the bassheads of capastrano. Feel the rumble of every step.
landmark: two containers billboard shade structure between

name: Deco Fish
description: The DECO FISH ART CARS ARE exotic creatures of the deep. Bright rainbows of glorious PSYCHEDELIC illumination, with powerful FIRE effects and rockin' sound systems laced up with intricate ART DECO styling throughout.  Come and say HI! And we'll give you a ride you won't forget.
landmark: DECO FISH Camp Marker.  It says "Deco Fish".

name: Prawn Shop
description: Welcome to The Prawn Shop at Burning Man, your one-stop shop for underwater misadventures! Dive into our Deep Sea Dive Bar if you dare, and try not to spill your Bloody Mary while losing at Prawn Shop Blackjack. Find refuge (or maybe just more chaos) in Trader's Cove dome. Our Bloody Marys are as infamous as our hospitality is questionable. Brace yourself for late-night shenanigans, sea-themed absurdity, and questionable dance moves under the stars. Forget the treasure; the real prize is surviving the fun!
landmark: Shrimp Beacon

name: CAMP WWIT
description: CAMPWWIT is place to ask yourself the question, "Wait, What's In This?" We explore the playa experience through snarky reflection, encouraging internal monologue and external dialogue through games, drinks, and music. With everything going on during the burn, we hope you can reflect on what's going on inside you with others to help bring these playa lessons out into the default world!
landmark: Large frontage that says Wait What's In This?

name: 42 Ramen
description: We know the answer to the ultimate question. If you know it, come and tell us to claim your yummy prize.
landmark: Big red maze

name: EMan Camp
landmark: Oracle Exchange table in the shape of a pentagon

name: BRC Snow Club
description: Welcome shredders! BRCSC is the home of the first (and only) ski slope on the Playa! Come get outfitted for boots and skis or a board in our Rental Shop, then ascend the slope to rip down our 60-foot long, multi-tiered dry ski hill! Don't ski or snowboard, no problem! We'll have saucers aplenty for shredders of all ages to come and fly down the slope! Also hosting nightly AprÃ¨s Ski parties with phenomenal DJs, performers, and more! â„)'(â„
landmark: 14' tall ski slope and LED man head sign

name: Last Camp Standing
description: Haggard? Wrecked? Us too! Stop into Last Camp Standing for refuge, games, workshops and more!
landmark: Large red and white striped Circus Tent

name: Nightchaser's Dusty Disco
description:
Queerest Lil Cocktail Party - Sunset Dance Parties Daily with delicious libations!
Immersive Late Night Dance Extravaganzas with Killer Djs, Super Fun Bar, Dancers and Fire Performances Nightly!
Sound Baths and Meditation moments here and there and an interactive shadow box to play in! ALL are WELCOME!
landmark: THREE WHITE CIRCUS TENT PEAKS w rainbow lighting

name: Soon to be Infamous
description: Your burn is Soon to Be Infamous! Stop by and decorate a flag with your playa name and address during our Don't Fucking Leave Your Fucking Bike on the Fucking Playa! Bicycle Flag Creation Station Events and help us end bikicide, the careless abandonment of an innocent bike to wither and die on the playa.
landmark: Bar, St.Andrews Cross, Shade with couches

name: Discrace
description:
Do you know how much beer can fit inside a frisbee? Join us to find out, play ultimate frisbee, and other fun competitions with fellow burners!

Ultimate Frisbee is an inclusive, spirited community based around a self-officiated "sport", with events primarily organized by players themselves and gifting each other silly things. Sure feels a lot like Burning Man to us.

We're here to share ultimate frisbee with Burners, and also maybe drink those 54 ounces of beer.
landmark: Carport with Discrace sign (lit at night) hanging

name: Neodebauchery
description: We are a throng of dome-dwelling miscreants, hooligans, bloviators, simps, warlocks, horse girls, diggerfish, and charlatans. As one of the aforementioned groups, your birthright compels you to complete the pilgrimage to the fabled land of Neodebauchery. A melange of tomfoolery new and old, Neodebauchery provides a welcoming space for weirdos of all creeds, colors, and degree of crustiness. Come gyrate to the soothing, yet somehow also abrasive melodies of our human-DJ chimeras, witness visual distortion unlike you have seen (since your last burn) with our procedurally generated Digital Domeflesh, and participate in our daily sinful activities.
landmark: Silver geodesic dome and a large shade structure

name: De Zula
description: Join us 24/7 Zula Chill Zone to relax and unwind.
landmark: Zula Chill Zone

name: KashyyyK
description: Your favorite wookiees are back! Swing by the legendary Wookiee Bodega, open daily from 12â€“5PM. Modeled after a classic NYC corner store, it's stocked with playa essentials (sunscreen, tampons, reusable water bottles) and completely unnecessary treasures (bedazzled jewelry, candy bars, knick-knacks galore). This year we've expanded the magic with Wardrobi, our free-playa costume closet where you can dress to express. Come for the goods, stay for the pop-up surprises, and return at night to gather 'round our public fire pitâ€”a cozy, low-key hang spot for stories, laughs, and maybe a snack if you catch us at the right time.
landmark: Stoop: stairs & doors. lights will read: KASHYYYK

name: Dusty Dillas
description: Experience the Wild Wild West at Dusty Dillas, a Western themed bar and a quesadilla saloon. Here you'll find comfort in assless chaps, refreshing libations, and some cheesy goodness. Come on down for a dusty good time and a chance to spin the wheel to determine your luck in the dust, lasso some bulls, or have a high noon duel.
landmark: Big Dusty Dillas sign and swinging saloon doors

name: Wok Paper Scissors
description: Welcome to Wok Paper Scissors! Here in Sizzle City you battle for your stir fry. Come one, come all to Wok Paper Scissors, serving stir fry on the playa daily. To get your hands on a bowl of our delicious delights, you must first win a game of rock-paper-scissors! Do you have what it takes when noodles are at stake?
landmark: Large Wok Paper Scissors Take-out box & Scissors

name: Thirst Trap
description: Feeling thirsty? We're bringing playful mischief back to the playa with a game that will have your mouth feeling drier than the playa. But don't worry, at our lush oasis we'll quench your thirst with ice-cold drinks and whimsical vibes.
landmark: pink flags and pink signage indicating Thirst Trap

name: Kostume Kult
description: Join us at Kostume Kult for daytime costume gifting, transformations, and costume runway shows (M-F 12:00-5:00), with evening events and dance parties. Born in NYC and baptized in BRC, we gift truckloads of costumes to those eager to strut down our runway with encouragement of our Emcees and DJ's, out onto Esplanade and out into your new Playa life. Also featuring a crafting tent, variety shows, fire performances, and random absurdities. Don't miss our annual Block Party on Wednesday night.
landmark: Brightly Illuminated Empire State Building

name: BAAAHS Station
description:
We're the home of BAAAHS: the Big-Ass Amazingly Awesome Homosexual Sheep. You might know us as the 40-foot long rolling disco whose entrance, naturally, is through the pulsing pink sphincter in the rear. Day and night, we graze on the playa â€” laser eyeballs shining, beloved DJs spinning, dancy people flocking.
BAAAHS Station is our central depot where everyone is welcome to kick up your hooves. Come for our daily dance parties, get a view from our four-story watchtower, enjoy a lovely beverage from our friendly bartenders, and meet a homo or two.
We're builders, artists, and techies at heart. Our DJ line-up combines world-famous names with up-and-cumming performers, with a focus on featuring queer artists. Our mission? Shear queer bliss.
landmark: 30' tall glowing art deco tower

name: Beverly Grillz
description: The playa's home for grilled meatz and exotic beatz. We are a boutique hospitality camp ready to serve.  We believe in radical inclusion and invite you to participate in our love and nourishment.
landmark: Marquee Beverly Grillz sign, 50' stretch tent

name: Camp NOT a Cult!
description: Camp Not a Cult provides an alcohol-free, sobriety-supportive space for new and experienced burners which is light-hearted, sarcastically and not culty. We believe that by removing alcohol from our lives we have unlocked a way to live more authentically, feel better, and have more FUN every single day. And that doesn't make us boring. You still find us howling at the moon, wild-eyed and sometimes naked, dancing around the fire. Rather than daily recovery meetings, we offer a variety of yoga and meditation classes and workshops, a cacao ceremony & ecstatic dance, a fire-spinning workshop for beginners, Ayurvedic wisdom, 1-2 sober/sober-curious meetups, and other events. All these events will be open to the community.
landmark: There are two green ET and a lighted sign.

name: UCamp
description: We are an art support camp that brings together Ukrainian artists and helps with installations. We organize various events featuring electronic music, traditional cuisine, and performances. We welcome everyone who is interested and can contribute to improving the project or enhancing our experience and joy at Burning Man.
landmark: Sign UCamp with big Ukrainian flag on a flagpole

name: Vitruvian
description: Turn your world upside down at Vitruvian Lounge. Enjoy good gyrations by taking a spin on our Human Sized Gyroscope, and stay to enjoy good vibrations in our lounge with great music, ice cold craft cocktails, and nightly hot tea service. Explore the edges of your mind and body with regularly scheduled sound baths, meditations, and workshops hosted by our campers. Head into the K-Box for Korean-style private room karaoke to sing the night away together from 9pm to sunrise.
landmark: 15 foot hexagonal gyroscope

name: planet wood collective
description:
Campers: designers, architects, and engineers in the built Environment.

Focus on the development of low-carbon infrastructure and living in Black Rock City. Give back to the community by sharing knowledge from yearly experimentation and iterations.
landmark: wood tower

name: Acid On Ice
description: Step into a snowstorm of silliness at Acid on Ice! We're a frosty oasis serving chilled vibes, mulled wines, and warm welcomes. Join us at our snow-themed lounge and bar for mist-cooled hangouts, icy karaoke, and popsicle mischief. Whether you're escaping the heat or diving into connection, our camp is your winter wonderland in the dust.
landmark: Blow-up snowman and a frosty bar

name: Spice N Vice
description: Spice N Vice offers Bedouin hospitality every day from 10am-6 p.m. Visit us for some hot or cold chai tea. Or join us for one of our workshops. Our comfortable oasis is also the perfect place to take a break from the sun and talk to one of our travel sages for stories about life abroad and travel advice.
landmark: The large red bedouin tent and Spice N Vice flags

name: Tropical Lunartics
description: Tropical happy hour featuring pina colada slushies (contains alcohol) and spam musubi
landmark: Lit signage includes camp name, crescent moon, sun

name: Placement HQ
description: Placement HQ is the official location of the Placement office on playa. We are at Esplanade & 5:45 - stop by to get in touch with your placers, to check in for a PEERS shift, or just to say hi!
landmark: Placement HQ sign

name: Wrongtown
description:
Wrongtown is an international family reunion gathering year round at events around the globe including Burning Man which is the main event! We have members on almost every Continent and from all walks of life.

Our goal is to create a community space for our friends and family to experience the playa to its fullest. The camp works together to provide everything needed to survive on the playa including an amazing chill space, equipped kitchen, covered tent city and camp showers. While Wrongtown provides the infrastructure, everyone is expected and counted on to work, to build, strike and keep things running during the event including internal camp operations as well as running interactivity.

Providing everything to survive allows our campmates to focus on amazing projects and epic performances
landmark: 40 Foot Beacon, Wrongtown Sign and Vertical Flags.

name: Square One
description: A diverse group united in creating large-scale art through efficient and sustainable designs, inspiring individuals and other camps to burn stronger. Our efficiency-driven approach allows us to contribute more to the community. We modify and use Burning Manâ€“centric shipping containers for our camp activities, including the B&B BBQ and our 35-foot hammock Nest tower. We operate two large art cars: Sparky (Hot Sauce) and Eden. We also provide logistical and power support for various playa art projects.
landmark: 40' shipping containers and a 38' hammock tower

name: Atomic Pussy Photo Lounge
description: Come visit what is easily the 3rd best Bar/Lounge and Photo Booth on the playa. Returning this year is Weir(d) Wednesday, when we'll be serving up a hero dose of the Grateful Dead all afternoon. Also returning this year is our twin-tip, reverse camber Shot-Ski (for those playa face shots), the Elaine Benes Dance Experience (dance classes for dance-introverts) â€“ and of course the photo booth, photo art, and photo gifts. New this year is Atomic Yoga on Thursday mid-morning, led by our certified instructors. Noon-6pm M-T-W-F and late night on Thursday. Lounge space is 24 hrs.
landmark: Camp Banner - Atomic Pussy Photo Lounge

name: Cold Yogis
description:
Cold Yogis exist to awaken terrestrial spirit, creative life force and ancestral resiliency by wilfully disrupting the status quo and immersing into the true self! 

We offer workshops for breathwork, cold exposures, brain over body techniques, verbal liberation, yoga and tantra to increase health, self awareness, and consciousness. We host playa's most epic Ecstatic Dances.
We are an international camp that shares space with DECENTRAL, Naked Heart and others.
landmark: We have a huge lit up COLD YOGIS sign at the front

name: Rears! Bar and Hill
description: Prepare yourself for an extraordinary adventure at the residence of Hippie Hill Mutant Vehicle and 'Rears!' themed bar. Come and join Norm and the rest of the crew to make unforgettable memories that will last a lifetime... or at least a few hours.
landmark: The Hanging Hexagonal Rears! Bar Sign

name: Critical Connections
description: Connections make us a collective being. They are all critical to us. And Puppets.
landmark: Puppet Theater

name: Playa Circuit Boogie
description: Here at Playa Circuit Boogie we use circuits and science to spark ideas and bring strangers together, all while jamming out to groovy tunes and enjoying a cold beverage from our bar. Come learn the basics of soldering and circuit building; ride away with your very own light-up pendant and the skills to make an even better one next year. And bring us your broken electronics during repair hours, we'll try our best to get them working.
landmark: Orange, purple, and red triangular flags

name: GLAMCOCKS
description: GlamCocks is a global family that was started at Burning Man, and is dedicated to creating extraordinary experiences that celebrate and encourage burner principles, GlamCockery, bringing people together to find inspiration and creativity, and to express their fabulous, authentic selves. We believe that creativity, authenticity, and love for yourself and others are critical to having meaningful connections that make life fulfilling.
landmark: Huge Rooster Head Tower w/ Neon ribbon ceiling

name: Yes Do That!
description: Come by for the fire pit community in the wee hours. Work through your dilemmas with us using the Ten Principles and refill your electrolytes. Sing with us. We're healers, nurses, and artists, queer and straight from around the world, with open arms and all ears.
landmark: Yes Do That Blue Flag

name: Comfy Cozy Community College
landmark: Giant Metal Comfy Cozy Sign

name: I Miss My Dog Cafe
description:
I Miss My Dog Cafe is a community cafe uniting people over our love of all animals.

A colorful dog installation welcomes our guests, who are invited to relax in the intimate ambiance of dog-themed decor. Our on-duty dog-tor (human therapy dog) will enthusiastically greet you and dexterously serve whatever drool-worthy refreshments the house is cooking that day. Sit and stay for dog-themed events or to share stories (AND PICS) of your furry friends.

We host hot dog parties, serving traditional and vegan options. Our day starts bright and early with a sunrise coffee, tea, and kibble cereal bar. Stop by to send your pup (or kitty) a postcard from playa or leave a message for passed four-legged friend and we'll memorialize them. Laugh, cry, and all the feels in between â€“ we're here for it.
landmark: Tie-Dye Dog Head!

name: In Queso Emergency
description: Legendary breakfast tacos & cold brew coffee service with a side of cheesemÃ©
landmark: In Queso Emergency Sign & LED Canopy

name: Mystopia
description: Step out of the sun-scorched wonderland into our cool haven. It's an icy oasis, an ice cream paradise, and a sanctuary for all. We welcome everyone: friends, partners, parents, children, individuals of any race, orientation and identity. Stop by our burner family and experience the rainbow of diversity. Come play with us, sit down and watch some drag/burlesque, dance with a stranger or simply relax on bean bags surrounded by refreshing mist.
landmark: Circus tent w/ neon flags & rainbow Mystopia sign

name: Pancake Playhouse
description: Come by Pancake Playhouse Monday through Friday from 11AM to 1PM for the brunch party of your playa dreams - pancakes, cocktails, games and uplifting and often disco-y beats!
landmark: Large and sparkly stack of pancakes!

name: SAHARAA CAMP
description:
AKA Sahar art camp
Honoring the Spirit of Morocco,
Trance. Tradition. Transformation.
Ancestral echoes rising,
From the Atlas to the Playa.
landmark: Pumpkin large tent structure

name: EBB & Glow Village
description:
Come get your glow on at EBB & Glow Village! 

Enter the BRC Piano Bar and quench your thirst, enjoy live music or get on stage yourself for karaoke or a jam. Learn how to ride a OneWheel at Keeping it Wheel and join our group rides. Enjoy morning yoga or evening cocktails and DJs on the SkyDeck. Get your gorgeous playa portrait shot by pros at Just Shoot Me in the Dust photo studio. Broken bike? Cranky and Sons Bike Repair will help you get rolling again. Hop a ride on the Peter Panda mutant vehicle.  Or relax and recover in our Glow Zone spa. All this and more!
landmark: SkyDeck, a shade covered space atop 3 containers

name: Milk + Honey
description: Milk + Honey is a multicultural camp with Jewish roots that remains guided by the principles of Jewish culture and tradition. Our guiding principles include: community building and support, the belief that food and the table are a place to nourish and gather, expression through dance and movement, intellectual introspection, loving our neighbors as ourselves, and more. We are a welcoming and inclusive tight-knit community of all types of people. Our camp is meant to be a home, not just a place to live, for our campers. We are stewards of the Burning Man principles and culture that provide engaging interactivity and a gathering place for citizens of Black Rock City at large. Our campers span a wide array of creative pursuits, skills, and passions.
landmark: Giant Milk + Honey banner hung from 53' container

name: Memento Mori
description:
Life, Death and Sexi Breakfast!

At Burning Vitae we nourish your body and invigorate your soul!

Come experience the sexiest breakfast on playa followed by powerful life and death reflective exercises.

Who says the most important meal of the day can't also be the sexiest?
landmark: A wooden gate with the large double doors

name: French Manila
description: Our camp is inspired by the melting pot of different cultures and backgrounds of our camp members who are from America, Canada, France, and the Philippines. Our founding crew met in Manila and San Francisco many years ago and we bonded over art, good food, and exploring these cities together. As our family grows over the years, one thing stays true, on playa we love hosting late afternoon themed dance parties with scoops of interactivity mixed in.
landmark: French Manila sign in the front of our camp

name: Short Bus Coffee Camp
description: Proudly serving only the finest Hawaiian coffees and organic accompaniments!  Open Monday thru Saturday
landmark: Yellow Short Bus, white tent with purple curtains

name: Honkers Harbor
description:
Calling all curious birds, wayward wings, and soulful squawkersâ€”
If you've been flying solo or searching for your flock, Honkers Harbor might just be your next nest. We're a neighborhood sanctuary for all species of seekers, honkers, and high-flyers.

Perch beneath a canopy of fluttering fabrics and glowing lights. Sip on a hydrating refreshment or a snow cone while soaking in a soundscape that's equal parts mindful and eclectic. Let the breeze carry your thoughts, your laughter, your longingâ€”for connection, for inspiration, for something more.

We're grateful to be a landing spot on your journey.
landmark: Neon Pink LED Sign

name: Burning Questions
description: Burning Questions offers visitors an escape to a hammock world surrounded by nature. Here to provide you with a comfortable hang space day or night, come climb into our nets and let us take you away to the beach, the forest, or a field filled with our World Famous Crickets. We are a group of friends from around the globe who are excited to build our small sanctuary for you to enjoy!
landmark: 2-masted circus tent with flags + green lasers

name: Martha Love
description:
Come play out fabulous games

Performance Stage

BRC Community space - Stage available for your use - Come and have your presentation in our space. contact us to make a reservation

Martha - Historical Vehicle - Longest continuous art car on the playa . Sharing Love; Jump on board and enjoy the loving company, visit the artists, and the best beats in Black Rock
landmark: Martha Love Sign

name: Bad Idea
description: Welcome to Camp Bad Idea, where we proudly present the Thumberdome! Picture a tiny cage filled with contestants in equally tiny costumes, ready for the ultimate test of strength â€“ thumb wrestling! Join scheduled tournaments, craft miniature costumes, or attend thumb wrestling workshops.  Reveal your inner sock puppet thespian.  Wonder at our rope suspension demonstrations.   Embrace the absurdity, laughter, and warmth of our camp â€“ whether you're a participant or spectator, there's never a dull moment at Bad Idea!
landmark: Tie-Dye Dome

name: Casa
description: WE SERVE AS YOUR HOME AWAY FROM HOME, A SANCTUARY FOR ALL ENCHANTING CREATURES. WITHIN OUR CASA, A COMMUNITY OF ARTISTS, MYSTICS, TEACHERS, AND DREAMERS COME ALIVE TO EMBRACE PROFOUND TRANSFORMATIONS. WELCOME HOME!
landmark: CANOPY INSTALLATION MADE OF HANGING FABRIC SHEET

name: Kinsey Walhberg Field Lab
description: Welcome to the Kinsey Walhberg Field Lab. This groundbreaking camp, developed by the esteemed Lindsey Kinsey and Remy Walhberg, stands at the vanguard of art analysis, offering training for those interested in their unique and comprehensive framework that transcends conventional critique methodologies. Enter KWASI-3. KWASI-3 is not just an assessment tool; it is a revolution in understanding art. Our instrument delves deep into the realms of artistic creation, exploring various dimensions such as Dimensional Topology, Activation Shape, and Materiality. This multidisciplinary approach allows for a holistic understanding of art, enabling critics, artists, and enthusiasts to engage with artworks on a deeper, more meaningful level.
landmark: Kinsey Walhberg metal sign

name: Beardhaus
description: The safe space for weirdos and queerdos to come together and celebrate the ridiculousness of life. Come for beard care, stay for the rachet drag, and shake your ass all the while.
landmark: light up viking beard

name: The G Spot
description: The G Spot is hard to find. A surreal junkyard where anything goes, and nothing is what it seems. Rare pokemon are born here. Come for the mystery, stay for the mayhem.
landmark: Red Lit Shade Sails

name: Alchemy Stop
description: Alchemy Stop is a dusty sanctuary for anyone to enjoy a quiet musical retreat with a cold hand-made limoncello in hand. Look for our open bar and block printing stations - we will be welcoming you with open arms.
landmark: Bar with a large LIMONCELLO sign

name: A Shack of Sit
description:
Do you feel like belting out a karaoke song or letting out your frustrations in our rage cage? Are you looking for a great spot to sit, grab some cold water, and watch the world go by while getting your nails painted, moisturizing your face, and enjoying a percussive massage? Are you looking for the Mensa Camp?
Come visit A Shack of Sit; where sit happens. We will be waiting for you in Snowflake Village.
landmark: chair sign & truss arch, near giant LED snowflake

name: Frizz
description: A chill cafe & bar to come retire at!
landmark: Camp Frizz Flag, White School Bus

name: Karma Love Camp
description: Karma Love Camp is a welcoming oasis designed for connection, relaxation, and playful interaction. We offer body art, wellness experiences, dance, gifting, and a friendly space to simply be. Our camp is a chill rest stop where you can relax, recharge, and connect with new friends. Whether you're looking to join a fun event or just hang out and chat, Karma Love Camp is here to share joy and genuine community with everyone.
landmark: 8ft pole with 50+ colored flags on ropes attached

name: Gravity
description: Camp Gravity is welcoming participants to exploring the beauty and importance of the swamp in the ecology through art installations, activities, and workshops.  We make our space to be fun and engaging as well as an amazing place to dance with top notch music!  Visit us!
landmark: A large elevated sign that says GRAVITY

name: Chez Mirage
description:
Escape to Chez Mirage, where the untamed spirit of the jungle meets the serenity of the desert. Here, under our lush canopy, you're invited to unleash your wild side in an oasis designed for adventure, fun, and deep emotional connections.

Immerse yourself in our Survivor-themed game, where you'll test your limits, strategize with teammates, and experience the thrill of competition and camaraderie. Sing along to Nickelback  while sipping pickleback shots to unwind. As twilight descends, our retreat transforms into an escape from the chaos of Burning Man; gather around the warmth of a cozy campfire, where you'll enjoy the simple pleasure of s'mores and sakes under the stars.

At Chez Mirage, every encounter is designed to leave you with a smile. Join us where the wild play and the wise sway.
landmark: Wooden treehouses, oasis vibes, Chez Mirage sign

name: SUMANAH
description:
At Sumanah, we welcome you into a soulful sanctuary where mornings begin with intention and evenings unfold in magic. Our beloved morning ritual cafÃ© serves freshly brewed coffee, guiding citizens through engaging daily themes, wellness activations, journaling with our Sumanah Print Newspaper, and grounding practices that set the tone for the day ahead.

As the evening unfolds, we transform into a cozy lounge offering evening elixirs, storytelling, music, and ritual gatherings under soft lights and soulful soundscapes. Whether you're starting your day with presence or winding down into connection, Sumanah invites you to drop in, explore, and remember what it feels like to truly arrive.
landmark: colorful fabrics flying in the wind!

name: Phasmantis
description: Phasmantis brings snow cones, pop tarts, and dank beats to the playa. Stop by on a hot day and grab a drink and some saucy snow cones to cool off or get  hot and sweaty with our trained athletes!
landmark: Blue and Green walls

name: LOBE
description:
Hypothesis: Scientifically rigorous yet playful participation enhances your burn.

Intro: LOBE invites you to experiment with our placebo bar, sci-art and brain-inspired activities. 

Specific Aims:

Aim 1) Are you drunk!? Our speakeasy The Double-Blind Pig serves placebo-controlled refreshments. While you sip, ask the local (inebriated?) scientists all your burning questions (results may vary)
Aim 2) Can we tickle your brain!? Play with our interactive neurotech, mind-stretching games, and discover the neuroscience of your favorite drugs!
Aim 3) Ready to blow your mind!? We're not just nerds, we're artists too! Study our scientifically inspired pieces co-created by neuroscientists and friends. 

In summary, WE WANT YOUR BRAINS to test our innovative approach to nerdy fun on the playa!
landmark: A fully illuminated street-facing LOBE sign

name: Art Haus
description: A collective of musicians and dancers dedicated to creating classical and contemporary productions on playa and sharing their art with the citizens of Black Rock City. We are a mix of professional and recreational artists and their supporters from all over the world.
landmark: flat-roof shade, black pennant banners+white logo

name: Camp Reno Nation
description:
Biggest Little Shit Show On The Playa

Great beer; Weird People

Welcome to the Shit-Rock Saloon!
landmark: Reno Nation neon sign

name: Flybynyte
description:
Serving exquisite coffee drinks at the Airport from 8am-noon, Mo-Sat.
Come and enjoy our live music and airport cafe atmosphere while waiting for a flight.
Mo-Fri 10am-noon we will have aviation ground school. Our instructors will give you an introduction to aerodynamics, weather, radio communications, avionics, airspace and all things aviation. We can go as easy or as deep as u like - let's learn about flying in a playful way!
landmark: ctr of the airport village CafÃ© with yellow shade

name: Howzit
description: Double, double toil and trouble: Fire Burn and cauldron bubble. By the pricking of my thumbs, something wicked this way comes... to fill their cups with delightful teas from Howzit's cauldron! Chase away those dry throats. Alcohol free for all ages and sobriety levels. Made with magic and love by the witchy denizens of Howzit.
landmark: Cauldron hanging over the fire pit of skulls

name: Camp Canadianderthal
description: TRAGICALLY HIP LIVE Tuesday at 300pm! Find an outfit in our Cariboutique, offering a curated selection of vintage threads and pre-loved playa wear, refreshed daily. Smack down your northern neighbors in our life-size Whack-Ca-Nuck game. Play some tunes or sing along in our shaded piano lounge. Spreading Canadian love, missing our Phish Phans!
landmark: Whack-Ca-Nuck w/Canadian Flag, Cariboutique, piano

name: Chill Vibez
description: The dome beckons!  We offer a chill space to vibe and hang in our LED powered dome.  We will have music and synchronized LEDs nightly.
landmark: heavily led-ed dome

name: Water Temple
description:
Welcome to Water Templeâ€”a sanctuary of serenity, connection, and renewal in the heart of the playa. We're a theme camp dedicated to holding space for hydration, healing, and human connection through elemental experiences and desert hospitality.

At Water Temple, you'll find: ðŸ’§ Cold, Kombucha  (because hydration is sacred)
ðŸŒ€ Guided meditations & sound baths
ðŸŒ¬ï¸ Shade, chill zones, and high-pressure misting
ðŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸ Yoga & gentle stretching sessions
ðŸ«– Water Temple Speaks- Speaker Series 

We believe in sacred stillness, playful presence, and radical kindness. Whether you're seeking a soft reset or a moment of peace under the dusty sky, our temple doors are open to you.
landmark: Double Tipis and Prayer Wheel on Frontage

name: Snack Shack
description: Home of The World Famous Black Rock City Hotdog Eating Contest. Floggin' and Doggin' since 2022
landmark: Snack Shack sign

name: Portal to the New Earth
description: Art support camp for Om Mani Padmi Hum - I am the Jewel in the Lotus Flower. We host New Earth Visioning meetings everyday at noon from Tuesday to Saturday
landmark: Portal to the New Earth banner

name: Mirage Garage
description: A sheltered, sumptuous place to find cool shade, a refreshing drink, soft pillows, and a place to park your camel.  From New York, the Bay Area, L.A, Colorado, Mexico, New Zealand and beyond, we bring you the best cold brew coffee, a great Tuesday party, our beautiful Henry Chang art car and more! Come by and try our aerials instruction or slings hung from our aerials truss. See our neighborhood 24/7 from our viewing platform. Or just get out of the heat in our main tent, and get some water. Everyone welcome, and police should know that if you don't have an i.d., you will not get served either... we know who you are!
landmark: Big white wedding tent, aerials rig, and art cars.

name: Y Knot Saloon
description: A late 1800s western town with a saloon on wheels, an apothecary, and a water tower. Come for a refreshing beverage, views, and live music.
landmark: water tower and Y Knot Saloon sign on the gate

name: Disorient
description: Disorient has been at Burning Man since 2001. We are art-centered, compassionate, open-source, and, above all, Pornj. We awaken the Disorienter within you and spread the spirit of Disorient far and wideâ€”Do it yourself. Do more. Do it all.
landmark: Big bright orange 20' tall & 60' wide DiS

name: Devachan Lounge
description: Devachan Lounge is a home for art and celebration on the Playa. We offer a beautiful lounge, stage, and performance space open to the public day and night. Come join the fun in our Participatory Dinner Theatre, add to a desert masterpiece in our Community Paint Project, or learn Playa essentials in one of our Cherry Poppers events for new Burners.
landmark: Lounge, Community Paint Project & backlit sign

name: Playa Agora
description: Playa Agora is a vibrant space of connection, curiosity, and community. We host a full week of interactive workshops, morning coffee, and afternoon gatherings designed to spark conversation, inspire creativity, and bring people together. Come learn, share, and laugh with us as we co-create something meaningful at Burning Man 2025.
landmark: Playa Agora sign above 80' white-roofed frontage

name: Mystical Order of Dust andShadows
description: Can you solve enough puzzles to complete our mission to an alien planet?
