landmark: Mystical Order of Dust and Shadows Sign

name: Whynauts
description:
Our mission at The Whynauts is to create a space of curiosity and discovery - encouraging everyone to say, "Why not?" 

Come explore with us with daily 3pm sensory workshops while being served quesadillas & piÃ±a coladas.
landmark: Bright pink neon sign that says "WhyNauts"

name: Illuminaughty
description: Illuminate your naughty side! Come visit our naughty carnival Monday-Thursday 4PM-8PM! Challenge yourself to feats of great debauchery! Tuesday and Thursday, the carnival becomes a riotous party through midnight - just follow the bright lights of our Ball of Light, high in the sky. Come see the Aperiodic Wall, the entrancing optical illusion generator! Enjoy the Chill Room, keeping everyone cool during the day!
landmark: 40 foot tower "Eye of Providence", illuminated

name: Celestial Tea Garden
description: Welcome to Celestial Tea Garden Camp, a vibrant, women-led, multicultural oasis celebrating the rich diversity of culture in our vibrant zen tea dome amidst the dusty canvas of Burning Man. We are multi culture camp bringing asian traditions to the playa. Our camp is a sanctuary where ancient traditions meet modern playfulness, all dedicated to fostering a deep sense of community, understanding, and radical inclusion.
landmark: giant red LED tea dome

name: TBD Camp
description: We know we're not legit anymore, but everything else is still TBD. Come hang out with us and enjoy our chill space, sip on some cold brew, make some shrinky dink art. Write out a postcard to your future self.
landmark: Large flag with a brain on it

name: Weird Steel
description: Welcome to Reared In Steel aka Weird Steel, a dynamic Burningman camp where steel artistry takes center stage. We are a collective of passionate artists and creators dedicated to pushing the boundaries of creativity through the medium of steel and steel-framed art installations. From Rhino Redemption, Medusa, and The Flower Tower, Brass Ring just to name a few. Our camp is a celebration of innovation, imagination, and the transformative power of art.
landmark: The Flower Tower

name: Comfort & Joy
description: Step through our glowing portal into a queer wonderland of dayglo art, towering flags, immersive light, and interactive installations. Lounge in our cuddle space, sweat it out in the 24/7 Pink Gym, or dance until sunrise in Afterglow. Join us for workshops, rituals, drag performances, fresh fruit gifting, and signature events like AcCUMulation and the Consent Carnival. Whether you're here to play, rest, connect, or transform. There's always a place for you within Comfort & Joy.
landmark: towering neon dayglo flags visible from deep playa

name: Census
description: The Census has been collecting information about the population of Black Rock City since 2002. The results of the Census from previous years will be on display at the Census Lab on playa and published in the Population Analysis Report at https://blackrockcitycensus.org
landmark: Pink Census signs/flags and colorful data displays

name: Hard as a Rock
description: A rag-tag bunch of geologists with a passion for sharing geology - including the geology of the Black Rock Desert! Join our geologists for rock talks, get creative with rock painting. Dig up your best rock puns and strike fools gold and other rockin' gifts!
landmark: Turquoise a-frame sign & rock painting

name: The Carrot Club
description:
Our camp is focused on health and happiness; health through fresh vegetables and fruits at the Black Rock Farmers Market in the mornings and happiness and festivities at the Carrot Club in the afternoons. Enjoy tasty, fresh produce to feed the body, refresh the spirit, and nourish the soul! One of the best parts of exploring any
city is checking out the farmer's market- and Black Rock City is no exception! Come try one of our wide array of fresh fruits
and veggies!
In the afternoons, join us for fresh and icy smoothies (boozy or not) as well as occasional fruit and vegetable-based cocktails at the Carrot Club.
landmark: Scaffolding; D-orange streamers, N-giant Carrot

name: Humans Being
description: Salute your Jorts is combining forces with Humans Being. Come by Wednesday for our big Jorts-decorating celebration, and other times throughout the week to lounge in our relaxing tea shanty!
landmark: Circus-style big tent on frontage w/ colorful sign

name: UniverseCity
description: Welcome to UniverseCity, the prestigious Black Rock City College of Arts and Sciences. Our accredited program issues diplomas on any subject matter, however imaginary. These range from the fictional and unlikely to major changes in life direction. Join us on campus and register at the Admissions Office to receive your Letter of Acceptance. Early in the week, attend New Student Orientation activities. Any day, come relax in our verdant Quad, take in lectures of questionable accuracy, gaze into our night time Planetarium. Later in the week we grant diplomas recognizing unique contributions to your field of study during a personalized graduation ceremony. We are a family-friendly camp, welcome all burners to our campus and encourage participation in launching your self-declared education.
landmark: UniverseCity logo signage, ivy columns

name: IDEATE
description: IDEATE is dedicated to amplifying ideas born on playa - to solve our world's greatest problems and build a better tomorrow - as a global community of purpose-driven entrepreneurs, creatives & humans. On playa, we are helping green the burn, hosting idea-provoking talks, and creating magical artistic experiences. Off playa, we are a year round community spreading the Ten Principles, sharing experiences of wonder and joy, and making the rest of the world feel more like playa one day at a time. Come join us!
landmark: big IDEATE sign and big wooden legos, lit at night

name: ICU:  Impromtu Crafters Union
description: Suffering from crafter withdrawal? Visit the ICU for a daily dose of creativity in the shade, cuz making Art cures what ails ya!  Craft offerings change daily.
landmark: 20x20 house with mural walls and upper deck roof

name: All Hail the Queens of Nothing
description: Our camp offers two complementary experiences designed to awaken and restore. The Crowning Ritual is a roaming, interactive gifting experience where we handcraft and ceremonially gift 150 unique crowns made from repurposed materials. Anyone can be a queen for a moment, regardless of gender or background. It is playful, powerful, and celebratory. The Void, located at the front of our camp, is a shaded, blacked-out sensory sanctuary offering hammocks, noise-canceling headphones, and eye masks for deep rest and nervous system reset. It is open for quiet, self-guided drop-in any time. Together, these offerings invite burners to experience both radical self-expression and radical restoration.
landmark: words THE VOID in dark & blacklight purple letters

name: MindShark
description: Step right up for your one-stop burning man shopping right here at the grand Ol' MindShark - a place that will likely be the only stop you need to make on your travels. Behold a wild array of stupid burner shit that features seemingly unlimited booze and entertainment, mind-blowing interactive light and flame effects, dope music, and what burners are saying is "for sure one of the camps that I've seen at Burning Man," but please Stay Out.
landmark: giant flaming sign that says MindShark

name: Midnight Roast
description: Late Night Afterhours Coffee + Music! The ONLY coffee service after midnight.
landmark: Giant coffee cups

name: The Petting Zoo
description: We're open ~11am to sundown daily - hosting our 3nd annual big wheel horse dildo jousting tournament of champions daily 3-5pm. Come enjoy all the free-of-forced-participation-games iced alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks you can manage. Bring your government issued ID - 21+ only!!
landmark: four 18 foot tall led whips with pink hearts

name: pandemonium
description:
kinky or jus curious ?  either way we have  a home for you at camp pandemonium. Where chaos becomes joy, and pain is pleasure.
Home of the Flaming Heart.  come enjoy some of our guided kink classes in rope, flogging /impact, and fireplay. enjoy our 2 story pyramid and grand views above the dust . swing is our lyra open 24/7.  dance w djs on our intimate  dance floor. meet old friends and make new ones. pandemonium is what you make it ...come explore
landmark: twin pyramids

name: Now and Then Artist Collective
description: The Now and Then Artist Collective supports various art projects on playa and in the camp.
landmark: Large metal gecko mobile

name: Skrambles**!*
description: Born from chaos and tempered by confusion, now a respectable bar and lounge! Home of the best Bloody Mary on playa (accepting all challengers) and the shrine to Elijah Wood.
landmark: 3 palm trees made with 4x4s and ikea leaves

name: The Wastelanders
description:
Forged from scavenged tech, glowing mesh, and post-industrial grit. This camp pulses with the creative chaos of a world on the edge. 
By day we're a collective of rogue artists, experience engineers, and anarcho-hackers. 
By night we anchor the Fire Zone, maintaining our iconic flame stage and collaborating with conclaves and performers that set the horizon alight. Inside our cyberpunk themed bar, the Tech Noir, dust weary wanderers trade stories and camaraderie over chilled concoctions in a haze of neon and nostalgia. Makers, fire spinners, and resilient nomads converge here to prove that even in collapse, creativity survives.
landmark: Post apocalyptic vehicles and the Black thumb bar

name: Poppy Moon Saloon
description: Step right up to The Poppy Moon Saloon, a vibrant and welcoming haven for those looking to kick back or karaoke it up, enjoy some dance'n and sip on a drink or two. You can dive into some delightful crafting or enjoy a verity of fun games. Step into the key hole of light or ride the rocket ship of tomorrow today.
landmark: 25 foot tall poles with a disco ball in the middle

name: The YoniVerse
description: The YoniVerse is a safe space for women to explore their eros and their unique feminine power. A camp by women for women. A space where we offer daily scheduled guided somatic experiences to support women to connect intimately with themselves and heal sisterhood wounds. A space held by men who want to hold a container that helps lift feminine energy, help women feel supported and cared for.
landmark: Pussy Portal

name: Camp Fucking Magical
description: Nestled in the quiet city street, our cozy camp is a haven of relaxation and connection. At its center, a giant cuddle pit swing invites visitors to sink into plush cushions and gently sway under the open sky, offering a peaceful escape from the noise and hustle of the outer city. Nearby, an enchanting bar glows with soft, colorful lights, serving drinks and innovative food delights. The camp's serene atmosphere, combined with its playful elements, creates a perfect spot for relaxation, laughter, and meaningful connections.
landmark: CAMP FUCKING MAGICAL sign on the trampoline swing.

name: Paper Cranes
description: At our camp, we strive to create a home on the playaâ€”a place where our campers feel just as excited to return after a long day as they are to dive into our interactive events. We keep it simple but meaningful: serving up PB&Js, letting our DJs set the vibe, and coming together each night for a family meal you won't want to miss. At the heart of our tradition, we invite visiting burners to write their wishes on paper cranes, which we bring to the Templeâ€”a ritual that embodies the spirit of our community.
landmark: Large LED Paper Cranes Sign and a large star tent

name: ClusterF*ck United
description: Dust, Sun, Booze, Bikes, Night, and Noiseâ€“it's a ClusterF*ck out there and that's exactly what you'll find here: a ClusterF*ck of activity where chaos meets collaboration in the heart of the playa! Our camp is a vibrant and diverse community of Burners from around the globe, coming together to celebrate the spirit of Burning Man in our own unique and unconventional ways. Look for our brightly-lit âœ½ marquee!
landmark: Giant silver asterisk marquee and our camp banner

name: Love Puddle
description: Where loving people come together and flourish. Established in 2005, Love Puddle is a vibrant camp dedicated to celebrating life and fostering inclusivity. We create a welcoming environment where everyone feels valued and accepted. Our camp offers a comfy lounge, a bar, and games like strip rock paper scissors and conversational bingo. We prioritize meaningful connections, provide safe spaces and love to meet new folks. Join us at Love Puddle and experience all the magic we've got going on this year!
landmark: Blue flag with a pink heart on a 20 foot flag pole

name: Star Jelly
description:
Star jelly is a loosely knit collection of individuals operating as a singular organism. Traveling space and time to learn and share with you all at Burning Man. Come by to enjoy our wonderlawn oasis with human size gold croquet or just general shenanigans in our Jelly Dome. We'll also be giving out Gold Stars, so come by to share your tales of why you deserve a Gold Star!!!
Fun for all ages!
landmark: 24' Pink Jellyfish Dome, green carpet & Gold Stars

name: Backstage
description:
Backstage is an experimental playground for light & sound where participants aren't just spectators to a performance - they're co-creators engaged in play. Backstage is not just a camp, but a living, breathing instrument and low-stakes stage where everyone has a hand in the creative process. 
We invite you to step backstage and engage with a series of collective, evolving compositions, participatory experiences, and experimental performances.
landmark: LED-illuminated camp sign with name & logo

name: Tram-Tastic Voyage
description: The Tram-tastic voyage is home to the Dolly Art Car. I
landmark: Pallet Rack Shade Structure and Butterfly art

name: Puking Pigeons
description: We are the Puking Pigeons! Come by for a chill place to chat, create, craft or clown around!
landmark: camp sign with our name "Puking Pigeons"

name: The Parlour Room
description: The Parlour Room is a classy-not-classy, heavily shady/shaded, industrial Victorian lounge space welcoming all BRC citizens to come relax under the shade with a cool beverage during the morning and afternoon or chat the night's adventures fantastic around our fire pit in the wee hours.
landmark: Stop Sign and rainbow bright light panels at night

name: MAD Recreational Movers
description: Chicago-based, home of the ChiCargo community shipping program.  Mon-Fri: Radical Self-Espresso Affogato Bar, including non-caffeine and non-dairy options.  24/7: check out our renewable energy micro-grid.
landmark: Big orange semi-trailer, 48 feet long

name: Black Rock Boutique
description: The Black Rock Boutique is your fashion headquarters at Burning Man since 1996. We empower Burners to creatively self-express with funky, freaky, furry, fabulous clothing. Come find a new outfit, donate your dusty old playawear, mutate your clothes into something new and weird, and strut your stuff on our runway! Open 12-5pm Monday-Saturday of Burn Week.
landmark: Pink and black 12-sided wooden frame circus tent

name: Desperados
description: Don't go to Desperados, it's a terrible bar. The bartenders are all narcissists and they can't make a proper drink. They just dance on the bar, knocking shit over while your cup is empty. The place is a junk heap, absolutely falling apart. What a shitshow. Stay away.
landmark: old saloon facade with swinging doors, lantern

name: Fix Yr Burn
description: Welcome to Fix Yr Burn, your local neighborhood fix-it and MacGyver shop. Our mission is to lend a helping hand and mend whatever may need fixing. Our fix-it abilities include, but are not limited to, bike repair, electrical issues, portable generators, sewing repairs, first aid, forgotten personal care items, and general problem solving. Come hang out in our shaded living room, have a cup of medicinal tea, and listen to soothing live music. Is your problem not listed here? Bring it anyway and we'll do our best.
landmark: Fix Yr Burn sign

name: Afterglow
description: Afterglow, that wonderful feeling that lingers long after the experience has elapsedâ€”a feeling that only occurs when the mind, body, and soul has been ever so stimulated. Our gift to the Playa and to its dear citizens is Afterglow!
landmark: AFTERGLOW Arch, and large aluminet shade.

name: Janky Barge
description: Janky Barge is an art car and all the people who made it. We cruise around the desert and have fun and play music we like. You should get on! We'll give you a ride to wherever we were already going.
landmark: Janky Barge art car

name: Draft Punk
description:
In the future, Daft Punk steals OUR name, "dRaft Punk".
We're here to steal it back.
And we brought a LOT of ice-cold beer with us.
Grab a cold one on the go, or hang out with us for the day.
landmark: Swap meet shade structure topped with orange flags

name: Possible Muertos
description: Wake up from the dead with Possible Muertos! Join us for morning movement classes (yoga, stretch, calisthenics), afternoon drinks with themes from around the world.  Our camp features a shaded lounge with daily country-themed frozen drinks, DJ booth with plenty of dance space, and a lounge area to kick back, relax and bond with kin spirits. Other camp features include live funerals, instant photos, a hydration station open during public events. Stop by daily between 10am-6pm.
landmark: Shaded struc. w/ led lights and Poss Muertos signs

name: Rumi's Tea House
landmark: Tea Tent w/stars, metal/LED sign, tall/large flags

name: A Medium Place
description: Welcome to an impermanent realm of mediocre existence curated especially for Burning Man. Our uninspired camp is the not-so-premiere destination for unexpectedly disappointing experiences and half-assed fuckery; the metaphorical handy, where no one fucks yer Burn.
landmark: Wooden train engine art piece

name: Spec-Taters
description: And amidst this sea of humanity, there are potatoes. Yes, potatoes. Perhaps an unexpected sight in the midst of such a surreal landscape, but therein lies the magic of Burning Man. These humble tubers, often overlooked in daily life, take on new significance here. They're not just food; they're symbols of sustenance, resilience, and community.
landmark: Carved wood Spec-Taters sign with hanging burlap

name: Whatchamacallit Whinery
description: What makes a quality whine? Is it how sour the grapes are? Or perhaps how long it stays bottled up? At the Whatchamacallit Whinery, we'll find the answer to that question by collecting gripes from all over the Playa, smushing em up, and celebrating our collective complaining overâ€¦ well you guessed it, wine!
landmark: Light up Grapevines and Sign!

name: Poseidon's Playhouse
description: A sea-soaked fever dream of games, chaos, and crustacean energy. Join us for bubble battles inside a sumo ring, spontaneous crab dance mobs, and the occasional sideways scuttle through the city. We mix oceanic absurdity with radical hospitalityâ€”equal parts weird, welcoming, and wonderfully wet (metaphorically, mostly). Swing by, suit up, and surrender to the tide.
landmark: 5 10ft poles with blue flags as a circle

name: Aya The Tiger
description: We are a healing-centered camp offering psychedelic peer support, yoga, meditation, and a sacred tobacco ceremony. Our team includes experienced volunteers, therapists, and physicians trained in harm reduction and emotional care. We provide a calm, welcoming sanctuary for anyone in need of grounding, connection, or support throughout the week.
landmark: sign: Camp Aya the Tiger + tiger lights in front.

name: The Shire
description: At the Shire, we're all about CONNECTION and PLAY. Dance like a hooligan at our DJ sets (you'll be in good company). *Almost* smooch a stranger in our Tension-Building Pre-Kissing Workshop. Take flight on our infamous rotating seesaw, The Merry-&-Pippin-Go-Round! Brave the 4-story climb up Isengard for a sunset singalong. Come celebrate your inner child. Just follow that giant sunflower flag you see in the sky, it'll lead you right to us!
landmark: Tiered scaffolding tower and S-H-I-R-E letters

name: Pour Choices
description: Step into Pour Choices, a late-night dive bar tattoo parlor serving fake tattoos, real broth, and questionable decisions. When the sun goes down our artists, bartenders, and brothel will ink your soul, feed your belly, and make serve you the best bad decisions you've ever made. Draw your own regret, pose for a Polaroid, and maybe stumble into something deeper than expected. If you see an "Out of Order Bathroom" doorâ€¦open it. Just trust us.
landmark: Lit "Pour Choices" blade sign

name: Bunny Meth Lab
description: BML is a place where all bunnies can exercise their darker side, the place of matted fur, of sharper teeth. We are the bunnies unafraid to carry rabbit feet so we don't lose the keys to our ever deeper and darker rabbit holes. We eat snakes. We devour foxes. We shit chocolate eggs.
landmark: Eight foot high lettering that spells "INSANITY"

name: Atypical Camp
description: Delve into the Dazzling and Deviate from the Mundane!
landmark: UV-reactive 4'x8' "Typical" sign on front wall

name: Clevian Circularity
description: Clevian Circularity dates back to 30,000 BC and channels a mystic lost civilization. Are you a Clevian too?
landmark: 11-foot Snowflake on top of a white van

name: OKNOTOK
description: OKNOTOK is another way of inscribing the ying to your yang. Non-sexual edge play is the way.
landmark: OK Tower, capped with OK in metal letters.

name: Bait Shack
landmark: Large LED fishing poles above our camp & Stop sign

name: SnowKoanSolar
description: Snow Koan Solar serves snow cones daily, hot dogs very late at night now and then, and provides solar-based power for a number of camps in our HUB. We also have a public charging station where smaller items can be charged.
landmark: large solar array in front of the camp

name: Toxic Disco Clam
description: In the default world, the Toxic Disco Clam is a real aquatic creature. It uses its luminous lips to attract passing fish... and then it dazes them with acidic snot. We're pretty much the same: we draw you in with dazzling lights and entertaining activities, we ply you with our intoxicating beverages, and we hope you never leave.
landmark: Toxic Disco Clam Sign hanging on shade structure

name: qt pies
description:
The qt pies are an eclectic collective of souls inviting you to explore quixotic transcendence. We're on a mission to understand the temporal nature of identity and imagine new versions of self, community, and world. Spend time with us and embrace your pie-in-the-sky ideas. Our doors are open to the most curious.

Our camp is a cozy, intimate home base for all of our adventures. We curate a wide spectrum of experiences from serene and sensual to hypnotic and party-popping. With us, the boundaries between dream and reality dissolve. Come find the magic in boundless possibility.
landmark: a pie on a plywood stand that says "QTPIES"

name: Salty Jacks
description: Your local deep dive bar and your safe-port in the storm, open daily.  A nautical disco grotto with salty libations and an eclectic fleet of DJs.
landmark: Look for the massive blue shiny SALTY sign !!

name: Reverbia
description:
Reverbia is an All Live Music Camp with 4 stages, including: The Radiance Dome (LED interactive) The Jam and Teahouse, Embassy Shad Stage, and Reverbia Main Stage. 
 Reverbia features Daily: Calm Inside (breathe, Stretch) ,Live Music Yoga in the Morning...Dance Workshops, Open Mic/ Songwriter Showcase, Concerts in the Shade, Reverbia  Classical Music Sunsets and Live Nights, The Reverbia Childrens' Hour, and Late Night Mini Radiance Dome, and Jam and Teahouse. Reverbia also features Dance Performances, including the Production Tommorow, Today. Our Tribute to Lost Musicians honors musicians who passed away the previous year.  And the 50th Anniversary of Pink Floyd's Wish you Were  Here with guest artist performances.
landmark: The Radiance Dome lit at night in multiple colors.

name: Black Rock City Rest Area
description:
Black Rock City Rest Area is open 24/7 for R&R.
Make a pit stop or stay a while. We'll point you in the right way. Enjoy a meal on our picnic table. Lounge in our courtyard or siesta in our teepee. Take in Mother Nature with a panoramic view of Black Rock City from our elevated perch. Warm your body and spirit around our campfire. Rest assured your Playa journey is just beginning.
landmark: 'Black Rock Rest Area' MUTCD DOT sign

name: *cats
description: *cats is all about the immersive digital art experience - we gift a high-fidelity LED live visualscape, where we host a roster of visual and sound artists, with a bias towards experimental art forms. For the last few years *cats has been part of the BRC skyline on Esplanade.
landmark: Big geodesic blinking dome with giant cat ears

name: ATypical Forest
landmark: Large (((TYPICAL))) Sign on top of 20ft tower

name: AndCamp
description: AndCamp is a queer affirming, sex-positive theme camp that celebrates the unity underneath what, on the surface, appears to be duality. Day/night, pleasure/pain, life/death. AndCamp is also home to the "This L'il Piggy & The Unicorn Creamer (They, Them), the two spirit Art Car that gifts freshly-baked cookies and ice cream treats.
landmark: & Sign and the Pink Piggy

name: Need A Minute
description:
Sometimes you just Need a Minute! Stop by to find out what kind of minute that is.

Sometimes you just need a minute. Need a Minute embodies childlike play, silliness, and free expression with experiential minutes, amazing music, and activities to connect with open-hearted friends and acquaintances. Stop by the Need a Minute Booth to spin the Wheel of Time and see what kind of minute is in your future. (is it really the minute you needed?) Or stop by our parties where we'll be serving the very best minutes you'll have all week.
landmark: Look for the "N-A-M" letters

name: Long Feng MV Support Camp
description: An ever transforming theatrical, performance-driven mutant vehicle. At it's core, Long Feng is an homage to the intricate articulation of a contortionist, mirroring the circus performer's ability to transform and transcend. A canvas of both past and future, Long Feng is a vessel for the human spirit to soar into the boundless realms of imagination. She is an invitation to explore the infinite within ourselves and to dream beyond the boundaries of reality.
landmark: 40x80 large communal lounge tent with lanterns

name: Playasophy
description: Playasophy is a Burning Man camp based primarily out of Seattle and San Francisco. We've been on playa since 2010, and you can usually find us serving iced coffee in the hot afternoons. We offer an open, welcoming shaded spot to pass the day and a relaxing lounge in the evenings with music and alcohol that challenges your tastebuds.
landmark: Lighted "Playasophy" sign

name: Cloudy AF
description:
Feel the thunder as we BUFF and FLOG your muscles at Body Werkz, get foggy in the Steamy AF sauna, get wisped away in our evolving sprinkles of frosty bevies, drift away in a dream in our cloud pit!
We are dedicated to raising the hearts, body and souls of the broader Burning Man community through our art, events, and welcoming space. We dew take our fun quite cirrus-ly.
It's never been this cool to throw so much shade!!
landmark: Cloudy Sauna

name: Tin Foil Hat
description: SAVE YOURSELF! Step into TIN FOIL HAT, Black Rock City's center for pseudo-science & conspiracy theory! Transform shiny foil into mind-shielding masterpieces that (allegedly) block pesky brain vibrations. We have conspiracies galoreâ€”grab string and sticky notes to map out your grand design and show how it all connects at the center: Burning Man itself! We'll supply materials (or bring your own) in our shady chill spot, open for hat-crafting adventures. Join us to "save" the worldâ€”and look fabulous doing it!
landmark: A giant tin foil hat

name: Maybe Bike Repair
description:
There's no faster way to fuck your burn than to have a broken bike. Bikes break. If you've ever had a broken bike on playa you know it sucks. A broken bike is much worse than no bike at all.A broken bike on Playa is the fucking worst; so, we get Burners with Broken Bikes back to burning by fixing their beaters. Does it always work? No. That's why we're "Maybe Bike Repair." 

We're a group of committed bike mechanics, enthusiasts, and artists who work with Burners with Broken Bikes to unfuck their bikes.
landmark: Mr. Maybe Bike Repair sign, resplendent in his red overalls

name: The Homie Depot
description:
Need a Homie? A bike buddy? A wingman? Do your campmates hate dancing? 
We'll be your Homie!
Everything is better with a Homie!
landmark: sign that says The Homie Depot, not The Home Depot

name: Hookahdome
description: Enter our silk draped, plush, cushioned, lantern-lit, air-conditioned dome to be whisked away into an oasis from the dust and heat. Let our loving attendants ensure your comfort while we serve you house made organic shisha and tea. Be entertained by a variety of intimate world music and dance performances taking place on the center carpet.  Wednesday-Sunday evenings, our outdoor courtyard, illuminated by a ring of torches ignites the dancing flame within us all as world class DJ's, musicians, and performers entertain into the night. Come spin fire or drum at the Fire Flow Jam and Drum Circle, dance the night away to one of our outdoor music and dance performances, and wax philosophical, regale your fellows with your tales, and make friends and lovers for a lifetime inside the Hookahdome!
landmark: Big dome with hookahdome sign and torches

name: The Gutter
description: Welcome to The Gutter, your grungy nostalgic neighborhood bowling alley. Land marked by our towering 10-ft bowling pin, The Gutter features a two-lane bowling alley open daily for spontaneous games, wild strikes, and the occasional gutterball. Spin your way into The Spare Room, a shaded lounge and dance space, a bowling-themed bar, and a DJ booth spinning beats to keep the energy rolling. By day, join us for bowling tournaments and themed parties, and by night, get your glow on with your inner child's favorite - Cosmic Bowling. Whether you're here to strike, dance, or just chill, The Gutter is the perfect place to let the good times roll - and don't forget to ask us about our PinPal VIP program!
landmark: 10ft Bowling Pin Signage; Bowling Pin flagpole top

name: Camp XUZA
description:
Home of XUZA Art Car
Every Night XUZA will be out on the prowl, seeking out Art installations to host parties and more.
landmark: XUZA Art Car Sign at the end of XUZA's Driveway.

name: Camp of the Rising Buns
description: Camp of the Rising Buns is a community that celebrates the many gifts of the sun. Come to our Abuntent to experience the renewal of a new day while basking in the evaporative cooling powered by the gift of the sun's rays. "Sun's out, Buns out!"
landmark: Look for the large Abuntents and the OASIS sign

name: La Calaca Village
description: La Calaca Village offers a theme camp, art car and artist support on playa. We pride ourselves on being makers, teachers and healers . Come for the healing, stay for the hedonism! Spiritual healers, yogis and massage artists await you in our Healing Plaza. Wanna help build and work on a big art car? Visit the "Imagination Station Piazza" featuring different activities and gatherings daily!
landmark: Giant Domes and La Calaca Village Signs

name: Still Stings
landmark: Big blue tent with red arch and two long red flags

name: Mystic
hometown: Bay Area + Los Angeles CA + Denver, CO + New York, NY
description:
Mystic is a legacy theme camp with a rich 20+ year history in Black Rock City. 
We create a vibrant space filled with interactive art, uplifting music, and transformative workshops that inspire personal growth and connection.  
BY DAY, experience our VISIONARY SPEAKER SERIES, HEALING MODALITIES, and engaging MIND-BODY WORKSHOPS in our MYSTIC THEATER and MYSTIC TEMPLE.  
BY NIGHT, immerse yourself in unforgettable performances from talented musicians, fire dancers, and artists during our exciting events, including the renowned TRUTH & BEAUTY WEDNESDAY NIGHT PARTY!  
And for a mobile Mystic adventure, explore our interactive Mutant Vehicle, MYSTIC FLYER EXPERIENCE, in Deep Playa joining us for a journey of creativity, community, and fun.
landmark: 16ft LED Arch, CNC Sign, 7x 40' poles wLED ribbon.

name: Cosmic Llama
description:
The Cosmic Llama Guardians are sworn to protect the ancient secrets of the Dali Llama lineage. The Cosmic Llamas have been charged with creating the highest vibrations of Harmony & Resonanceâ€¦Without our camp offering beats, music, rhythmic dance (and llama puns)â€¦the Cosmos would fall dangerously out of balance! 

In the whimsical world of Cosmic Llamas,  every step resonates with rhythm, every word hums with harmony, and every heart pulsates with cosmic frequencies. Together we weave the melodies of unity and vibrations of joy that reach the farthest corners of the cosmos, one llama leap at a time!
landmark: Wooden purple llama art and the Cosmic Llama sign

name: NAACB
description: NAACB (National Association for the Advancement of Colored Burners)
landmark: White archway frontage and large black sculpture.

name: No Aduults Detected
landmark: Arch main tent with No Adults Detected neon sign

name: The Hearth
description: The Hearth offers a sanctuary of warmth and rejuvenation in the heart of the playa. Step into our cozy squish space filled with cushions and comfort where you can rest your weary body while connecting with fellow burners. Rejuvenate in our steam room, where heat and community combine to cleanse both body and spirit. Stay hydrated with our refreshing spa water station offering cucumber, strawberry, and other infusions throughout the day. As the sun sets, gather around our bubbling cauldron for a nourishing bowl of soup served daily. The Hearth welcomes all who seek restoration, connection, and the simple comfort of being cared for before venturing back into the dust and wonder of Black Rock City.
landmark: sign that says "The Hearth" and the cauldron

name: Moonlight Collective
description: We are the art support camp building the Moonlight Library. Come visit our camp to meet the artists, and enjoy some hot sake at our sake bar.
landmark: Glowing Moonlight Collective sign

name: MythMaker
description: We are a Tribe, a Family, and a Close Circle of Performing Artists and Skilled Makers. We seek to restore the sacredness of myth through theater, dance, circus arts, puppetry, costumes, and fire performances coupled with deep, ritualized tales of days long past yet still relevant in the present. We seek to balance the foolish with the wise, the free-spirited with the disciplined, the ridiculous with the honourable; to face the Shadow and the Light. We welcome all who seek the Truth.
landmark: Giant Viking Bus topped by a Massive Silver Dragon [stationary through event]

name: Rootist Lounge
description:
#RootistLounge is a camp based on the joy of #energy, the beauty of #spiritual connection with self, and others. It's a gathering of open-minded and like-minded individuals where friendships surround you. 
We are always creating new art, supporting art, art cars, and artists. If you would like to co-create with us, please email us! With a major focus on energy work, healing sound vibrational therapy, #yoga, #workshops, #hughealing, #ArtCars -Art car support, Art project support, and so much more. We are constantly striving to go above and beyond to create a truly magical experience for our participants. We put in our all, dedicating endless hours of our time to creating a beautiful place where everyone can gather and celebrate life through yoga, music, and #community.
landmark: The 8ft LED Gifting tree. It is lite with LEDs

name: RIPPLE
description: The Ripple Effect reflects on the very nature of affecting change:  how one small stone tossed into a body of water causes a ripple effect with an almost never-ending forward motion.  Camp Ripple is all about tossing those positive stones to impact your own life and those of others one small metaphorical pebble at a time!
landmark: 10x20 Tie-Die with RIPPLE in large letters.

name: Dr. Carl's Collection of Depts.
description: Dr. Carl's Collection of Departments returns! Come play our legendary Dept. of Collections game, where we will give you a semi-fabulous prize if you can do, are, or tell us about a thing we list on the board of tiles. Enjoy a homebrew at our Dept. of Dumpster Dive Bar. Get glowed up by our Dept. of Boudoir Photography and be adored and cheekily photographed (now including black light sessions after dark!).  Learn and play Go in our Dept. of Strategy, enjoy our blacklight Hissing Booth, or let fate decide at our luscious pink Kiss-Met randomizer.
landmark: Walls of tiles, oval sign. Lit up pink and blue.

name: Vietnamese Iced Coffee Experience
description: Vietnamese Iced Coffee Experience (VICE) is an all inclusive Burning Man Theme Camp offering a cool icy beverage during the heat of the day as well as several other activities for our fellow participants. We encourage diversity, participation, and acceptance and welcome new members from all locales and walks of life.
landmark: large letters made of metal that spell out V I C E

name: Altar of Awen
description: This is an Art Support Camp for Altar of Awen, a playa-placed interactive sculptural environment that serves as both a literal and figurative reflective space, inspired by the Welsh concept of 'inspiration,' where the heart and creativity converge.
landmark: Alchemy shade structure and Color changing heart

name: The Institute
description: The Institute of higher yearning invites the dusty wanderer to expand their mind into the bottomless pit of knowledge and exploration.
landmark: THE INSTITUTE sign between two geodesic domes

name: The Melt
landmark: Mahal tea tent

name: Camp Corny
description:
Find your spirit animal. Put em on a Pole. Thrust them to the beat. They're out of fucking control!  

Jump into a pile of 1,000 spirit animals and use our state-of-the-art technology to guide your hand to YOUR spirit animal. Then our team of experts will help you put your spirit animal atop a gorgeous party pole. As we all know, spirit animals eat dance, so FEED your new spirit animal, dancing wildly w/your new creation at our insanely joyful day club w/amazing DJ's and music. Relax in our lounge, or on the shaded observation decks with playa scopes, or gaze at the 20' tall, flaming double unicorn arch with bubbles coming out of their butts. 

Camp Corny - The Friendliest Fucking Camp in the Universe.
landmark: Twenty foot tall, flame-throwing dbl unicorn arch

name: Big Bitty Litty Committee
description: Litty energy with Big Bitty vibes, come hang out and join a Committee of like minded funky individuals.
landmark: Large hanging 'Big Bitty Litty Committee' sign

name: Probe-AbiliTEA
description: Embrace unknown probabilities and explore universal truths by rolling the dice, allowing fate and magic to intertwine in a dance of chance. Each roll serves as a conduit for the universe's will, guiding you toward unique and spontaneous experiences and connections. After all, true magic lies not in knowing the outcome, but in embracing endless possibilities. We invite you to linger and share in our tea offerings and share your desert wisdom.
landmark: Geodesic dome in the shape of a UFO, lit at night

name: Get Toasted
description: Step into a world where childhood memories meet adult indulgence at "Get Toasted"! Immerse yourself in the comforting aroma of warm, buttery (vegan) cinnamon toast that will transport you back to carefree days. For those seeking a bit of spice, savor our tantalizing cinnamon whisky that adds a grown-up twist to the classic treat. As the sun sets, join us for electrifying DJ sets from 9 pm to midnight, creating the perfect ambiance for unforgettable nights under the desert sky. Get ready to ignite your senses and toast to new adventures at Get Toasted!
landmark: 20 Pink Light Up Toasts bordering the main streets

name: Sidequest Sideshow
landmark: Fishing dock next to a circus tent

name: The Real Grass
landmark: Rectangular scaffolding structure with cream cover

name: EnchantÃ©
description: Welcome to EnchantÃ©! Where we drop bangers and know how to keep the party going all night long. Swing by for one of our sunset parties and get the best dusty cock(tail) on the Playa and dance your face off!
landmark: Scaffolding and Crystals!

name: Avocado "Toast"
description: Come enjoy a slice of avocado toast and a refreshing drink before heading out on the playa!
landmark: the avocado toast sign with a burning man chef

name: Disco Porch
description: Welcome to Disco Porch! You can't miss our large multicolor psychedelic illuminated "DISCO PORCH" sign placed on the ground to the left of the camp. The main structure is a canopy decorated with various string lights and several disco balls hanging from the roof. Under the canopy, there is a living room vibe with inflatable couch/chairs and coffee tables. Our bar is bright and covered with a shiny silver cloth. Out front you will see our jumbo disco mailbox labeled "DP MAIL"â€”don't forget to check your mail! The overall atmosphere is festive, vibrant, and inviting. So come on in, take a seat, relax, and let the disco porchers do the rest!!!
landmark: Jumbo Disco mailbox & psychedelic Disco Porch sign

name: The G-Spot & Sloth Sinema
description: Can you find the G-Spot?  We are your favorite neighborhood dive bar.  Come thirsty, leave happy!  New for 2024 we are shifting to an evening offering and opening the Sloth Sinema.  Join us for a chill evening of great movies, themed cocktails, and of course, shenanigans!  Family-friendly matinees included.  Already have plans for the evening?  Come by in the morning for "Saturday" morning cartoons and milk and cereal.  Just like mom used to make.
landmark: , red box office and spinning G"/Sloth Sinema sign

name: Steam Bath Project
description:
The original and still the best steam bath experience.
Step into a world of relaxation and rejuvenation at The Steam Bath Project. Located at the heart of Burning Man, our camp offers a unique and immersive experience inspired by the soothing power of steam. Enter our tranquil oasis and indulge in the therapeutic benefits of steam bathing, surrounded by the sights, sounds, and scents of the desert. Our Lavender Lounge provides a sanctuary for participants to unwind and prepare for their steam bath adventure, while interactive elements engage the senses and foster community connection. Join us for a journey of self-discovery and renewal, where the principles of radical inclusion, communal effort, and radical self-expression come to life.
landmark: A very large solar array

name: Venice Red Light
description: Inspired by the free-spirited heritage of our adopted home of Venice Beach, CA. We are a conglomerate of artists getting weird and supporting each other as we put our dreams into action.
landmark: The dome with the illluminated red V on top

name: KeyHaus
description: Enjoy 24/7 gourmet ceremonial tea service in a lush, cool, luxurious teahouse. Our small stage will feature world folk music and dance performances. We will be gifting literal and figurative keys of liberation.
landmark: KeyHaus teahouse next to the Foam Home experience.

name: El Station BRC
landmark: red and white star tents & Hel's Diner art car

name: Luminous Grove
description: Step into a dreamlike grove where color-shifting light, ambient sound, and organic textures invite moments of pause and inner reflection. This immersive space blends bioluminescent-inspired art with mindful programmingâ€”offering glow-paint workshops, quiet meditations, and evening sound journeys under soft, shifting hues. Created as a haven for connection and self-expression, our camp is a living gift to the playaâ€”open to all who seek creativity, calm, and a deeper resonance with themselves and others.
landmark: tent with lounge area

name: Reimaginate
description: ReImaginate at Alight Market offers a vibrant sensory oasis at Burning Man. Our 5Zenses Lounge features tea and elixirs, a Nose Spa, live music, and a space for calligraphy, healing and connection. At night, we host a lively Night Market with spontaneous performances and interactive experiences. Rooted in community and inclusion, we celebrate diverse voices and provide a welcoming, alcohol-free space for relaxation, play, and discovery.
landmark: Crochet lamps with a sign that says 5Zenses Lounge

name: Jolt
description:
Jolt! Come to get recharged! If your bike is sick, we'll heal it for ya!
If you're low on energy, try our refreshing icy slushies while relaxing in our cozy lounge.
landmark: UV reactive lounge with a bar

name: Paradox Outpost
description: Lying between dimensions, the Paradox outpost hums with exotic wares and whispered secrets from a thousand worlds. Come hang up your space boots, shop exotic wares and alien paraphernalia and lose yourself in the eyes (or tentacles) of your fellow travelers. Remember: at the Paradox Outpost, you're never lostâ€”just in the wrong timeline.
landmark: Wooden market stall and Paradox outpost sign

name: People of Color Camp
description:
Bringing COLOR to the playa since 2014!
The People of Color Camp is what happens when The Muppet Show gets put in the same telepod as an episode of The Fresh Prince of Bel Air, MTV's The Real World and a debate at the United Nations.
We provide opportunity for BIPOC Burners to not only learn about and experience Burning Man, but make it our home. We bring the diversity of our cultures to the playa through events, workshops and simply our presence. We bring our music, our soul, our rhythm, our cultureâ€¦ Unapologetically!
We welcome all people of all backgrounds. Stop by! Add some color to your burn! It's always love! :)
landmark: Huge POC sign

name: 8-bit Bunny
description: Our steam sauna is open every day. Sweet out the dust and leave cleaner than you have ever been on playa. Feeling adventurous? Spin the wheel at our bar for a drink. Rabbit ears encouraged, but not required.
landmark: Look for the pixel bunny sign

name: Vimana
description: A serene Indian tea lounge offering a peaceful escape in the heart of Black Rock City. We serve freshly brewed chai daily and host immersive cultural experiences including storytelling, guided meditation, and workshops on Indian tea traditions. Our vibrant space features colorful dÃ©cor, soft music, and welcoming hospitality. Rooted in the spirit of gifting and cultural exchange, we invite all to relax, connect, and share in the warmth of Indian tradition.
landmark: Rajasthani multicolored Indian tea lounge

name: Captain Pump's Raiders
hometown: Boulder, CO, USA, Earth, Sol System, Orion Arm, Milky Way, Laniakea Supercluster
description: Captain Pump's Raiders is Black Rock City's finest giant-robot driving mercenary company, and we roll a mean D20. Come visit us for RaiderCon X, the Playa's premier (and possibly only) roleplaying-game convention!  Don't miss our Starcraft and Magic tournaments.
landmark: Captain Pump's Raiders sign

name: Burning Globe
description:
Tomorrow and tomorrow and tomorrow...TODAY! Maybe you're a thespian, maybe you're thespian-curious, or maybe you just have lots of thespian friends (round here we call that an "ally") If that sounds like you, come join us for a chalice-full of tomfoolery, skullduggery, swashbuckle...ery and overall merriment. Theatrics! Catharsis! Comedy! Tragedy... catch a show--or be a part of one! We'll make you a fancy cocktail pre-show...

...if you can find our bar, that is.
landmark: "Burning Globe" sign in the shape of flames

name: L'Atelier de Wagon Support Camp
description: L'Atelier de Wagon has been created solely for the intent of interaction, participation, leave no trace, and gifting at Burning Man.The vehicle is a mobile art studio, bringing together professional and amateur artists or anyone whom wants to give painting a shot. Atelier gives the ability to participants to share their feelings, emotions, thoughts, and minds through live, group, artwork creation. Participants can paint in one location, load into the vehicle, be comfortable during a journey, then unload and continue to work in a new location creating a whole new set of outside interaction in which to paint.
landmark: Large horseless covered wagon MV

name: But those are Our Plans (BOPs)
description: We "check" your emotional baggage early in the week, so you can have the burn you deserve. Visit us in the middle of the week for our non-verbal non-sexual touch conscious connections workshop. Or just come by and say hi. We love everyone!
landmark: Sign that says "But those are our Plans"

name: Next Year on Luna
description: Next Year on Luna explores the remarkable experience of humanity in the present from complementary perspectives: creating beautiful experiences centered on embodied and visual expression, and provoking expansive thoughts with a salon-style exchange of ideas as we marvel together at the breadth of existence through space and time. Together, we wonder: As the systems around us shape our experiences and our lives, what does it mean to maintain our essential humanity and ultimately to remain ourselves?
landmark: 24' lit geodesic sphere

name: CornHub
description:
Do you love corn as much as we do? Come experience the entire gamut of the beautiful vegetable slash grain! Vegetables are a scarcity on the playa, so come join us for our fresh corn daily and build your own flavor popcorn bar to get your fibre on! Pooping is a problem out here, so make sure you get in and out of that little plastic box of a toilet as fast as possible.

If you've got your fiber fix already, come hydrate with some iced beverages!
landmark: CornHub flag that is strikingly similar to PornHub

name: WeHaul
description: Your cool suburban friends who have the best living room and throw some cool parties if you're willing to commute to the edge of town. Welcoming weirdos who want to express themselves in as many ways as they can, misfit toys on the lookout for lost dreams in need of a new home, encouraging community, whimsy and a safe space to experience being alive! Occasionally known to be overrun by puppets and their leader, the Pink Secretary. WeHaul - Move yourself and rave!
landmark: 16ft mast w/shade sail tent and Burt Reynolds bar

name: Serenity Now
description: An oasis in a world of dust. Serenity Now is a long standing coffee house and performance space, with cold brew coffee service, featuring art and music.
landmark: Tall aluminet dome with triangular door

name: A Touchy Subject
description: A Touchy Subject is a shady spot to relax, confess, break the ice, forget about a postcard, meet a friend, or get away. Brought to you by those shady folks who didn't serve waffles.
landmark: Flat-top shade structure, picnic tables

name: Big Unicorn Energy
landmark: Large Unicorn Head, lit at night

name: DECENTRAL
description: Join experts from various fields in fascinating interactive discussions on decentralization, alternative governance strategies, AI and other revolutionary topics.
landmark: White 30 ft fishbowl dome

name: Kazbah
description: Kazbah is the tower that protects the kingdom.  Its where the local leader resides, in our case the DJ, playing house music and good vibes from midnight to noonish on Wednesday, Friday, and Sunday mornings.
landmark: 48' tall pyramid obelisk w/laser blasting the sky

name: Mithyko camp
description:
Welcome to Mithyko, a camp where we celebrate the flavors, culture, and warmth of Mexico! We invite all burners to enjoy delicious Mexican food like tacos, tamales, guacamole, and hot chocolate, while connecting through music and dance. Our camp is a cozy space for relaxation with comfy seating and refreshing drinks, including coconut water, natural water, and tequila!

At Mithyko, we believe in Radical Inclusion, Gifting, and Communal Effort. We encourage participation and sharing, creating a space where everyone feels welcome and valued. Come join us to enjoy good food, great company, and the true spirit of Mexican hospitality at Burning Man!
landmark: big sign that says "MITHYKO" with yellow LED light

name: Perihelion
description: Welcome a brilliant morning at our Planet Brunch parties (Mon-Fri, 11-1)! Discover an unexpected oasis under the scorching noonday sun: chilled cucumber sandwiches, loaded drunken pancakes, frozen Pina Coladas, and spiked Frappuccinos! Come for the hotcakes, stay for the live-music dance jams and giant adult coloring boards.
landmark: Blue & gold camp, lines of blue streamers in front

name: Practice Camp
description:
Practice Camp - Practicing Burning Man in all the best ways!  Come by for our daily Practices from arty to farty.  Interact with the truly unqie Exquisite Dorks.   Come see how practice makes camp!

Exquisite dorks is a collaborative art piece that takes the surrealist game of "Exquisite Corpse" and makes it 1000 feet long.  It will be possible for thousands of people to participate.  The project is a shaded kiosk with multiple wall panels for participants to draw on while alternating sections of a giant spool of paper are revealed as the roll is periodically rolled through the installation.  Drawing materials will be provided and stools will be available for young and disabled persons.  Come by any time day or night!
landmark: Practice Camp Sign x2

name: Dicey Side Quests
landmark: Massive 20-sided dice archway

name: BRCSPCA (anti-human society)
description: We are a small, welcoming camp focused on connection, creativity, and community care. Our central dome hosts daily interactive offerings like conversation games, pop-up workshops, and cozy lounges where anyone can drop in to chill, connect, or collaborate. Whether you're looking for a deep talk, a silly prompt, or a moment of rest, we offer a space that's low-key, low-barrier, and open to all. Come say hi, share a story, or just hang in the shadeâ€”everyone is welcome here.
landmark: BRCSPCA (anti-humane society) banner

name: No Bikini Atoll
description: We are a small camp of Big Island Hawaii based campers sharing aloha and PÄÊ»ina Wai Niu coconut water parties and hydration.
landmark: Large white tent, 'No Bikini Atoll' sign

name: Seaweed
description: A place where alternate worlds twist your ideas of history -- and what version of our world you actually come from.  The Lounge at the Cross-time Jaunter's Ball is full of twisted timelines and realities that may exist -- as well as shade and hammocks to refresh the weary time traveling citizen.
landmark: Lit hammocks in a grid of brightly painted 4x4s

name: Nom De Plume
description: We are a tea lounge that has yerba mate brewing the entire event. Come by to lurk, chill, and lounge. Relax while thriving, and drinking tea. The way life should be. We have a variety of other teas available throughout the week but always have yerba brewing. Sit down and hydrate while you start or finish your day. Yerba Mate Dub starts every day at 10:30am. Classic dub sounds from around the world as time turns elastic. We are making pancakes in the mornings during the tea parties.
landmark: White circus tent with a red stripe on the roof

name: HeeBeeGeeBee Healers
description: We are BRC's long-standing oasis for nurturing, grounding and healing. Stop by to hang out and chill, take a class, or to receive a healing session for the mind, body and spirit.
landmark: 3 green parachute tents w blue/yellow "HBGB" flags

name: Sundowners
description: 'Sundowners' comes from a South African friendship ritual we host Monday to Friday at sunset. A safari-themed art car and joyous South African "shebeen" speakeasy are our experiential tentpoles. Our creative center is Afrofuturism, imagining a positive, inclusive future through speculative art and technology, representing the diverse background and skills of our community. We feel Burning Man, as the planet's largest temporary city, is a fitting ecosystem to explore and express this unique Afrodiasporic ethnographic theme.
landmark: Lion head mural, Sundowner Sign, African Speakeasy

name: BBC
description: Balls, Bacon and Christmas! Because...why not!? Come volley and whack our balls (volleyballs and baseballs that is) eat some yummy bacon and watch our Christmas light show at night!
landmark: Big blue balls, lit up at night

name: BIGTIME
description:
Welcome to BIGTIME! Our BIG shade area will be the perfect oasis for weary burners seeking respite from the blazing desert sun. We'll be serving up refreshing beer every day of the week, so drop by anytime and chill out in our comfy seating area.

We're going back in time to serve up some of the best 80's music during our hot pants 80's day party on Tuesday from 2 - 6PM, and traversing time on Thursday during our all decades dance party from 2 - 6PM. 

Friday we're emptying our coffers and throwing a tiki-bash for the ages. Come by between 2 - 6PM for some of the best punch on the playa. 

We'll have games, pranks, and good times the rest of the week!
landmark: Big bell tent and a sign that says BIGTIME

name: Dâ€™JUNGLE
description: We're a family of friends turned camp â€” an interactive jungle-inspired sanctuary offering deep connection, music, and magic. By day, explore our art gallery curated by talented visual artists, sound healing, massage sessions, and consciousness talks. By night, sip handcrafted cocktails at our Tulum-style bar and dance beneath the stars to sets by gifted DJs on our Void sound system. Stop by to rest, create, connect, or party with heart.
landmark: Tuluminastys banner palm tree with sunglasses flag

name: Bubble Lounge
description: A queer-forward, wildly inclusive, bar and chill zone celebrating 26 years on playa. Featuring a three-story tassel-wrapped DJ and barker platform, a vibrantly lit body wash experience, ADA-accessible care spaces, a secret room, SHHH!, and a chill lounge where you can find reprieve from the chaos. Expect music, mischief, bubbly, and a caring group of folk in equal measure.
landmark: 3D eggplant on top of a traditional â€œVegas Styleâ€ neon sign (rotating)

name: Hoot 'n Holler Camp
description:
We are your aid station for body, mind, and spirit refreshment! We are here to hydrate you, beautify you, and keep you on your toes. Sustenance comes with a side of shenanigans; make it through our playful rituals to unlock access to secret surprises that will confuse and alight your taste buds. Come for the misters, mint infused water, electrolyte spritzers and ice cold fruit, stay for the air brushed stencil tattoos, cheeky pranks and unexpected human connection moments. Live DJ's and best playlists on the Playa will play all afternoon!
Look for our pop-up on the esplanade during the ultramarathon!
landmark: 15' tall geodesic dome with neon covers

name: Tac-O-Cat
description:
We are Camp Tac-O-Cat. We cook tacos for the masses and enjoy serving libations and great conversation. We offer shade, a misty breeze and we have a few gear-heads who like to solve problems. Our camp is made up of Burners with deep roots in playa culture and a few we have newly adopted. People will likely be pulled in by heckling when they pass by, and some of the best connections have come from luring our new friends in from the street. We enjoy cracking people out of their comfort zone and immersing them in dusty happiness.

At sunset Monday, Wednesday and Friday we will be offering tacos. Our tacos are playa-famous and have a special grilled tortilla. We have vegetarian options as well.

Last year we brought out 1,000 pounds of cold beer and plan to do the same this year.
landmark: Large tower and green and tan shelter. Big TACO.

name: Nova Heaven The Camp
description: Nova Heaven Art Support Camp is the behind-the-scenes home of the Nova Heaven Art Installation team. While we are not open to public interactivity at the camp, we welcome the community to engage with our project on deep playa and at LumiNova, where we offer healing workshops during the day and house and trance Djs at night.
landmark: HUGE LED lit "We Will Dance Again" arch

name: Blinky Things Hospital
description: Shit breaks on the playa. Electronic shit super breaks. Did you bring a full repair shop? No? Good news - we did. Come to camp MVC and our Blinky Things Hospital to leverage the tools, voltmeters, and engineering talent you need to troubleshoot your ride, exhibit or playa gifts and, hopefully, get it fully functional again. MVC is staffed by the creators of the eight-foot, LED illuminated, motorized, sound-infused Burner Boards (surfboards) you may have seen riding across the playaâ€¦. You might even get a ride! But no, we're not going to build you or sell you a board.
landmark: The Blinky Things Hospital Banner(s)

name: Black Rock Public Library
description:
There once were some folks from afar,
Whose love of books knew no bar.
They visited a library so remote,
In search of good quotes,
And they left with improved repertoire.

Come browse our dusty stacks! One year book checkouts!
landmark: Black vinyl banner w/camp name; white book flags

name: Celestial Tapestry
landmark: inflatable logo and kite installation

name: OnlyJams
description:
Fruit jams, improv jams, and campfire jams, oh my!

Drop into our little forest oasis for some tea, toast (literal or heartfelt), tunes, and a taste of something sweet, strange, or slightly suspicious.

Come join the weirdest/warmest jam session you never knew you needed.
landmark: Birch "trees" with "greenery" as the backdrop.

name: Ab Avo and Therapy Tea
description:
Ab Avo and Therapy Tea is your place for the avocado toast and hot tea in the morning. Come by and enjoy 100 avocado toasts serving with hot tea Mon-Fri every morning on the first come first served basis!
We're also facilitating therapy workshops teaching how to live a happier life. Check the schedule to find the one that works for you the best and come join our high vibes!
landmark: Ab Avo and Therapy Tea sign

name: LumiNova
description: LumiNova is a sanctuary of healing, movement, and light. Join us for workshops, sound journeys, ecstatic and regular dance, and our Art from Ashes ritual. At night, catch a deep house or trance as we turn up the womp womp and the untz untz. Our glowing domes offer space to rest, reconnect, and rise. The fusion of Lumina and Nova symbolizes light emerging from darkness, rebirth, and radiant connection. From stillness to rhythm, from silence to joyâ€”LumiNova invites you to explore, release, and shine in your fullest expression.
landmark: HUGE LED lit "We Will Dance Again" arch and dome

name: Mansonian Institute 4 Urban Study
description: Visit us to learn Burningman History from its very beginning to now from experts. Come hear "Meet the Man Base Build Krewe" talk and ask questions Tues @ 3-4:15PM. Bring a shirt & make it a BM t-shirt Tues + Wed 10-Noon, Swag Swag Swag + visit our fabulous day bar for BM themed games & drinks. See Tubatron "the Flaming Tuba guy" do his thing! Get a pic made with a Star Wars character in the image. Add props and costumes to Tomorow's scifi today from the 80's!.
landmark: Large banners w long timeline on 2 story framing

name: Raccoons
description: Well, as the loveliest trash pandas, we firmly believe that sustainability, alternative energy sources, as well as the 4Rs (Reuse, Reduce, Rethink, Recycle) are crucial in our daily human (and raccoon) lives. A raccoon can be crafty and resourceful, responsible and playful, but above all â€“ curious and friendly.
landmark: Raccoons sign

name: FUR
description: FUR is a theme camp of furries, who come together to collaborate in the shared theme of Anthropomorphic Art, Costuming, and Culture.
landmark: Scaffolding tower with the large LED paw sign.

name: Dickhead Camp
description: Camp Dickheadery is at your service providing shitty jokes, bazar drinks and all-around good times. We will be providing an interactive neighborhood bar with inappropriate reading material and creative art experiences such as learning how to draw a dick, or possibly boobs.
landmark: Metal wing entrance, cow horns, red carpet

name: Magic Paradise
description: Dive into an oasis of wonder, where community and enchantment come together! Enjoy captivating magic shows, intimate speakeasy encounters, and daily afternoon treats. Let our skilled team repair your gear, and make your bike stand out with our dazzling decorations.
landmark: Magic Paradise Sign

name: Deep Sea Kingdom
description: Deep Sea Kingdom (DSK) is making waves with an immersive undersea adventure where curiosity, creativity, and connection run deep. Our camp is a welcoming reef where you can dive into interactive art, thought-provoking discussions, and playful games. Swim through our glowing dome to add your mark to a living art project, get hooked on our Eel game, or drift into deep conversations. Don't flounder! Join us for workshops, lectures, and dance parties featuring resident and guest DJs dropping beats deeper than the Mariana Trench. Whether you're here to sea-lebrate, create, or just go with the flow, DSK is shore to delight. Dive in! The water's weird.
landmark: Blue geodesic dome, 8' 3" tall, lit at night

name: Foam Home presents Transfoam NOW!
description: Foam Home presents Transfoam NOW! to Black Rock City!! The Foamy Homies will be foam blasting & rinsing sparkly clean burners, which can only be attained through consent training and practicing true Inclusion for all human beings! - Groups of 60 at a time for a total of 2000 people a day. Wednesday through Saturday from 12-1pm for families with kids, and 1-4:20pm for all.
landmark: 3 huge solar units, & 2 huge water tanks arted up

name: Siberian Electric Company
description: A Siberian Vodka Bar, Nuclear Powered.
landmark: Green & Blue Neon Shade Structure (And the sign)

name: Celestial Sideshow
description:
Our camp is made up of lively, youthful, creative, high energy people who love creating unique and transformative experiences for ALL. The camp is designed to promote an exhilarating and transformative experience, with an emphasis on healing practices and performance arts.
To us, healing includes yoga, breath, intimacy, consent, sex & kink and emotional mastery. 
Our performances include acro-yoga, aerial silks, fire spinning, flow toys, juggling, improv + comedy, contact dancing, DJ sets and live music bands.
Our intention goes beyond celebrating our own blissful flow: we aim to share, inspire, educate and include individuals into our community, space and lives. Our BRC camp is an open door invitation to fully integrate into our world, and an open heart to everyone's unique offerings.
landmark: large circus tent made of tan and teal shade sails

name: Black Rock Brewery
description: Black Rock Brewery specializes in serving home brew creations. Including dozens of varieties of beer, cider, mead, seltzer, wine and tea. We are also home to Utah Fire Tribe conclave group.
landmark: Black Rock Brewery sign frontage shade structure

name: Camp Akumal
description: The Best Shaved Ice on Playa -- Come for the Concessions, Stay for the Vibes
landmark: There will be a camp akumal flag out front

name: Celtic Chaos
description: Celtic Chaos theme camp is back to recharge your soul and deliver top-quality tunes and cold drinks all served with a side of Irish charm! While the camp's roots are Irish, its branches extend worldwide, embracing radical inclusivity with a warm CÃ©ad MÃ­le FÃ¡ilte (a hundred thousand welcomes) spirit. Check your ego at the door and stop by Bertie's Bar to share a drink, swap stories, or dive into the lively "craic and banter." From sunset to sunrise, dance through the night and embrace the chaos. And of course, we will be bringing back our wild pyro show to light up the playa. Events: Tues (day)  Playa-Olympics Thurs (Day): St. Paddy's Day on the Playa (Traditional Irish Music) night with tantalizing tunes from a serious line-up of international DJs.
landmark: Fire, falling torpedo on top of bar and Mega Sound

name: Pleasant Camp
description: A pleasant place to be.
landmark: Shaded Lounge and Pleasant Camp Sign

name: Back To Camp
landmark: 4ft wooden "Back to Camp" sign

name: Awesome!(ville)
description: Awesome!(ville) is the home of daily classes, fun spaces, live music, plenty of shenanigans and organized chaos. We'll teach you a new skill, find your hidden artsy talent, move and grove your body, and pour you a tasty cocktail. Kick back and enjoy artwork, new friends, and lots of laughs. We're here to celebrate just how AWESOME you can be!
landmark: Large steel dome with multi-colored shade cloth

name: People's Art Congress
description: We are a collection of various artists working in diverse mediums, seeking a range of expression and serendipity. We have interactive art, talks and workshops, Qigong, spirit bar, parties, philosophy slams, and welcoming space for various spontaneous activities all day and night.
landmark: People's Art Congress sign and star tent

name: Space Hole: Mist Opportunity
description: Come by and cool off!  We are a misting camp. We have 2 to 3 forced air misters. They are active participation, not stationary fans. Camp members bring in street traffic and cool them down.  We are active and interactive with the street for several hours each day.
landmark: LED Ball 10 or 20 feet in the air

name: Camp BORING
description: Art support for BORING sign. Promoters of sarcasm and shenanigans. Come by for a sticker and a sunset sign push!
landmark: BORING spire

name: Fuck Yeah!
landmark: the FUCK YEAH! sign

name: Shuttlecocks
description: Welcome to Shuttlecocks, where we're bringing Badminton back. Our playa court is open by noon into the evening from  Tuesday to Friday for pick up play. Come on by, grab a racquet and have a go! Don't miss our Tuesday BADminton cheeky happy hour and Friday afternoon tournament where you can challenge your fellow burners. Whether you're showing off your killer smash, whacking a few birdies, or relaxing with a refreshing Pimms cup and a cool misting, there's something for everyone.
landmark: Glowing shuttlecock signage with badminton court

name: Lakes on the Playa Village
description: The only lake on the playa, come swim
landmark: Lakeside bollards with lights and rope

name: Bureau of Misinformation
description: The Bureau of Misinformation has been Black Rock City's leading source of radical ridiculosity, ambiguity, and factual inconsistency since the man still lived in his parents basement. In other words, we will ALWAYS tell you the absolute truth, as it is ingrained in the very fiber of our beings.
landmark: Large, glowing information I

name: Deep C
description: Deep C presents: HypnoDrome â€” a dazzling 26-foot dome lit by over 25,000 LEDs! Step into the light and get lost in an immersive sea of color, rhythm, and movement. By day, it's a shaded oasis to relax, chill, and connect. By night, it transforms into a vibrant beacon of sound and lightâ€”perfect for dancing, lounging, or just being hypnotized by the show. Come drift in the Deep.
landmark: Large LED covered geodesic dome

name: Ibex
landmark: Two domes (one is red/white & one is silver)

name: Camp TeaPunk
description: Stop by our Steampunk inspired tea/coffee/cocktail tent and chill for a bit. With victorian furniture, plush rugs, a cuddle puddle, small library and games you're sure to feel welcome as you prop your feet up and relax. Looking for something more upbeat? Our "Teabag Olympics"  might be for you. With relay races in high heals, granny panty competitions and other hilarious happenings, you're sure to find fun and laughter, all while listening to an array of DJ beats. Our campers are the family you wish you had, we welcome you to stop in and say hi!
landmark: bohemian bell tea tent

name: Why Do You Do What You Do?
description: Why do you do what you do?  (aka WDYDWYD?)   Visit our WDYDWYD? installation at Center Camp to see portraits of burners answering this question for the last 20 years. You may find something that inspires you, makes giggle, or makes you question. And we want your portrait as well, answering our simple question - WDYDWYD?
landmark: "WDYDWYD?" banner

name: Partner Dance Adventures
landmark: PARTNER DANCE ADVENTURES lightbulb sign

name: Jitters & Bitters
description: We will be serving cold brew with milk and dairy alternatives and ice! Hangout space in the shade with chairs provided to get out of the sun and get jittery. Service is in the morning and we will have 1 midnight brew session to help stay up until the sunset!
landmark: Large 90s Bus attached to our shade structure

name: Camp Safari
description: Determine your fate with a spin of the Safari Wheel. Photo ops, animal hunts, and other dusty games
landmark: Lions & Giraffes, Camp Safari & Safari Bar Signage

name: Beaverton
description: Camp Beaverton is an intentional, experimental, and experiential Burning Man community theme camp. We are a group of queer women/trans/genderqueer/lesbian/bisexual/heterosexual/etc... or folks who are simply as wayward as the playa is dusty. We celebrate sexuality, self exploration, and respect for one's journey through this life. Our goal is to provide a safe(r), brave(r) space that centers queer women, trans folks, and nonbinary identities on and off-playa. We encourage education, participation, inquiry, conversation, and self-reflection. We extend our goals to the greater Black Rock community by hosting workshops and social events.
landmark: Rainbow Camp Beaverton sign & large Beaver symbol

name: Geckos
description:
The Gecko camp has been a BRC landmark since 2007 and we are ready to rock the playa again this year! Our main bar lights up with an interactive Simon Says Games starting night fall. Our dance floor and lounge focus on deep house disco music. Our resident DJs (DJM, Pottz, GoSouth, Samcake, Loustaoun) will be rocking the Gecko's Camp this year again, every night starting at 7pm. DJM has been playing music for Black Rock City for over 19 years now!

Thursday 4PM, we host our Playa-renowned ABCD PARTY: bring your Ass, eat some Bacon (and pizza), drink some Champagne and dance to Disco!

Visit us in our Tiki Bar at the Golden Guys Camp, where 2 of our campers will serve infused rum cocktails everyday 9pm-2am.
landmark: Gecko purple flag

name: ING
description:
Welcome to Camp ING, an ephemeral sanctuary conjured into existence annually by a passionate group of friends from all corners of the globe for the last decade... vibrant camp day and night we embrace the ethos of the playa, build-ing, sweat-ing, laugh-ing, play-ing, and bask-ing in the wonder around us. Here we seek those moments that leave us breathless. Camp ING is not just a place but an experienceâ€” where radical participation is key. No sherpas. No spectat-ING! come create some dusty memories 

Parties and events posted outside daily: A Bar, A Slide, An Aerial Rig, Shade!
landmark: ING sign 20' in the air

name: Motropolis
description: In 2010 several creative characters came together to embark on a journey that would change their lives. That trip was the "MoRoadtrip" 21 artists, from 8 countries, traveling 21 days from Austin to Burning Man on a 60ft bus called the "MoBus". Freshly inspired after a life changing trip a few "Mo" came together to form a "Transitional Culture of Mo." Meeting artists and creatives from the many walks of life led to "MoCarnivals", A "MoFarm", events, festivals, collective living, academic/activist discourse, a theme camp and lifetimes of friendships. We continue as an ongoing cavalcade of cosmic characters cultivating a common culture of creativity and convivial community.
landmark: Entrance marked Motropolis

name: Seashell Cartel
description:
When Ragnarokk fell into the sea, we fell deep. Now reborn as Seashell Cartel, we are a sunken society of sea creatures, pirates, mermaids, and misfits living beneath the waves of the playa. We believe in mystery, magic, and the beauty that grows when you give things space to transform.

Ours is a world of coral crowns, morning mermaid rituals, barnacled bars, and glittering deep-sea dreams. We dance in the grotto, we marry under kelp, we drink at the Bait Shack, and we welcome all curious travelers who want to explore the weird and wondrous ocean floor with us.

Dive in. The tide is rising.
landmark: Rustic Bait shack with netting and lanterns.

name: HexMix
description: Come relax at HexMix and enjoy spa services as well as guided meditations and art workshops .
landmark: Pink shade wings

name: CentriPEDAL Porch
description: The CentriPEDAL Porch and its Handle Bar is a space full of bike-based furniture and a human-powered blender bar, recycling default world bike parts into new lives and uses on playa. We also host a variety of bike-oriented events, teaching people the delicate art of how to physically and emotionally ride a tandem, jousting on a big wheels trike, the limbo on two wheels, and hosting many other mini-games focused on finding new ways to enjoy and appreciate your playa bike.
landmark: Real estate sign w/ name&sched; 6 ft wood bicycle

name: Nobo House
description: Nobo House is an international, quirky Holistic Wellness & Recovery camp that is a place of refuge for playa adventurers, artists, & builders. Our gift is a chill playa spa, that includes a steam room, outdoor gym, dance classes, massages and smoothies.
landmark: Hanging Pink Diamond

name: Scarbutts Cafe
description:
Scarbutts Cafe is the leading megacorporate ass-spanking coffee shop on the playa.
Our chipper staff serve strong coffee and fantastic spankings to the groggy masses. Choose from a menu of spankings that range from mild to hot and heavy. After being served their spanking of choice by a friendly bar-assta, they are served a cup of coffee. We come with a sarcastic edge butt provide a warm, welcoming, atmosphere.
New for 2025! Exclusive, Scarbutts After Dark(tm)-brand coffee will be served at a number of after-sundown VIP events including a "Coffee Cocktail Happy Hour", "Midnight Coffee" and more! Wanna know exactly what and when happens After Dark(tm)? Then come visit our Cafe for the nightly schedule ass it becomes available.
landmark: illuminated 8-foot sign, reads "Scarbutts Cafe"

name: Intergalactic Sasquatch Village
description: The Intergalactic Sasquatch is returning for its 8th year on Playa, 10 years old- for the day trippers, the night walkers, the virgins to the vets, our funky lil cantina offers a place to escape the madness and go down the rabbit hole! Take a stroll through our fractal forest, guests are welcome to walk about the woods through fractal trees, but we warn you to tread carefully and keep an eye out for the very creatures that find their home in our camp! You might be asked to pay the "squatchtoll" in our interactive gameland and if visitors are 21&older, Squatch O'Hairs offers deliciously refreshing bevvys for in between rounds.
landmark: ISV Wooden Sign, Large Wooden Sasquatch

name: The Shrimp Ranch
description:
