Howdy! Welcome to the Shrimp Ranch, where the Wild West meets the salty sea. We're a camp of new and seasoned looking to create a unique experience for the community in the only way we know how: through quirky food, music and event offerings. 

Our ragtag crew will transport you to an imagined past, where crustaceans roamed the frontier. From shrimp snacks and shrimp brine martinis, to our Shrimp Yoga and Crabbin' Shack, get ready to live your nautical fantasy and somehow leave weirdly warmer (or cooler) than you came.
landmark: Shrimp Ranch surfboard adorned with cattle horns

name: Kaleidoscope
description:
Step into a world of color and indulge your caffeine addictions at Kaleidoscope, where we bring people together over exquisite single origin coffee sourced and roasted by our campmates, prepared and brewed in front of you at our bar, one cup at a time. Our vibrant, welcoming space adorned with low tables, cushions, and ambient music, invites you to slow down, savor the moment, and encourages you to engage in meaningful conversations with your fellow Burners.

Finally, don't miss the opportunity to climb our iconic 26 ft crow's nest lookout tower. This unique structure offers a high vantage point to take in the sights and sounds of Black Rock City.
landmark: 50x33 ft cafe, tower and the Kaleidoscope sign

name: FUN-DO BAR
description: Looking to get melty while having a booty shaking good time?! Look no further than Fun-Do Bar! Our delicious Swiss cheese and chocolate fondue paired with ice cold wine is sure to make your taste buds dance! Join us for our dance party happy hour (4p-6p or until we run out!). Our servers will be scantily clad wearing nothing but aprons, so come on down and melt with happiness while shaking your booty to the beats!
landmark: Yellow/Blue Serving Bar labeled with FUN-DO BAR

name: Camp Tada!
description:
**Camp Tada! Where the magic is REAL!** 

Get ready for a summer explosion of creativity, connection, and COLOR!  Think non-stop fun, amazing new friends, and adventures around every corner.  At Camp Tada!, it's not just a summer camp â€“ it's a portal to a world where imagination runs wild!  
Prepare for:
* **CRAZY** crafts that'll blow your mind!
* **UNFORGETTABLE** memories you'll cherish forever! 
* **EPIC** adventures you won't believe! 
Something new and exciting awaits you at every turn!  Ready to unleash your inner artist, explorer, and friend-maker?
landmark: The rainbow entrance!

name: The Fountain (of youth)
description:
The Fountain (of youth) is a longevity-focused camp at BM where we celebrate life and coordinate to fight aging & death.

Our gifts to the playa are LongeviTEA, our signature teahouse and the Rejuvenating IV Lounge.

We have healthy food (inspired by the blueprint diet), IV hydration raffles, and daily workshops on accelerating lon biohacking, and thriving. 
Whether you're seeking a soothing cup of LongeviTea or a deep conversation about defying aging and death, The Fountain (of youth) invites you to sip, connect, rehydrate and explore what it means to live vibrantly on the edge of time.
landmark: 2 signs, "The Fountain (of youth)" +  "LongeviTEA"

name: Mad Tea(se) Party
description: Mad Tea(se) Party is a circusy sound camp and interactive lounge. We offer Victorian era ambiance, a robust collection of cat literature and pop up circus events. Since 2019, Mad Tea(se) has hosted tea parties, cabaret shows, and yoga/acroyoga events under its iconic, striped circus tent.
landmark: red and white striped circus tent

name: Cyborg Mazu
description:
The beliefs in oriental temples are rooted in ancient Chinese philosophy, forming a complete system of rituals. This year, our theme camp will explore this through five immersive experiences using art, music, and drama. Burners can communicate with gods through Taoist priests, seeking blessings to break bad luck and find peace.

A key experience features Cyborg Mazu, a futuristic, enhanced version of the sea goddess. Blending ancient divinity with technology, she bridges the spiritual and mechanical realms. With cybernetic enhancements, she bestows blessings, merging traditional rituals with modern power. This fusion transcends time and space, offering Burners a unique, transformative journey.
landmark: Giant Robotic Hands

name: Brain Freeze Camp
description: We will be back again in 2025 serving the coldest frozen margaritas on the Playa. Our amusement center will certainly entertain you and Power to the People will be available to help keep your electrical devices charged.
landmark: The Bar

name: Temple Oasis
description:
Temple Oasis is a decompression spot and camp for those who have gathered at, worked at, or been a Guardian at the Temple.

An Oasis on the playa from the heaviness of the Temple and our service to it; a place to find others who are welcome to talk or sit in knowing silence as we unwind our experiences.
landmark: Blue Temple Oasis banner or lit-up sandwich board

name: Lost + Found
description: We are a family and community, a California-based collective of dreamers, artists, adventurers, and passionate doers, that loves throwing fun off the wall parties as much as we love connecting on deeper levels. We are professionals at being, playing, curating unique experiences, and faffing about - whether it's flow, dance, music, magic, bubbles, movement, fire spinning, food, drinks, art, live jams, deep talks, tiny things or a whole lot of silly nonsense. We're a diverse group of eclectic individuals that operates with love and respect for the 10 Principles of Burning Man. We create interactive and magical experiences together as we inspire others to flow, love, and be their free and fearless selves. We also take lost and found items, including people. ;) Come play and get lost with us!
landmark: Lost + Found Neon Sign and LED Arrow

name: Kosmic Korner
description: Come join us for Exotic Elixirs, BORG, Music, Quests and our own infinity mirror room - just know this will be the funnest Korner on playa!
landmark: "Kosmic Korner" LED Sign at top of car port

name: Hack-a-Cola
description: A visit to Hack-a-Cola is a reprieve from the heat empowered by a sampling of a wide variety of unique, handcrafted flavors of soda. Hand us a cup and we'll mix cold carbonated water with one or more of our syrups to make a refreshing soda on the spot. We may even put a scoop of ice cream in your soda to make it a float! We tweak our recipes and invent new flavors throughout the week. Inquisitive visitors can learn how to fulfill their own soda making dreams with the guidance of our knowledgeable, helpful soda jerks. We aim to provide a welcoming space where everyone will feel comfortable to stay a while and enjoy the company under our plentiful shade.
landmark: red shade, brick wall facade, Hack-a-Cola sign

name: Jub Jub's Plastic Circus
description: Jub Jub always here to fling those funny hard-to-get drinks, uneasy rest, strange music, weird plays, loud noises, oh-so-friendly grief, bruises, nausea, vertigo i.e. Monkey Business!!!   maybe poo tooâ€¦
landmark: Banana Peels by Porches under the Monkey Head neon

name: Bombees
description:
Our camp will be offering a rooftop deck atop the Bombus Regius Steampunk Airship Art Car ( docked for the summer ) stationed within The Hive Village. Our upper deck event space will host a variety of events such as Karaoke, Dark and Stormy Story telling events, Tabletop and RPG daytime. The lower deck features a Tiki Bar plus some Fancy Festive and Fun pedal powered Rickshaws that will ferry guests from camp to the playa for adventures and Tiki Light Totems.
We will also be hosting live musical performances primarily from the band, Parlour Tricks
landmark: The large Shipwrecked Bar with tiki lounge

name: Camp Contact
description: Camp Contact is dedicated to offering a more embodied world through Contact Improvisation, Acro Yoga, Ecstatic Dance, Authentic Relating, Internal Family Systems, and other Psychotechnologies.  We bring a dance space and domes for our offerings!  We welcome others who know of these and related practices and modalities to join us in community!
landmark: 30' White Dome and Wide Aluminet structure

name: Mutual Aid
description: A group of humans that are here to party, as well as break down social barriers around wealth & social status. By building community among folks who might never have interacted with each other, we are creating solidarity & pushing against a staus quo of scarcity & exploitation.  That's a lot of words to say come on by for some mending, camraderie, or a stiff drink. Whatever you're after, we can help you find it.
landmark: Community boards w/ Glowing "Mutual Aid" sign atop

name: Uli Baba & the Horny Thieves
description:
The Finest Flesh Market in Black Rock City! 

Uli Baba and the Horny Thieves, also known as Uli Baba's, is a Burning Man theme camp. In addition to the Ten Principles, our guiding inspiration is hospitality. We are always honored to serve our guests, even while subjecting them to cruel humiliation, voluntary servitude, and wanton drunkenness. Our gorgeous Moroccan tents are lushly furnished with wall-to-wall rugs, benches, and more pillows than you can count. Ours is a hard-working group of camp mates who come together to create a Moroccan oasis in Black Rock City. Auctions always Tuesday through Thursday at 2pm!
landmark: Large Moroccan tent and colorful painted camels.

name: Neon Amanita
description: Relax under the Neon Amanita mushroom and among the fungi forest. By day we offer shade from the hot sun in the mushroom lounge. At night, Neon Amanita glows in ambient lighting and transforms into a magical forest lounge with soft places to chill and ambient music. Visit during our High Tea Events for a tea and treats!
landmark: Black and White Neon Amanita signs

name: Shanti Town
description: We at Shanti Town Sound Movement strive to bring you the citizens of Black Rock City the most authentic experience in Reggae music and Sound System Culture. Delivering strictly Irie Vibes to Burningman since day one!
landmark: Rasta colored (Green, yellow, & Red) shade cloth

name: Trailer Trash
description: Your neighborhood coffeeshop serving The Playa's Most Adequate Coffee every morning. Bring your cup, milks, sugars, light snacks, shade, and good conversation provided. Find us by the giant tomato, which is also our afternoon/night gently cooled and ventilated  chill space.
landmark: large red tomato, green stem atop, lit at night

name: My Favorite Things
description: At My Favorite Things, we're all about creating unforgettable experiences and fostering community spirit through an array of interactive activities and experiences we love. As you explore our camp, you'll discover a plethora of exciting offerings designed to keep you cool, entertained, and connected: a cacao ceremony to connect with the spirit of ancestors,  an aerial arts workshop, playa dust sculptures, and an amazing Fajita party. Join us as we celebrate creativity, connection, and the magic of Burning Man!
landmark: Wood entrance gate that say My Favorite Things

name: Positive Deviants
description: To deviate positively is to play with the rules, reimagine the future, build new realities, and break what no longer serves. It starts small: a question, an experiment, a new way of relating - that quietly reorganizes whatâ€™s possible between us and around us.
landmark: Wonderfuck sign, giant wood cube structure, flags

name: Luminary Love
description: Luminary Love is an interactive light portal symbolizing the transition from the present to the future through light and love. It reminds us that the future is built today, and love is the key to transformation. As participants pass through, they leave behind fear and doubt, stepping into a space of new possibilities. The glowing lights reflect the connection between people, showing that we create the future together.
landmark: Big red heart at the entrance

name: Dead Spark
description: DeadSpark is your western destination of choice.  From fixing your generators and power, to western dancing, a photobooth, and much much more.
landmark: Western Town

name: Furniture Car Rally Camp
description: Furniture Car Rally Camp is a welcoming place for all Furniture Car Owners, Operators and Enthusiasts.
landmark: FCRC marquee sign & 15' tall checkered rally flags

name: The Kingdom
description: massive artcar that welcomes all for art tours and a cold one.
landmark: Large sculls and 2 large tigers

name: Gnome on the Range
landmark: Giant Gnome

name: BLD
description: Swiss Space cow racing, drinks, and an observation tower for looking out across BRC.
landmark: illuminated 16' tower on a shipping container

name: Pink Mammoth
description: We create an inclusive environment of love, compassion, connection, and self expression both on and off the playa.
landmark: Giant PINK MAMMOTH sign and iconic pink shade

name: Parley
description:
Parley is your dedicated conversation camp.  Come "Parley" with us during our daily facilitated events or drop in anytime for adhoc conversations on your topic of your choice. 

Our mission is to facilitate meaningful conversations and bridge gaps between people who might be different from one another.   The topics and framing are done in a way that everyone can have an opinion and a voice.  During the Parley, ideas and thoughts shall be shared, rapport shall be built and new friends made.
landmark: Big Green Star Tent

name: Brodega
description: Da Brodega and Le Gentrifique, the snarkiest businesses in town. Millions of dissatisfied customers can't be wrong. Come get a mouthful.
landmark: Brick Facade with two streetlights.

name: Mattress Society
description:
We spend so much time on our feet at Burning Man that sometimes we just need to get horizontal! So come and indulge your senses at Mattress Society, a huge 24-hour air mattress oasis in the desert. Like any thriving Empire on the brink of decay, our theme is decadence, abundance and over-indulgence.

Once you're all cuddled out, grab a new friend and play a leisurely card game in our bistro area. Enjoy our regular afternoon chillout DJ sets Mon, Tues, Fri (1pm-4pm) with featured drinks and more. Hedonism on display at our Thursday night cocktail party 7pm-12am. 

The day humanity decided to elevate itself from ground to Mattress was the day we detached ourselves from nature to pursue our limitless ambitions. So enjoyâ€¦ or die! Because, ultimately, nothing else mattress.
landmark: Giant Humming Bird Feeder and Mini Trampolines

name: Black Rock Migratory Bird Refuge
description:
As urban communities like BRC threaten migratory birds, concerned citizens are banding together to protect endangered animals and habitats. This led to the formation of the Black Rock Desert Migratory Bird Refuge (BiRDMBR), a new outpost of the Desert National Wildlife Refuge. 

With the creation of the Black Rock Desert Migratory Bird Refuge, birds will have a home in the Great Basin during their migrations as well as habitat preserved for year round residents including cougars, beavers, badgers. 

BiRDMBR plans an extensive permanent Visitor Center with interpretive panels and interactive activities to engage participants of all abilities and ages. 

Join us in our Visitor's Center watering hole and nest for activities like Personalize Your Pee Jug, Bird Bingo, Nature Journaling, and more.
landmark: Big bird, bird flags, large pond

name: Node
description: Node is an oasis of epic proportions. Stop by for drinks, vibes and beats. Dont miss our Hip Hop BBQ on Wednesday!
landmark: Glowing pink sign on the ground with trio of flags

name: KonaZona Coffee and Tiki Bar
description: Kona Zona  Tiki Bar, Serving Liquid Hugs for your brain in a Tropical  setting.  Coffee in the morning, Mai Tai's in the Afternoon.  Chill in our Tropical Hammocks  and relax with the soothing Hawaii sounds and cooling surroundings
landmark: Large KonaZona Banners and Neon Palm trees

name: Chai Lounge
description: The Chai Lounge is a place where we celebrate life over a cup of chai, in a drum circle, during ecstatic dance, and inside our portal where we explore the unseen realm! The Lounge's mission is to bring people into sincere interaction with one another and experience deep love and a profound, spiritual, consensual healing. This is facilitated through our camp healers. Come, drop in and connect in a space dedicated to community and creation. come to connect or experience a healing safe place to paint, journal and rest.
landmark: Bright bus with Chai Lounge painted on the side

name: Burning Man T-Shirt Factory
description: Interactive DIY BM designs. We supply the spray paint and BM stencils.  You supply the clothing, gear, or body to paint. Totally interactive, quick, easy, and fun.  Open 24/7.
landmark: ZAP! Lightning Bolt

name: Joyism
description:
We've been a presence at Burning man for 20 years, as Joyism and as a part of Silicon Village, with many people coming up to the art car recognizing it from the past, and coming by our area later to explore as they search for coffee and interaction.
Our coffee kitchen regularly generates lines of people from every corner of the Playa for hours every morning, with hundreds served. We take our coffee seriously!
This year, hundreds of people will interact with our "One Pill makes you Smaller, and One Pill makes you Tall" exhibit, and our "Joyism Cares" tent hands out sunscreen, condoms, pain relievers, hydration and advice.  We may have wifi available for those in dire need.  Come say Hi!!!
landmark: Joyism Pyramid

name: Gianni's Fellas
landmark: Italian Flag

name: Turtle Camp
description: Turtle Camp is a quiet shady spot where SIMON the TURTLE can rest between playa cruises. Come visit SIMON in his "TURTLE CAVE", and cruise the playa in the luxury of SIMON's plushy turtle shell!
landmark: Giant Glowing Turtle Car! and the Turtle Camp sign

name: Black Rock Piano Lounge
description: Black Rock Piano Lounge is the place to come and share your talent with a friendly audience. We bring great musicians to the playa but build our lounge for that spontaneous moments where the perfect vocals are combined with the best tuned pianos on the playa. Lets make some beautiful music together.
landmark: All white tent structure with pianos and a sign

name: Global Camp
description: Global Camp exists to be a safe place for international participants, and our camp every year has over 30 regions or more represented. Come and hang out with us - and enjoy wellness offerings Tuesday to Friday mornings and afternoons.
landmark: Hot Pink Archway or the Dome

name: NYC Deli
description:
NYC Deli will be be serving Seinfeld-esque laughs and scrumptious New York Deli breakfast food 10am-12pm Monday through Saturday during the Burn. Bacon Egg and Cheese is most popular but we also have great Vegan, Veggie and Gluten Free breakfast sandwich options too! Coffee and water served also. Like last year: there is an air conditioned public picnic area to enjoy your meal! 

In addition to the food: NYC Deli also offers Staten Island! Staten Island is an 85-person public cooling center kept at 70 degrees 10am-5pm Monday through Saturday. Most burners use it to sleep or quietly socialize. There is no programming or events inside: just ocean noise playing over a speaker. Ice is available! Staten Island is NYC Deli's response to 2022's heat.

Please stop by! ðŸ¥¯ðŸ€ðŸ—½â¤ï¸â€ðŸ”¥
landmark: NYC Deli Banners, Blue Shade, Pigeon deco

name: The Mystical Grill
description: The Mystical Grill is a global circle of kindred spirits united by fire, flavor, and story. We gift two styles of traditional Argentinian Asado from our open grill and invite Burners to gather for communal meals, spontaneous storytelling, and soul-warming connection. Sing your heart out at Grill-aoke, sip mate in our shaded nook, or simply bask in the glow of our sacred fire. We honor food as ritual, fire as transformation, and the Playa as our shared home.
landmark: Large metal ring, grill spatula's crossing through

name: DesiFAM
description: Food, Art and Music
landmark: Large white bollywood event lounge

name: Mission Country Club
description: Hailing from the sunny Mission District of San Francisco, we invite everyone to enjoy the dusty comforts of our playa outpost. Pull up a bar stool at Flanagan's Pub - open day and night - for a refreshing beverage. Cozy up on one of our couches beneath the ample and breezy shade structure. Let loose on the dance floor. We're a relaxed and fun-loving crowd from all over - San Francisco, Tahoe, Reno, Los Angeles, Washington DC, Boston, New York, Seattle, Portland, Ireland, Germany, Belgium and beyond. Often serving tunes and always serving drink, the Mission Country Club has been calling Black Rock City home since 2004.
landmark: Big "Mission Country Club" banner atop pavilion!

name: Nowhere; Probably
description:
Nowhere; Probably is a camp that is designed to be a safe-haven from Society for any who are willing to participate. We are actively considerate of those experiencing unorthodox consciousness, be that temporarily, "neuro-divergent", or otherwise. Our main goal, aside from creating community, art, and more participation, is to show and empower the curious and courageous how to do more with less waste.

Nowhere; Probably is a place where "self"-expression, creation, and exploration are encouraged. We are here to support, help, and learn from each other. We do not need to limit ourselves in the scope of our expression, as our resources come at a seemingly infinite and ever increasing rate. We take what has been ignored or cast aside by Society and use it for living and creating.
landmark: Carport with blue shade triangles

name: Automatic Subconscious
description: Automatic Subconscious is back again with our 31 foot, fully climbable non geodesic diagrid gherkin complete with netting at the top. Come by and relax in the netting or catch a beer that we launch from the sky.
landmark: Egg shaped dome

name: Desert Power
description: We are "Dune" fans, nuts, and aficionados. Come gush, discuss, or passionately argue about "Dune" with us. Bless the Maker and His water!
landmark: BoxofPain w/ 4 glowing holes, DesertPower LED sign

name: The Heart Collective
description: This year, The Heart Collective is combining its Squish Lounge, Healing Sanctuary, and Nourishment Lab into one structure: the < < < Nourishment Lounge>>> a one-stop shop for integrated energetic, nutritional, and somatic support. We host services from skilled and ethical practitioners, from massage to reiki to tuning forks to buffing. Come by to receive healing care offered on a first-come-first-serve basis by a rotating cast of practitioners from across the globe, or visit our alcohol-free space with nourishing and hydrating elixirs (both open throughout the afternoon on days later in the week). From sundown to sunup, we welcome burners to our communal fire, a sacred space that helps us greet the darkness and support us through the night.
landmark: Frontage with sign that says THE HEART COLLECTIVE

name: Atom Cult
description:
Cool yourself down with a variety of Fission Ice Cream offerings at noon!
Fill yourself with Happiness and Joy while exploring the magnificent Garden of Tomorrow!
Relax and recharge both yourself and your portable electronics in our Reactor Dome!
landmark: Dome, Sculpture Garden, Dancing Air Sculpture

name: ConTent
description: Jiggle your bones at the "Dome of the Dead", or enjoy the "Volleyball Court for the Deceased"!
landmark: LED Volleyball Court

name: Luxurious Vagrants
description: Luxurious Vagrants are where sandy bodies meet rough luxury
landmark: 30ft tent structure with a large diamond on top

name: Accult
description: Accult is Black Rock City's preeminent venue for ascending to the next plane of existence. Come to us in order to register for planar ascension and join us in our standardized ritual initiation or SRI. We look forward to collecting you.. er uhm we mean assisting you in the next stage of your planar journey.
landmark: A giant fake neon LED sign saying "ACCULT"

name: Gaian Airship
description: An immersive journey into the thriving future. We play a game to create a unifying vision of the thriving future around the Time, Water, Fire, Air and Earth elements.
landmark: Gaian Airship and the art Geodesic Dome

name: Fermented Reality
description:
We celebrate fermentation in all its forms â€“ of foods, drinks, the mind, and the body!

This year, we're hosting events to ferment the SELF, ONE ANOTHER and the COMMUNITY. Ferment your fashion, mind, or taste buds with our morning event series. In the afternoons, participate in rowdy and eclectic games: Can you prevail in our Dickle Fencing ring? Are you ready to kneel before the Pickle Glory Hole? Maybe you just need a prescription from our Pickle Clinic to cure what ails you?

We hail from 10+ countries and 7 states, and would love to make fermented playa magic with YOU!
landmark: Glory Hole Wall & Fermented Veggie Garden Gnomes

name: Black Rock French Quarter
description: Welcome to the bayou! Home of the infamous Golden Cafe cocktail lounge, ubiquitous Cafe de la Fin du Monde coffee house, legendary Black Rock Bakery, elusive Lonesome Gator Gumbo Cookery, subterranean Black Rock Wine Cellar, fermented and pickled Swine and Brine, and ever apologetic Domeakase sushi bar. Your home for elevated drinking, fine dining, and boring stories about the old days, since 2003!
landmark: Neon fleur de lis signs

name: Mayan Warrior
description:
tired of having fun in the sun? take a momento for downtempo.
come chill with us at Malio's, the bar with the best view on the playa
landmark: look for the Heaven Station, a clean energy oasis

name: Slackers
landmark: 10ft+ triangular wooden structures with hammocks

name: French Maid Brigade
description: The French Maids are a playful, meaningful, health and wellness camp that is excited to offer Ayurvedic Massages, Scented Oils, Yoga, Breathing, Happiness and Art workshops to express any Burners creative skills...Come chill and add to your experience on playa with the MAIDS!
landmark: Red Room Lounge fronting the street - red lights

name: Slightly Conscious
description:
Gymnasium celebrates acceptance of everyone in their most natural form, naked.   Come enjoy the freedom of social nudity and take part in some of our recreation events including naked oil wrestling, naked beer mile fun run, yoga, carnival games, the Gym at Gymnasium and gymnastics on a suspended ring.   We hope to see you there!

Our camp is a great mixture of gay and straight burners, men and women of multiple ethnicities and nationalities.  Come by and say hi, experience some of our events, or just take your clothes off and enjoy some shade (it's just about the only area of our camp where the sun doesn't shine).
landmark: The Yoga Tent

name: Maple Matryoshka Mob
description: Somewhere beyond the dust, beneath shifting rhythms of metal, techno, and the occasional string quartet, something strange stirs. Homemade alcohol(-free) gummies whisper secrets under your tongue. Natural wines flow like forgotten dreams. Specialty coffee arrives like a revelation.
landmark: neon half maple leaf half Russian doll-matryoshka

name: Lunars Tuners
landmark: circle of lights for our perimeter in art space; large colorful hot air ballon

name: HORIZON
description: Horizon was originally Inspired by the unobstructed view of the open playa - a space beyond the city's limits, where the sun meets the mountains over the vast and empty desert - we gather to create a community built around ideals of curiosity, art, and celebration. Over the years Horizon has moved from the outer rim to plazas and to front lines of Esplanade. No matter where we are on playa we are always thrilled to call it our home!
landmark: Horizon Signage / Carnival Bar/ Stretch tents

name: Down The Rabbit Hole
description: Step into the shoes of Alice as you enter a world of mysteries and surprises. Take a leap into the rabbit hole and wake up into a world where small appears big, rooms are turned upside down and where you can play with the riddles and mysteries we have placed along the way back into the "real" world of Black Rock City. Along the way you will ponder on the questions of reality, perception and collective consciousness. Enjoy the ride!
landmark: Light tunnel and signage

name: Inspiration Oasis: Swagatron
description: Inspiration Oasis is somewhere you come to get inspired in many ways. From listening and sharing to others during open mic, to looking at our visual tapestries or watching our many heat press art options, you will become inspired.
landmark: Palm tree cut outs and red lights

name: Gauchos del Fuego
description:
The home to Argentinean burners in BRC since 2014. Come by to enjoy some mates in the morning and may be you might end up taking your own mate kit home.

We are also home of Fuego Austral, our regional burn. We'll have information and postcards for you to take home about the only regional burn in Latin America.

On Thursday show your Gaucho's skills at the Guacho Partuza, a Pampa's Rodeo BRC Style and the Alpha Whore competition.
landmark: Large Argentinean flag,  and Colombian, Mexico

name: Team Human Base Camp
description: A far-flung conglomerate of artist, loonies and weirdos from California, Oregon, Texas and Indiana coming together support  to provide an interactive and unique space for live music, DJs, performance artist and speakers to share their offers. Come be a character in our quirky little variety show.
landmark: metal framed stage structure with "TEAM HUMAN"

name: Shitty Wood
description: We (sometimes) have wood. We burn. Established 2007.
landmark: Silver tarped 10x20 structure right along the road

name: Camposanto
description:
CAMPOSANTO is from all corners of the World, but we are mostly Latinos. We love to dance and celebrate friendship. We contribute to the playa experience with dope Latin Beats, Salsa, Merengue, Cumbia, and Deep Rhythm. Our bar is always open!

Come to enjoy our Salsa Floor, beer-in-hand soccer games, and more. Look for our Solar Mutant Vehicle (Solar Chiva)
landmark: Camposanto Sign, Stadium and listen to the Salsa

name: Playa Art Park Support
description: A camp to support the Playa Art Park, a place to enjoy smaller art in a cozy setting.
landmark: Playa Art Park lamp

name: Miscellaneous Heathens
description: The Miscellaneous Heathens are the caretakers of Beethen, Burning Man's most comfortable Mutant Vehicle built by doers, not professional art car builders.
landmark: Large wooden Beethen and Logo sign

name: Kaleidoscope Collective
landmark: Colorful Kaleidoscopic Flags & lots of plants

name: Northern Lights
description: Sauna camp from Norway with a lounge litt in the northern lights.
landmark: Sauna and sand camo lounge

name: Pink Dragon
description:
Pink Dragon is a sonic sanctuary born from the dust, dedicated to the radical ritual of dance and connection. Rooted in the spirit of Burning Man and inspired by the pulsating heartbeats of cities like Los Angeles and San Francisco, Pink Dragon is where music meets transformation.

Our camp curates a full-spectrum sound experienceâ€”ranging from deep house and melodic techno to soulful downtempo and surprise sunrise sets. Every DJ in our orbit brings their own flavor, but the mission is the same: to move bodies, stir souls, and keep the playa vibrating.

Stop by to dance and enjoy a beverage from our bar, or connect to our public WiFi.
landmark: 4 Carports w/ Pink LED rope lights and floodlight

name: Love Tram
description: Art Support Camp for "The Love Tram" art piece.  A collection of dusty artists bringing joy to the desert!
landmark: 50x50 beige military shade structure on Street.

name: Math Camp @ Group W
description: A Safe place to drink and Derive. Share your problems with us.
landmark: 40' tall pyramid with illuminated Pi symbol on top

name: Catmandu
description: Catmandu is a group of diverse friends who love dumplings, music, and cats. Join us on playa for activities throughout the week like prom, pickles & tatts, and a cat creation station.
landmark: The dome and cat LED high up near the dome.

name: Counter Culture
description: We are the BRC Census support camp. Drop by anytime to learn about what Census does and the information we have to share.
landmark: Counter Culture banner with the Census logo

name: Jungle Oddity
description: A jungle oasis lost in time and space. Stop by to experience our lush soundscapes with musical performances and engaging daily workshops.
landmark: Circular camp sign and geometric star fire pit

name: End of the Line
description: We welcome all Dusty Burners, and whiskey-soaked ghosts of the Old West. We offer mischief and laughter to rattle your bonesâ€”consensually, of course. Or perhaps you'd rather just belly up to the bar, trade tall tales, and plot a Burner takeover of the Default World.
landmark: Old west saloon with an "End of the Line" sign

name: Plunderground
description: Interactive fire art installations, led creations, and TOAST!
landmark: Toast Cart

name: Camp Kinetic
description:
Dedicated to Movement Arts in Black Rock City.
Afternoon Workshops in Flow Arts, Juggling, Dance, Yoga, and Aerial.
Evening Features Performances and Fire Jams
landmark: Big Pointy Shade, Tower, Aerial Tripod, Sign

name: Stranger Things
description: We're an art support camp bringing art to the playa for the 6th year.
landmark: "Camp Stranger Things" sign

name: Afterlife Art Support Camp
description: Afterlife art support camp host members and crew who is building Afterlife Reincarnate, an Honoraria Art Project at Burning Man 2025
landmark: Blacklight Art

name: Storytime Friends
description:
Storytime and Dreamtime co-create magic. Storytime is a larger-than-life Tiffany's banker's lamp, building community through the magic of storytelling and reading aloud across the playa. Pick up a book, sit in a circle, and read to friends new and old. Lie back, listen, and watch the stained-glass lampshade slowly change overhead. Share your own stories, or create a new one together. Storytime is a stage for reading and connection, and a comfortable retreat from the noise, throughout the city and in deep playa.

Rest on Dreamtime to inspire, introspect, reflect on dreams past and co-create new visions for the future.
landmark: Friends Sign

name: UnExPecTed SexEd Talks
description:
Unexpected Holistic Sex Ed Talks at 11-2pm
Sextionality Pop Up Q&A daily at 12pm
Psychedelic SciFi Movie Nights at 10pm
landmark: A Frame sign in front of 2 carports in an L shape

name: The Garden of Hairy Nipples
description:
Two inverted trampoline frames (15' & 16' diameters) will provide armatures upon which I will add plastic and metal nipple-like objects embellished with a variety of hair-like materials resembling blossoming flowers.
Solar lights will provide a soft atmosphere surrounding the set of nipples
landmark: The Garden of Hairy Nipples... banner

name: Ranger Outpost Berlin
description:
Ranger Outpost Berlin - The Black Rock Ranger Station in the 3:00 sector where participants in need of assistance can
seek out the help of a friendly Black Rock Ranger. Located at 3:00 and C.
landmark: Ranger Outpost Berlin

name: Ranger Outpost Tokyo
description: Ranger Outpost Tokyo - the Black Rock Ranger station in the 9:00 sector where participants in need of assistance can seek out the help from the Black Rock Rangers. Located at the corner of 9:00 and C.
landmark: Ranger Outpost Tokyo

name: Ranger Headquarters
description: Black Rock Ranger Headquarters â€“ The center of Black Rock Ranger Operations. Located on the Esplanade at 6:35.
landmark: Ranger Headquarters

name: Moon Landing
description:
Moon Landing, a celestial outpost of creativity, exploration, and radical self-expression at Burning Man. Our camp is a launchpad for dreamers, builders, and cosmic wanderersâ€”a space where art, technology, and human connection intersect in gravity-defying ways.

Inspired by the pioneering spirit of lunar exploration, we craft immersive experiences that transport participants beyond the ordinary. Whether it's through interactive installations, mind-expanding discussions, or late-night moonwalks under the neon glow, Moon Landing invites you to step into the unknown and embrace the infinite possibilities of the playa.

Join us as we orbit together in a community fueled by curiosity, collaboration, and a little bit of space dust. The countdown has begunâ€”see you on the moon!
landmark: 8 foot red neon sign

name: BRC Hash House Harriers (BRCH3)
description:
The Black Rock City Hash House Harriers are a group of hashers from around the world that come together to share our love of drinking, singing, sometimes running, and shenanigans with everyone at Burning Man.

Join us for a hash on the playa. In addition to our Annual Red Dress Run (Thursday, 3pm, meet at the man), we host a variety of hash activities and events. Check out our events page for more information!

Stop by our hash house for delicious hash browns, hot sauce, and plenty of cold strong drinks and join us as we strive to live out the 10 principles in the most fun an inclusive way possible!
landmark: Large Red BRCH3 out front, neon arrow totem night

name: The Pit
description: The Pit, DMV volunteer camp.
landmark: Big Red Shuttle

name: DMV
description: Official BRC DMV. Bring your mutant vehicles and mobility vehicles here for inspection and licensing.
landmark: DMV Sign

name: The Tiniest Camp
description:
The Tiniest Camp is a place where people can connect and have meaningful conversations. We offer an intimate and cozy environment.
You won't find any grandiose installations or flashy decorations. Instead, you'll find a humble gathering of burners who are there to share stories, ideas, and experiences. The focus is on creating a space that allows for genuine interactions and deep conversations.
It is a testament to the idea that bigger isn't always better. We place a strong emphasis on creating a welcoming and inclusive environment, and create a space where everyone feels comfortable and valued, regardless of their background or beliefs. 
At the Tiniest Camp, you can disconnect from the distractions of modern life and truly engage with the people around you. It's a beautiful thing to witness.
landmark: The Tiniest camp sign

name: Academy of Arts and Sciences
description: We're the scientists who are artists. And the artists with a passion for science. We can show you how a crystal is born, and then teach you to make wearable art with it. Want to look at the sun? Want to look at the sun and NOT go blind? We got you, and we'll even paint you up once you're done. Want to learn more about drug tests, or have a question for an OB/GYN? Stop on by for our lively and interesting debate and educational sessions. Feel like pursuing gallery worthy photos of Burning Man through the years? The Academy is the place to be You can also just kick back in the shade, trade a bad idea for a bad drink, and relax at the Bad Idea Bar - worst bar on the Playa (since 2010!).
landmark: Large Banner

name: Bounce Block
description: Welcome to Bounce Block! Come Bounce in our Bounce House culdesac and relax in our shaded couch zone! Spontaneous DJ sets and party vibes Press the dynamite box to see what happens and get a Scooby smooch if your lucky!
landmark: 4 bounce houses with Scooby and Elmo

name: Universal Lantern Art Support
description: Universal Lantern Camp is an Art Support camp for "Quantum Existence".
landmark: Tie dye & Mongolian Yurt

name: BMIR
description:
Burning Man Information Radio (94.5 FM) is your nexus for essential information on the playa. Check BMIR for late-breaking event announcements and a melange of music. In the event of an on-site emergency, tune into BMIR for rumor-free updates and advisories to surf the storm to a sane conclusion.

Come down to BMIR from 12-5pm each day to record event and camp announcements. Or relate your encounters with radical acts of gifting on-air to the city at large.
landmark: Big radio tower that says BMIR in blinking lights!

name: Looners Camp
description: Experience a unique journey aboard our tethered hot air balloon, 75 feet high, with live instrumentals and electronic beats. Enjoy stunning Black Rock City views and our ground-level dance floor. Join the best show on earth in our old-world circus lounge or relax and rejuvenate in our Oracle's Den.
landmark: Hot Air Balloon and well lit perimeter

name: Fire Camp
description: Fire Camp is a home for fire spinners and performers of all kinds. Come by for a fire jam or to play on the aerial rigs & poles, or just enjoy the music and entertainment! Try to find out who the swag keeper is and get your stickers or patch!
landmark: 30' x 30' canvas canopy w/ flame effects out front

name: Galactic Relay
description: The spaceport of love on the playa. Home base of Out Of Band III and Zodiac. Location of the Intergalactically famous bar: The Crocodile Milking Table.
landmark: Large and illuminated "Galactic Relay" sign

name: Love, Beer, &the Pursuit of Pizza
hometown: Oakland California, Guerneville California, a few people from the East Coast
description: Love, Beer & The Pursuit of Pizza invites you over Monday - Friday to join us for the best beer freshly poured on playa!  We're looking trade some of our prized special beer for pizza so if you've got a slice to share we'll make it worth your while!
landmark: Large round Pizza sign in front of camp

name: Camp Condundrum
description: Playa got you in a difficult place? Camp Conundrum might just be the answer. Our mutant vehicle, a delightful conundrum in itself, offers hydration, music to move you, and a pole for the ... adventurous.

name: Red Rooster Ranch
description: The Red Rooster Ranch art car celebrates the fun and frivolity of Nevada's tawdry past and present association with saloons and Cat Houses. Come join us for a ride and enjoy a libation in our tiny saloon!
landmark: Little red Saloon or the Red Rooster Ranch art car

name: TEREMOCK
description: Welcome to "TEREMOK," a Burning Man camp where the surreal world of mushrooms meets the vibrant spirit of the playa. Our camp features giant mushroom structures, a central gathering area called the Mushroom Grove, and a dance floor known as the Spore Dance Temple. Join us for workshops, delicious mushroom-inspired treats, and surreal DJ sets under bioluminescent mushrooms. Come immerse yourself in the magic of TEREMOK!

name: Star Sailor

Visitors are welcome to explore our sculpture garden, join mini workshops, and connect with the artists behind the work. We believe in shared effort, playful creativity, and fostering meaningful exchanges with fellow Burners.

You can often find us randomly at sound cars in deep playa serving quesadillas at sunrise. We will also serve quesadillas at Dilla's Den a few afternoons during the week. See you in the dust.

name: LOVEGUARD TOWER69
description:
LOVEGUARD Tower69 is a supportive camp for our mutant vehicle. 
Hop on board! While we are on duty, you will not drown in the desert of loneliness!

name: Arabella's Lair
description: Arabella lives here.   She is not a fire chicken.

name: Kaya
landmark: Fire Pit, Hourglass or Kaya sign

name: ByrdhaÃ¼s
description: Welcome to the support camp for byrdhaÃ¼s and the purple people eater! If camps a-rockin' stop in for a beverage at our bar! Hours: sometime - whenever.

name: ImagiMorphia
description: Welcome to Camp Imorgimorphia, a space where creativity and transformation converge. Inspired by the concept of "morphing," we invite you to explore and express your evolving self through art, interactive experiences, and collaboration. Join us for immersive installations, transformative rituals, and workshops focused on personal growth and creative expression. Whether you're seeking self-discovery or community connection, Imorgimorphia is a space to shed the old and embrace the new. Come evolve with us on the Playa!
landmark: Neon sign says imagimorphia,and a fire pit

name: Evil Twin
description: Our camp might be boring but our art isn't!

name: GARDEN OLYMPICS
description:
For the delight of all visionaries, chillers and music lovers the Garden is back to provide JOY. Garden Olympics is a cosmopolitan melting pot based about inclusion and gentleness that becomes home.  Always open, join us during the day to relax, chill and talk, come at night to love and shake. Workshops welcome. 
European tenderness and far reaching sights await you. Jahlove
landmark: 7 m long, 60 cm high, luminous sign: GARDEN OF JOY

name: El Pulpo Magnifico
description: Circular shade pavilion approximately 30' in diameter up front.

name: NOT BORING
description: The most NOT BORING after party at your service â‡ï¸

name: Chromosomatic
description: Chromosomatic is an art support camp for the Chromosomatic sculpture, an artwork build from DNA data.
landmark: Chromosomatic sign

name: House of Sammich
description: We serve gourmet, gluten-free, cinnamon-buttered toasted, peanut-butter and jelly sammiches. All that we ask is for you to provide us with a taste of YOUR flavor. Sing us a song..., tell us a joke..., confess a sin.., the dirtier the better. We also provide a moving cuddle puddle which is all about conscious conversations: opening up, connecting, and sharing what's going on inside oneself.
landmark: Trailer with "The Great Sammich Ride" on the side

name: Dome Sweet Dome
description: A group of long time burners happy to be in Black Rock City. Come by and visit and check out our Mutant Vehicles.

name: Mindseye Bonsai
description: "Become the vision of the mind's eye and carry your flame to the fire. Do not wait for the fire to carry the flame to you." - Catfish Billy
landmark: Oculus - the glowing eyeball!

name: Recycle Camp
description: CRUSH IT w/the Recyclenauts at Recycle Camp. Find us at our new location, 5:35 and just off the Esplanade. Bring us your mesh bags full of empty aluminum cans & ride the amazing bicycle powered Crushing Machine - The Crushinator! (plz no tin/steel/glass/plastic/trash)
landmark: 24' dome covered w/ aluminet at the front of camp

name: Playa Piano Bar and Lounge
description:
Playa Piano Bar and Lounge will be featuring live collaborative musical performance along with refreshing beverages every afternoon except Friday. Come by Tuesday for Tutu Tuesday Evening Music Party and Tacos from 6 to 8
Come by Wednesday For Pizza Pockets and Music from 6 to 8
Drinks and music every afternoon Monday to Thursday 3 to 5
landmark: Playa Piano Bar Art car with Giant  PIANO Keys

name: Camp Cingulata
description: Camp Cingulata is a vibrant, myth-inspired village dedicated to connection, creativity, and radical inclusion. Anchored by two mutant vehiclesâ€”Cingulata, our roving lounge, and MAYA, a temple-like art carâ€”we host sound journeys, rituals, and communal gatherings. Our shaded courtyard features a welcoming kitchen and bar where we serve up shared meals and deep conversation. With music, storytelling, and a spirit of play, Cingulata offers a space to rest, reflect, and reconnect in the heart of the playa.
landmark: Colorful banners & flags waving above the campsite

name: Arctic Court
description: Multi national art support camp of Arctic Court - CUBE.
landmark: Canopy tent with ARCTIC COURT text

name: Earth Guardians
description: Earth Guardians are an outreach and communications volunteer group whose mission is to educate and inspire Burning Man participants to Leave No Trace (LNT) at the event. We can go beyond leaving "no trace" and leave instead, positive traces on the land. Come see our many bike nature and geology tours, sustainability speakers, DIY workshops, Aztec Burner dances, or volunteer training and gatherings! Come and volunteer on our LNT and compliance outreach teams or participate in a Gerlach LNT our hot-spring patrol, or jump on our MOOP train.
landmark: Earth Guardian Sign and EG man

name: Native Tongues
description:
A Native Tongue speaks to the frequency we all share, a common way of communicating with love, empathy & respect. An acknowledgment of the humanity we recognize in each other.
And also a kick ass rap collective from the 90's!
landmark: The Native Tongues Black Flag flying high

name: Black Rock Labs The Expanse
description: Black Rock Labs is a Civic Support camp focused on testing/scaling/messaging climate smart regenerative technologies at Black Rock City and the Regionals. Black Rock Labs hosts a daily  1-hour Sustainability Talk Series at 2 pm and a Playa-wide tour on the Abraxas art car at 4 pm  on Thursday to view BRC's expanding deployment of renewables and regenerative climate smart activities.
landmark: Large white banners with Black Rock Labs symbol

name: Favela Culture
description: Our camp celebrates the spirit of unity, simplicity, and radical expression, proudly supporting the first Brazilian mutant vehicle at Burning Man. In our community, all souls are equal.
landmark: A Favela sign and two black skull face flags

name: Amber Dust
description: Pagan vibes, chill spaces, all the fun is here!
landmark: Large Amber Dust Sign on Scaffold - lit at night.

name: The Burntique at Dollhouse
description: The Burntique at Dollhouse is a whimsical, immersive storefront offering curated playa treasures for any dusty traveler in need. Under pink-and-white striped awnings, we gift goggles, coats, tutus, and essentials with sparkle and heart. Our garden lounge invites you to take a load off, sip something cool, and connect. Whether you're strutting through a fashion show or just need shade and good vibes, the Burntique is here to help you win the burn.
landmark: Pink and white striped awnings and storefront

name: Shiny's Keepers
description: Shinys' Home
landmark: Sign that says "Shiny" and a Mirror MV if parked

name: BLM/FNW Interpretive Camp
landmark: BLM Interpretive Camp sign

name: Haven
description: Haven, 6:30 and A: The Black Rock Rangers are honored to provide participants with harm reduction support while Zendo takes the year off from Black Rock City. If you're experiencing a different conscious or emotional state, and you can't be at peace in your own camp or out in the City, come to Haven. We offer a chill space with friendly, trained volunteers that want to help you through your experience.
landmark: Large Yurt on 6:30 between 'A' and Esplanade

name: the black hole
description: The Black Hole is a Staff Camp supporting the needs of Gate, Perimeter and Exodus.
landmark: The Black Hole directly next to The Commissary

name: Ballistic Bubbles Dust Patrol
description:
Ballistic Bubbles brought to you by Dust Patrol. Fighting the good fight against dust since 2019.

Come on by our one stop shop for all your dusty needs. We've got vacuum cleaners, dust devils, dirt busters & dusters of all kinds. If you've got dust bunnies, you are a dust bunny, you want to be a dust bunny or you're just plain ol' dusty, this is the place for you. 

Dust Patrol is a great place to suck (the dust away)! After all, the dust is inevitable. We just make it fun!
landmark: Mutant peace tank blowing bubbles

name: iBurn/Burning Man Earth
description: Download the iBurn App! Your best resource to navigate the activities, theme camps, art installations, and scheduled events on the playa -- all without wifi -- it's GPS enabled! Download the 2025 version of the gifted (free) iBurn app pre-event, or swing by our camp to download on our wifi. It's like having an elf read you the What/Where/When in a dust storm! 32,000 Burners used iBurn last year -- make sure you are one of them.
landmark: Blue bus camper and iBurn sandwich board sign

name: Jukebox Acres
description: Art support camp for Jukebox Country.  Y'all come back now, ya hear?
landmark: Jukebox flag

name: Sea Dragon Camp
description: We love meeting new people and transport them around the playa on our Fire Breathing Leafy Sea Dragon. Anyone is welcome to hop on and go where Snouty takes us. We do day cruises out to deep playa art installations. Some nights we do "10:00 - 2:00 shuttle bus" to take dancers back and forth between the two big sound camp regions. Sometimes someone hops on board and tells us about something that sounds amazing, so we go.
landmark: Big Boxy Aluminum RV

name: Dirty Goat Roadhouse
description: Dirty Goat Roadhouse is a welcoming home base supporting our beloved art car, The Dirty Goat. We offer dusty hospitality, cold pickles, funky beats, and surprise pop-up antics to refresh and delight weary wanderers. Our camp brings together seasoned Burners and fresh faces to celebrate radical expression, community, and silliness. Come find us for an adventure on the Dirty Goat!
landmark: Dirty Goat Roadhouse Sign

name: Temple Crew Camp
description: We are the support camp for Temple of the Deep, this year's official Burning Man Temple 2025. We are a multinational crew of doers, builders, artists and supporters who have spent the greater part of 2025 bringing this temple to life for our community, We welcome everyone to stop by and learn more about the process of designing and building the temple, and we'd love to hear your thoughts and stories.
landmark: Temple Builders Guild painted 40' trailer

name: Intergalactic Confederation
description: We invite all intergalactic beings to come share some Brazilian BBQ and enjoy some outer space techno music with our crew. Watch an official fire juggling show rehearsal with the conclave.  join us Tuesday and Thursday from 3pm to 3am.
landmark: Dome with aliens at the entrance, lit at night.

name: Train of Thought
landmark: Steampunk Train

name: Camp FUA
description: Camp FUA is a small camp of veteran Burners, part of the Outer Road neighbor for over 15 years.  Home of the PAMS mutant vehicle.

name: THICC VIBEZ
description: We will have a branch from the giving tree art car that we have not used on the at car for sometime now. We will be mounting this 8' long horizontally arched branch 15' high off one of our frontage street corners, with 12' long GREEN vines hanging from the branch blowing in the wind like a flag. It looks just like the art car so people will know what camp we are when the art car is away from camp.

It's also where you'll find past MOOP Maps, interactive displays, and friendly faces happy to chat about Leave No Trace or how to join the Resto crew!

name: Terrapin Station

name: Mona camp
description:
Welcome to Mona Camp, where the spirit of caring, loving, and creativity thrives amidst the vast expanse of the playa. As part of the same community that brought you the Huge Mona Bunny in 2023 and the enchanting Mona Mushroom in 2024, this year we are bringing MONA DIE! DIE! DIE! and are dedicated to spreading the Mona spirit far and wide.

We believe in the power of art to inspire, connect, and uplift souls. Our theme revolves around celebrating art and mushrooms. 

Join the Million Mushroom March where everyone who identifies as mushroom (or has mushroom inside of them) will dress up as their favorite fungus and parade from Center camp to Mona Mushroom. We'll have workshops from legendary mycologists and neuroscientists beforehand.

Regnum Animalia finitur. Regnum Fungi surgit.
landmark: Large pink MONA Letters and pink MONA Bunny

name: Grass Palace
description: Grass Palace is an Art Support Camp that is in training to become a fully grown theme camp in future years. Look for the bamboo towers and wild people in imminent jeopardy - there you'll find us.
landmark: Bamboo towers

name: We are BORG
description: We are Borg is home to the BORG Cube, a solar-powered, all-electric mutant vehicle shaped like a glowing cube of alien tech. Our camp blends sustainability, art, and engineering through low-impact, immersive design. Nearly all of our infrastructureâ€”lighting, sound, and powerâ€”is battery-powered and solar-fueled. Visitors can relax in our shaded lounge, enjoy music, and explore clean energy solutions.
landmark: Glowing green BORG pipe sign & LED-lit lounge area

name: Ninja Pizza Camp
description: Art support camp for Ninja Pizza
landmark: 2 white arched roof carports w/ flagpole between

name: Dream
description: Welcome to *D*R*E*A*M* Immerse yourself in a cloud-like oasis of creativity and serenity. Our camp is a haven for dreamers, artists, and visionaries from around the world. Join us in a space where radical inclusion and artistic expression flourish. Experience immersive art, wellness offerings in our dream cloud. Be part of a community dedicated to personal and planetary growth, embracing the beauty of simplicity. Explore new dimensions with us at Burning Man 2024

name: AREOLA 51
description: Areola 51 is where the grand universe meets the mighty nipple! We offer a fun experience that combines radical self expression with tactile art in a lightly kink format. Playans paint their (or a friend's) nipple with any design they choose, then press that design onto canvas and have it framed by one of our specialists! After they sign it, take the art home or put it on display in our Boobseum!

Power tools and expertise available Office Hours, otherwise 24/7 DIY with hand tools, work space, and plenty of materials to MacGyver your issue. No bikes or mutant vehicle help, though we'll try to point you in the right direction.

name: Dustmight
description:
Art support camp for Voxelite, a volumetric light sculpture.

Previous projects have included Popstar, the mobile popcorn stand!

name: WHIRL OF ART
description: Whirl of Art team brings to the playa a whimsical art installation of multi-tower kinetic art sculptures set into motion by burners playing on a merry-go-round. Its a collaborative project of dozens of amazing artists from different Texas cities. Come activate your inner child and play on the playground of the Whirl. Stop by our art support camp to meet the artists and builders behind the project.

name: Airpusher Collective
description: The Airpusher camp is the port from which our fantastical airship begins and ends her voyages.  Join us for music and joy.  Check our event schedule and meet us at camp prior to our published airship rides to playa and beyond.

name: Swizzle Me Timbers
description: Swizzle Me Timbers is your tropical oasis in the desertâ€”serving up sunshine, sass and sensational spirits during our afternoon happy hours. We specialize in playful pours like tiki concoctions, rum tastings and boat drinks, shaken with a wink and a twist of lime. No late-night ragers hereâ€”just daytime delight and breezy vibes before the burn kicks into overdrive. In the spirit of Tomorrow Today, we're building a future where connection is stirred, not shakenâ€”and the only thing fake is our pirate accents.
landmark: 2 vertical feather shaped banners flanking entry

name: Playa Info/VRT
description:
Look for the Blue "I" in the sky near center camp!
Providing Oracles, Digital Services, Lost and Found, ASL, Health Permits and BRC Lockout and Towing Services.
Open 9am-6pm daily with limited services 8 am-11am on Sept. 2

name: MOSP(Ministry of Special Permits)
description: If you need a permit for that special thing, and you cannot find the right department at BMO, come see us.  Or if you want some water, a hug, a place to put your feet up, or just a good story come on by...permit not required.

name: Burners Without Borders (BWB-BRC)
description:
Burners Without Borders is celebrating our 20th Anniversary!
Our camp in Black Rock City (BWB-BRC) is a physical manifestation of our mission and community. We seek to bring together do-ers, makers, and change agents who bring the 10 principles to life beyond the orange trash fence. We do this by hosting a speaker series, a maker space, evening conversations around the fire-pit and supporting the participant-facing BRC sustainability teams like BLAST, RAT, and the Green Corridor.
landmark: Two Story Towers with large wings on top + flags.

name: FERN
description: FERN is the home of the RAMPART medical staff.

name: ESD Rampart
description: Rampart is the main medical clinic staffed by  licensed medical professionals able to provide advanced care to the entire community. Doctors, nurses, paramedics, x-ray techs, lab techs and pharmacists on staff 24/7 along with ambulances and aircraft provide care at the highest level under permit from the State of Nevada.
landmark: Look for the RED Cross on the Esplanade @ 5:15

name: ESD Station 3:00
description: ESD Station 3 supports the Medical station at 3 & C, it is also the home to the Black Rock City Fire Department. For 25 Years "Fire Camp" has been the playa home for ourESD Fire, HazMat, Tech Rescue and medical volunteers.

name: BLACK ROCK ADVENTURES BUS STOP!
description: Providing accessible Playa tours in our adventure rig, with room for about 10 - 13 Burners, leaving from our BUS STOP! art installation on the Playa. Tours go daily at 9am, return you to the BUS STOP! and last about 2hrs. Or meet us at camp prior to the tour! Contact us for info about special tours and pick ups/drop offs. If you are interested in camping with us or driving tours please contact us. To find our camp - look for tall grey feather flags with a big " ! "on them! or check the website for our location closer to the Burn. Come ride with us!
